imgui.h
1// dear imgui, v1.92.0 WIP
2// (headers)
3
4// Help:
5// - See links below.
6// - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in imgui_demo.cpp. All applications in examples/ are doing that.
7// - Read top of imgui.cpp for more details, links and comments.
8// - Add '#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS' before including this file (or in imconfig.h) to access courtesy maths
9// operators for ImVec2 and ImVec4.
10
11// Resources:
12// - FAQ ........................ https://dearimgui.com/faq (in repository as docs/FAQ.md)
13// - Homepage ................... https://github.com/ocornut/imgui
14// - Releases & changelog ....... https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/releases
15// - Gallery .................... https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues?q=label%3Agallery (please post your
16// screenshots/video there!)
17// - Wiki ....................... https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki (lots of good stuff there)
18// - Getting Started https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Getting-Started (how to integrate in an existing
19// app by adding ~25 lines of code)
20// - Third-party Extensions https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Useful-Extensions (ImPlot & many more)
21// - Bindings/Backends https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Bindings (language bindings, backends for
22// various tech/engines)
23// - Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary
24// - Debug Tools https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Debug-Tools
25// - Software using Dear ImGui https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Software-using-dear-imgui
26// - Issues & support ........... https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues
27// - Test Engine & Automation ... https://github.com/ocornut/imgui_test_engine (test suite, test engine to automate your
28// apps)
29
30// For first-time users having issues compiling/linking/running/loading fonts:
31// please post in https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/discussions if you cannot find a solution in resources above.
32// Everything else should be asked in 'Issues'! We are building a database of cross-linked knowledge there.
33
34// Library Version
35// (Integer encoded as XYYZZ for use in #if preprocessor conditionals, e.g. '#if IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 12345')
36#define IMGUI_VERSION "1.92.0 WIP"
37#define IMGUI_VERSION_NUM 19192
38#define IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
39#define IMGUI_HAS_VIEWPORT // Viewport WIP branch
40#define IMGUI_HAS_DOCK // Docking WIP branch
41
42/*
43
44Index of this file:
45// [SECTION] Header mess
46// [SECTION] Forward declarations and basic types
47// [SECTION] Texture identifier (ImTextureID)
48// [SECTION] Dear ImGui end-user API functions
49// [SECTION] Flags & Enumerations
50// [SECTION] Tables API flags and structures (ImGuiTableFlags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags, ImGuiTableRowFlags,
51ImGuiTableBgTarget, ImGuiTableSortSpecs, ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs)
52// [SECTION] Helpers: Debug log, Memory allocations macros, ImVector<>
53// [SECTION] ImGuiStyle
54// [SECTION] ImGuiIO
55// [SECTION] Misc data structures (ImGuiInputTextCallbackData, ImGuiSizeCallbackData, ImGuiWindowClass, ImGuiPayload)
56// [SECTION] Helpers (ImGuiOnceUponAFrame, ImGuiTextFilter, ImGuiTextBuffer, ImGuiStorage, ImGuiListClipper, Math
57Operators, ImColor)
58// [SECTION] Multi-Select API flags and structures (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags, ImGuiMultiSelectIO, ImGuiSelectionRequest,
59ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage, ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage)
60// [SECTION] Drawing API (ImDrawCallback, ImDrawCmd, ImDrawIdx, ImDrawVert, ImDrawChannel, ImDrawListSplitter,
61ImDrawFlags, ImDrawListFlags, ImDrawList, ImDrawData)
62// [SECTION] Font API (ImFontConfig, ImFontGlyph, ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder, ImFontAtlasFlags, ImFontAtlas, ImFont)
63// [SECTION] Viewports (ImGuiViewportFlags, ImGuiViewport)
64// [SECTION] ImGuiPlatformIO + other Platform Dependent Interfaces (ImGuiPlatformMonitor, ImGuiPlatformImeData)
65// [SECTION] Obsolete functions and types
66
67*/
68
69#pragma once
70
71// Configuration file with compile-time options
72// (edit imconfig.h or '#define IMGUI_USER_CONFIG "myfilename.h" from your build system)
73#ifdef IMGUI_USER_CONFIG
74#include IMGUI_USER_CONFIG
75#endif
76#include "external/imconfig.h"
77
78#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
79
80//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
81// [SECTION] Header mess
82//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
83
84// Includes
85#include <float.h> // FLT_MIN, FLT_MAX
86#include <stdarg.h> // va_list, va_start, va_end
87#include <stddef.h> // ptrdiff_t, NULL
88#include <string.h> // memset, memmove, memcpy, strlen, strchr, strcpy, strcmp
89
90// Define attributes of all API symbols declarations (e.g. for DLL under Windows)
91// IMGUI_API is used for core imgui functions, IMGUI_IMPL_API is used for the default backends files (imgui_impl_xxx.h)
92// Using dear imgui via a shared library is not recommended: we don't guarantee backward nor forward ABI compatibility +
93// this is a call-heavy library and function call overhead adds up.
94#ifndef IMGUI_API
95#define IMGUI_API
96#endif
97#ifndef IMGUI_IMPL_API
98#define IMGUI_IMPL_API IMGUI_API
99#endif
100
101// Helper Macros
102#ifndef IM_ASSERT
103#include <assert.h>
104#define IM_ASSERT(_EXPR) assert(_EXPR) // You can override the default assert handler by editing imconfig.h
105#endif
106#define IM_ARRAYSIZE(_ARR) \
107 ((int)(sizeof(_ARR) / sizeof(*(_ARR)))) // Size of a static C-style array. Don't use on pointers!
108#define IM_UNUSED(_VAR) \
109 ((void)(_VAR)) // Used to silence "unused variable warnings". Often useful as asserts may be stripped out from final
110 // builds.
111
112// Check that version and structures layouts are matching between compiled imgui code and caller. Read comments above
113// DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout() for details.
114#define IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() \
115 ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(IMGUI_VERSION, sizeof(ImGuiIO), sizeof(ImGuiStyle), sizeof(ImVec2), \
116 sizeof(ImVec4), sizeof(ImDrawVert), sizeof(ImDrawIdx))
117
118// Helper Macros - IM_FMTARGS, IM_FMTLIST: Apply printf-style warnings to our formatting functions.
119// (MSVC provides an equivalent mechanism via SAL Annotations but it would require the macros in a different
120// location. e.g. #include <sal.h> + void myprintf(_Printf_format_string_ const char* format, ...))
121#if !defined(IMGUI_USE_STB_SPRINTF) && defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__clang__)
122#define IM_FMTARGS(FMT) __attribute__((format(gnu_printf, FMT, FMT + 1)))
123#define IM_FMTLIST(FMT) __attribute__((format(gnu_printf, FMT, 0)))
124#elif !defined(IMGUI_USE_STB_SPRINTF) && (defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__))
125#define IM_FMTARGS(FMT) __attribute__((format(printf, FMT, FMT + 1)))
126#define IM_FMTLIST(FMT) __attribute__((format(printf, FMT, 0)))
127#else
128#define IM_FMTARGS(FMT)
129#define IM_FMTLIST(FMT)
130#endif
131
132// Disable some of MSVC most aggressive Debug runtime checks in function header/footer (used in some simple/low-level
133// functions)
134#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && !defined(IMGUI_DEBUG_PARANOID)
135#define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF \
136 __pragma(runtime_checks("", off)) __pragma(check_stack(off)) __pragma(strict_gs_check(push, off))
137#define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE \
138 __pragma(runtime_checks("", restore)) __pragma(check_stack()) __pragma(strict_gs_check(pop))
139#else
140#define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
141#define IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
142#endif
143
144// Warnings
145#ifdef _MSC_VER
146#pragma warning(push)
147#pragma warning( \
148 disable \
149 : 26495) // [Static Analyzer] Variable 'XXX' is uninitialized. Always initialize a member variable (type.6).
150#endif
151#if defined(__clang__)
152#pragma clang diagnostic push
153#if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option")
154#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
155#endif
156#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
157#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast" // warning: use of old-style cast
158#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating point with == or != is unsafe
159#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant" // warning: zero as null pointer constant
160#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wreserved-identifier" // warning: identifier '_Xxx' is reserved because it starts
161 // with '_' followed by a capital letter
162#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunsafe-buffer-usage" // warning: 'xxx' is an unsafe pointer used for buffer access
163#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wnontrivial-memaccess" // warning: first argument in call to 'memset' is a pointer to
164 // non-trivially copyable type
165#elif defined(__GNUC__)
166#pragma GCC diagnostic push
167#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas" // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind
168#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating-point with '==' or '!=' is unsafe
169#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored \
170 "-Wclass-memaccess" // [__GNUC__ >= 8] warning: 'memset/memcpy' clearing/writing an object of type 'xxxx' with no
171 // trivial copy-assignment; use assignment or value-initialization instead
172#endif
173
174//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
175// [SECTION] Forward declarations and basic types
176//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
177
178// Scalar data types
179typedef unsigned int ImGuiID; // A unique ID used by widgets (typically the result of hashing a stack of string)
180typedef signed char ImS8; // 8-bit signed integer
181typedef unsigned char ImU8; // 8-bit unsigned integer
182typedef signed short ImS16; // 16-bit signed integer
183typedef unsigned short ImU16; // 16-bit unsigned integer
184typedef signed int ImS32; // 32-bit signed integer == int
185typedef unsigned int ImU32; // 32-bit unsigned integer (often used to store packed colors)
186typedef signed long long ImS64; // 64-bit signed integer
187typedef unsigned long long ImU64; // 64-bit unsigned integer
188
189// Forward declarations: ImDrawList, ImFontAtlas layer
190struct ImDrawChannel; // Temporary storage to output draw commands out of order, used by ImDrawListSplitter and
191 // ImDrawList::ChannelsSplit()
192struct ImDrawCmd; // A single draw command within a parent ImDrawList (generally maps to 1 GPU draw call, unless it is a
193 // callback)
194struct ImDrawData; // All draw command lists required to render the frame + pos/size coordinates to use for the
195 // projection matrix.
196struct ImDrawList; // A single draw command list (generally one per window, conceptually you may see this as a dynamic
197 // "mesh" builder)
198struct ImDrawListSharedData; // Data shared among multiple draw lists (typically owned by parent ImGui context, but you
199 // may create one yourself)
200struct ImDrawListSplitter; // Helper to split a draw list into different layers which can be drawn into out of order,
201 // then flattened back.
202struct ImDrawVert; // A single vertex (pos + uv + col = 20 bytes by default. Override layout with
203 // IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT)
204struct ImFont; // Runtime data for a single font within a parent ImFontAtlas
205struct ImFontAtlas; // Runtime data for multiple fonts, bake multiple fonts into a single texture, TTF/OTF font loader
206struct ImFontBuilderIO; // Opaque interface to a font builder (stb_truetype or FreeType).
207struct ImFontConfig; // Configuration data when adding a font or merging fonts
208struct ImFontGlyph; // A single font glyph (code point + coordinates within in ImFontAtlas + offset)
209struct ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder; // Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data
210struct ImColor; // Helper functions to create a color that can be converted to either u32 or float4 (*OBSOLETE* please
211 // avoid using)
212
213// Forward declarations: ImGui layer
214struct ImGuiContext; // Dear ImGui context (opaque structure, unless including imgui_internal.h)
215struct ImGuiIO; // Main configuration and I/O between your application and ImGui (also see: ImGuiPlatformIO)
216struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData; // Shared state of InputText() when using custom ImGuiInputTextCallback
217 // (rare/advanced use)
218struct ImGuiKeyData; // Storage for ImGuiIO and IsKeyDown(), IsKeyPressed() etc functions.
219struct ImGuiListClipper; // Helper to manually clip large list of items
220struct ImGuiMultiSelectIO; // Structure to interact with a BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect() block
221struct ImGuiOnceUponAFrame; // Helper for running a block of code not more than once a frame
222struct ImGuiPayload; // User data payload for drag and drop operations
223struct ImGuiPlatformIO; // Interface between platform/renderer backends and ImGui (e.g. Clipboard, IME, Multi-Viewport
224 // support). Extends ImGuiIO.
225struct ImGuiPlatformImeData; // Platform IME data for io.PlatformSetImeDataFn() function.
226struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor; // Multi-viewport support: user-provided bounds for each connected monitor/display. Used
227 // when positioning popups and tooltips to avoid them straddling monitors
228struct ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage; // Optional helper to store multi-selection state + apply multi-selection requests.
229struct ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage; // Optional helper to apply multi-selection requests to existing randomly
230 // accessible storage.
231struct ImGuiSelectionRequest; // A selection request (stored in ImGuiMultiSelectIO)
232struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData; // Callback data when using SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() (rare/advanced use)
233struct ImGuiStorage; // Helper for key->value storage (container sorted by key)
234struct ImGuiStoragePair; // Helper for key->value storage (pair)
235struct ImGuiStyle; // Runtime data for styling/colors
236struct ImGuiTableSortSpecs; // Sorting specifications for a table (often handling sort specs for a single column,
237 // occasionally more)
238struct ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs; // Sorting specification for one column of a table
239struct ImGuiTextBuffer; // Helper to hold and append into a text buffer (~string builder)
240struct ImGuiTextFilter; // Helper to parse and apply text filters (e.g. "aaaaa[,bbbbb][,ccccc]")
241struct ImGuiViewport; // A Platform Window (always 1 unless multi-viewport are enabled. One per platform window to
242 // output to). In the future may represent Platform Monitor
243struct ImGuiWindowClass; // Window class (rare/advanced uses: provide hints to the platform backend via altered viewport
244 // flags and parent/child info)
245
246// Enumerations
247// - We don't use strongly typed enums much because they add constraints (can't extend in private code, can't store
248// typed in bit fields, extra casting on iteration)
249// - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _central column_ below to find the actual
250// flags/enum lists!
251// - In Visual Studio: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols inside comments, whereas CTRL+F12
252// ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
253// - In Visual Studio w/ Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols inside
254// comments.
255// - In VS Code, CLion, etc.: CTRL+click can follow symbols inside comments.
256enum ImGuiDir : int; // -> enum ImGuiDir // Enum: A cardinal direction (Left, Right, Up, Down)
257enum ImGuiKey : int; // -> enum ImGuiKey // Enum: A key identifier (ImGuiKey_XXX or ImGuiMod_XXX value)
258enum ImGuiMouseSource : int; // -> enum ImGuiMouseSource // Enum; A mouse input source identifier (Mouse,
259 // TouchScreen, Pen)
260enum ImGuiSortDirection : ImU8; // -> enum ImGuiSortDirection // Enum: A sorting direction (ascending or descending)
261typedef int ImGuiCol; // -> enum ImGuiCol_ // Enum: A color identifier for styling
262typedef int ImGuiCond; // -> enum ImGuiCond_ // Enum: A condition for many Set*() functions
263typedef int ImGuiDataType; // -> enum ImGuiDataType_ // Enum: A primary data type
264typedef int
265 ImGuiMouseButton; // -> enum ImGuiMouseButton_ // Enum: A mouse button identifier (0=left, 1=right, 2=middle)
266typedef int ImGuiMouseCursor; // -> enum ImGuiMouseCursor_ // Enum: A mouse cursor shape
267typedef int ImGuiStyleVar; // -> enum ImGuiStyleVar_ // Enum: A variable identifier for styling
268typedef int ImGuiTableBgTarget; // -> enum ImGuiTableBgTarget_ // Enum: A color target for TableSetBgColor()
269
270// Flags (declared as int to allow using as flags without overhead, and to not pollute the top of this file)
271// - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _central column_ below to find the actual
272// flags/enum lists!
273// - In Visual Studio: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols inside comments, whereas CTRL+F12
274// ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
275// - In Visual Studio w/ Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols inside
276// comments.
277// - In VS Code, CLion, etc.: CTRL+click can follow symbols inside comments.
278typedef int ImDrawFlags; // -> enum ImDrawFlags_ // Flags: for ImDrawList functions
279typedef int ImDrawListFlags; // -> enum ImDrawListFlags_ // Flags: for ImDrawList instance
280typedef int ImFontAtlasFlags; // -> enum ImFontAtlasFlags_ // Flags: for ImFontAtlas build
281typedef int ImGuiBackendFlags; // -> enum ImGuiBackendFlags_ // Flags: for io.BackendFlags
282typedef int ImGuiButtonFlags; // -> enum ImGuiButtonFlags_ // Flags: for InvisibleButton()
283typedef int ImGuiChildFlags; // -> enum ImGuiChildFlags_ // Flags: for BeginChild()
284typedef int ImGuiColorEditFlags; // -> enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_ // Flags: for ColorEdit4(), ColorPicker4() etc.
285typedef int ImGuiConfigFlags; // -> enum ImGuiConfigFlags_ // Flags: for io.ConfigFlags
286typedef int ImGuiComboFlags; // -> enum ImGuiComboFlags_ // Flags: for BeginCombo()
287typedef int ImGuiDockNodeFlags; // -> enum ImGuiDockNodeFlags_ // Flags: for DockSpace()
288typedef int
289 ImGuiDragDropFlags; // -> enum ImGuiDragDropFlags_ // Flags: for BeginDragDropSource(), AcceptDragDropPayload()
290typedef int ImGuiFocusedFlags; // -> enum ImGuiFocusedFlags_ // Flags: for IsWindowFocused()
291typedef int ImGuiHoveredFlags; // -> enum ImGuiHoveredFlags_ // Flags: for IsItemHovered(), IsWindowHovered() etc.
292typedef int ImGuiInputFlags; // -> enum ImGuiInputFlags_ // Flags: for Shortcut(), SetNextItemShortcut()
293typedef int ImGuiInputTextFlags; // -> enum ImGuiInputTextFlags_ // Flags: for InputText(), InputTextMultiline()
294typedef int ImGuiItemFlags; // -> enum ImGuiItemFlags_ // Flags: for PushItemFlag(), shared by all items
295typedef int ImGuiKeyChord; // -> ImGuiKey | ImGuiMod_XXX // Flags: for IsKeyChordPressed(), Shortcut() etc. an
296 // ImGuiKey optionally OR-ed with one or more ImGuiMod_XXX values.
297typedef int
298 ImGuiPopupFlags; // -> enum ImGuiPopupFlags_ // Flags: for OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(), IsPopupOpen()
299typedef int ImGuiMultiSelectFlags; // -> enum ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_// Flags: for BeginMultiSelect()
300typedef int ImGuiSelectableFlags; // -> enum ImGuiSelectableFlags_ // Flags: for Selectable()
301typedef int ImGuiSliderFlags; // -> enum ImGuiSliderFlags_ // Flags: for DragFloat(), DragInt(), SliderFloat(),
302 // SliderInt() etc.
303typedef int ImGuiTabBarFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTabBarFlags_ // Flags: for BeginTabBar()
304typedef int ImGuiTabItemFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTabItemFlags_ // Flags: for BeginTabItem()
305typedef int ImGuiTableFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTableFlags_ // Flags: For BeginTable()
306typedef int ImGuiTableColumnFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTableColumnFlags_// Flags: For TableSetupColumn()
307typedef int ImGuiTableRowFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTableRowFlags_ // Flags: For TableNextRow()
308typedef int
309 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ // Flags: for TreeNode(), TreeNodeEx(), CollapsingHeader()
310typedef int ImGuiViewportFlags; // -> enum ImGuiViewportFlags_ // Flags: for ImGuiViewport
311typedef int ImGuiWindowFlags; // -> enum ImGuiWindowFlags_ // Flags: for Begin(), BeginChild()
312
313// Character types
314// (we generally use UTF-8 encoded string in the API. This is storage specifically for a decoded character used for
315// keyboard input and display)
316typedef unsigned int
317 ImWchar32; // A single decoded U32 character/code point. We encode them as multi bytes UTF-8 when used in strings.
318typedef unsigned short
319 ImWchar16; // A single decoded U16 character/code point. We encode them as multi bytes UTF-8 when used in strings.
320#ifdef IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32 // ImWchar [configurable type: override in imconfig.h with '#define IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32' to
321 // support Unicode planes 1-16]
322typedef ImWchar32 ImWchar;
323#else
324typedef ImWchar16 ImWchar;
325#endif
326
327// Multi-Selection item index or identifier when using BeginMultiSelect()
328// - Used by SetNextItemSelectionUserData() + and inside ImGuiMultiSelectIO structure.
329// - Most users are likely to use this store an item INDEX but this may be used to store a POINTER/ID as well. Read
330// comments near ImGuiMultiSelectIO for details.
331typedef ImS64 ImGuiSelectionUserData;
332
333// Callback and functions types
334typedef int (*ImGuiInputTextCallback)(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData *data); // Callback function for ImGui::InputText()
335typedef void (*ImGuiSizeCallback)(
336 ImGuiSizeCallbackData *data); // Callback function for ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints()
337typedef void *(*ImGuiMemAllocFunc)(size_t sz, void *user_data); // Function signature for ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions()
338typedef void (*ImGuiMemFreeFunc)(void *ptr, void *user_data); // Function signature for ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions()
339
340// ImVec2: 2D vector used to store positions, sizes etc. [Compile-time configurable type]
341// - This is a frequently used type in the API. Consider using IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA to create implicit cast from/to our
342// preferred type.
343// - Add '#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS' before including this file (or in imconfig.h) to access courtesy maths
344// operators for ImVec2 and ImVec4.
345IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
346struct ImVec2
347{
348 float x, y;
349 constexpr ImVec2() : x(0.0f), y(0.0f)
350 {
351 }
352 constexpr ImVec2(float _x, float _y) : x(_x), y(_y)
353 {
354 }
355 float &operator[](size_t idx)
356 {
357 IM_ASSERT(idx == 0 || idx == 1);
358 return ((float *)(void *)(char *)this)[idx];
359 } // We very rarely use this [] operator, so the assert overhead is fine.
360 float operator[](size_t idx) const
361 {
362 IM_ASSERT(idx == 0 || idx == 1);
363 return ((const float *)(const void *)(const char *)this)[idx];
364 }
365#ifdef IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA
366 IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA // Define additional constructors and implicit cast operators in imconfig.h to convert back and
367 // forth between your math types and ImVec2.
368#endif
369};
370
371// ImVec4: 4D vector used to store clipping rectangles, colors etc. [Compile-time configurable type]
372struct ImVec4
373{
374 float x, y, z, w;
375 constexpr ImVec4() : x(0.0f), y(0.0f), z(0.0f), w(0.0f)
376 {
377 }
378 constexpr ImVec4(float _x, float _y, float _z, float _w) : x(_x), y(_y), z(_z), w(_w)
379 {
380 }
381#ifdef IM_VEC4_CLASS_EXTRA
382 IM_VEC4_CLASS_EXTRA // Define additional constructors and implicit cast operators in imconfig.h to convert back and
383 // forth between your math types and ImVec4.
384#endif
385};
386IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
387
388//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
389// [SECTION] Texture identifier (ImTextureID)
390//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
391
392// ImTexture: user data for renderer backend to identify a texture [Compile-time configurable type]
393// - To use something else than an opaque void* pointer: override with e.g. '#define ImTextureID MyTextureType*' in your
394// imconfig.h file.
395// - This can be whatever to you want it to be! read the FAQ about ImTextureID for details.
396// - You can make this a structure with various constructors if you need. You will have to implement ==/!= operators.
397// - (note: before v1.91.4 (2024/10/08) the default type for ImTextureID was void*. Use intermediary intptr_t cast and
398// read FAQ if you have casting warnings)
399#ifndef ImTextureID
400typedef ImU64 ImTextureID; // Default: store a pointer or an integer fitting in a pointer (most renderer backends are ok
401 // with that)
402#endif
403
404//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
405// [SECTION] Dear ImGui end-user API functions
406// (Note that ImGui:: being a namespace, you can add extra ImGui:: functions in your own separate file. Please don't
407// modify imgui source files!)
408//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
409
410namespace ImGui
411{
412// Context creation and access
413// - Each context create its own ImFontAtlas by default. You may instance one yourself and pass it to CreateContext() to
414// share a font atlas between contexts.
415// - DLL users: heaps and globals are not shared across DLL boundaries! You will need to call SetCurrentContext() +
416// SetAllocatorFunctions()
417// for each static/DLL boundary you are calling from. Read "Context and Memory Allocators" section of imgui.cpp for
418// details.
419IMGUI_API ImGuiContext *CreateContext(ImFontAtlas *shared_font_atlas = NULL);
420IMGUI_API void DestroyContext(ImGuiContext *ctx = NULL); // NULL = destroy current context
421IMGUI_API ImGuiContext *GetCurrentContext();
422IMGUI_API void SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext *ctx);
423
424// Main
425IMGUI_API ImGuiIO &GetIO(); // access the ImGuiIO structure (mouse/keyboard/gamepad inputs, time, various configuration
426 // options/flags)
427IMGUI_API ImGuiPlatformIO &GetPlatformIO(); // access the ImGuiPlatformIO structure (mostly hooks/functions to connect
428 // to platform/renderer and OS Clipboard, IME etc.)
429IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle &GetStyle(); // access the Style structure (colors, sizes). Always use PushStyleColor(),
430 // PushStyleVar() to modify style mid-frame!
431IMGUI_API void NewFrame(); // start a new Dear ImGui frame, you can submit any command from this point until
432 // Render()/EndFrame().
433IMGUI_API void EndFrame(); // ends the Dear ImGui frame. automatically called by Render(). If you don't need to render
434 // data (skipping rendering) you may call EndFrame() without Render()... but you'll have
435 // wasted CPU already! If you don't need to render, better to not create any windows and not
436 // call NewFrame() at all!
437IMGUI_API void Render(); // ends the Dear ImGui frame, finalize the draw data. You can then get call GetDrawData().
438IMGUI_API ImDrawData *GetDrawData(); // valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame(). this is what you
439 // have to render.
440
441// Demo, Debug, Information
442IMGUI_API void ShowDemoWindow(
443 bool *p_open = NULL); // create Demo window. demonstrate most ImGui features. call this to learn about the library!
444 // try to make it always available in your application!
445IMGUI_API void ShowMetricsWindow(bool *p_open = NULL); // create Metrics/Debugger window. display Dear ImGui internals:
446 // windows, draw commands, various internal state, etc.
447IMGUI_API void ShowDebugLogWindow(
448 bool *p_open = NULL); // create Debug Log window. display a simplified log of important dear imgui events.
449IMGUI_API void ShowIDStackToolWindow(bool *p_open = NULL); // create Stack Tool window. hover items with mouse to query
450 // information about the source of their unique ID.
451IMGUI_API void ShowAboutWindow(
452 bool *p_open = NULL); // create About window. display Dear ImGui version, credits and build/system information.
453IMGUI_API void ShowStyleEditor(
454 ImGuiStyle *ref = NULL); // add style editor block (not a window). you can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure
455 // to compare to, revert to and save to (else it uses the default style)
456IMGUI_API bool ShowStyleSelector(
457 const char *label); // add style selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the default styles.
458IMGUI_API void ShowFontSelector(
459 const char *label); // add font selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the loaded fonts.
460IMGUI_API void ShowUserGuide(); // add basic help/info block (not a window): how to manipulate ImGui as an end-user
461 // (mouse/keyboard controls).
462IMGUI_API const char *GetVersion(); // get the compiled version string e.g. "1.80 WIP" (essentially the value for
463 // IMGUI_VERSION from the compiled version of imgui.cpp)
464
465// Styles
466IMGUI_API void StyleColorsDark(ImGuiStyle *dst = NULL); // new, recommended style (default)
467IMGUI_API void StyleColorsLight(ImGuiStyle *dst = NULL); // best used with borders and a custom, thicker font
468IMGUI_API void StyleColorsClassic(ImGuiStyle *dst = NULL); // classic imgui style
469
470// Windows
471// - Begin() = push window to the stack and start appending to it. End() = pop window from the stack.
472// - Passing 'bool* p_open != NULL' shows a window-closing widget in the upper-right corner of the window,
473// which clicking will set the boolean to false when clicked.
474// - You may append multiple times to the same window during the same frame by calling Begin()/End() pairs multiple
475// times.
476// Some information such as 'flags' or 'p_open' will only be considered by the first call to Begin().
477// - Begin() return false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting
478// anything to the window. Always call a matching End() for each Begin() call, regardless of its return value!
479// [Important: due to legacy reason, Begin/End and BeginChild/EndChild are inconsistent with all other functions
480// such as BeginMenu/EndMenu, BeginPopup/EndPopup, etc. where the EndXXX call should only be called if the
481// corresponding BeginXXX function returned true. Begin and BeginChild are the only odd ones out. Will be fixed in a
482// future update.]
483// - Note that the bottom of window stack always contains a window called "Debug".
484IMGUI_API bool Begin(const char *name, bool *p_open = NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0);
485IMGUI_API void End();
486
487// Child Windows
488// - Use child windows to begin into a self-contained independent scrolling/clipping regions within a host window. Child
489// windows can embed their own child.
490// - Before 1.90 (November 2023), the "ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = 0" parameter was "bool border = false".
491// This API is backward compatible with old code, as we guarantee that ImGuiChildFlags_Borders == true.
492// Consider updating your old code:
493// BeginChild("Name", size, false) -> Begin("Name", size, 0); or Begin("Name", size, ImGuiChildFlags_None);
494// BeginChild("Name", size, true) -> Begin("Name", size, ImGuiChildFlags_Borders);
495// - Manual sizing (each axis can use a different setting e.g. ImVec2(0.0f, 400.0f)):
496// == 0.0f: use remaining parent window size for this axis.
497// > 0.0f: use specified size for this axis.
498// < 0.0f: right/bottom-align to specified distance from available content boundaries.
499// - Specifying ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeX or ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeY makes the sizing automatic based on child
500// contents.
501// Combining both ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeX _and_ ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeY defeats purpose of a scrolling region
502// and is NOT recommended.
503// - BeginChild() returns false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit
504// submitting
505// anything to the window. Always call a matching EndChild() for each BeginChild() call, regardless of its return
506// value. [Important: due to legacy reason, Begin/End and BeginChild/EndChild are inconsistent with all other
507// functions
508// such as BeginMenu/EndMenu, BeginPopup/EndPopup, etc. where the EndXXX call should only be called if the
509// corresponding BeginXXX function returned true. Begin and BeginChild are the only odd ones out. Will be fixed in a
510// future update.]
511IMGUI_API bool BeginChild(const char *str_id, const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = 0,
512 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0);
513IMGUI_API bool BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = 0,
514 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0);
515IMGUI_API void EndChild();
516
517// Windows Utilities
518// - 'current window' = the window we are appending into while inside a Begin()/End() block. 'next window' = next window
519// we will Begin() into.
520IMGUI_API bool IsWindowAppearing();
521IMGUI_API bool IsWindowCollapsed();
522IMGUI_API bool IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags = 0); // is current window focused? or its root/child, depending
523 // on flags. see flags for options.
524IMGUI_API bool IsWindowHovered(
525 ImGuiHoveredFlags flags =
526 0); // is current window hovered and hoverable (e.g. not blocked by a popup/modal)? See ImGuiHoveredFlags_ for
527 // options. IMPORTANT: If you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to Dear ImGui or
528 // to your underlying app, you should not use this function! Use the 'io.WantCaptureMouse' boolean for that!
529 // Refer to FAQ entry "How can I tell whether to dispatch mouse/keyboard to Dear ImGui or my application?"
530 // for details.
531IMGUI_API ImDrawList *GetWindowDrawList(); // get draw list associated to the current window, to append your own drawing
532 // primitives
533IMGUI_API float GetWindowDpiScale(); // get DPI scale currently associated to the current window's viewport.
534IMGUI_API ImVec2
535GetWindowPos(); // get current window position in screen space (IT IS UNLIKELY YOU EVER NEED TO USE THIS. Consider
536 // always using GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail() instead)
537IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowSize(); // get current window size (IT IS UNLIKELY YOU EVER NEED TO USE THIS. Consider always
538 // using GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail() instead)
539IMGUI_API float GetWindowWidth(); // get current window width (IT IS UNLIKELY YOU EVER NEED TO USE THIS). Shortcut for
540 // GetWindowSize().x.
541IMGUI_API float GetWindowHeight(); // get current window height (IT IS UNLIKELY YOU EVER NEED TO USE THIS). Shortcut for
542 // GetWindowSize().y.
543IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport *GetWindowViewport(); // get viewport currently associated to the current window.
544
545// Window manipulation
546// - Prefer using SetNextXXX functions (before Begin) rather that SetXXX functions (after Begin).
547IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowPos(
548 const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0,
549 const ImVec2 &pivot = ImVec2(
550 0, 0)); // set next window position. call before Begin(). use pivot=(0.5f,0.5f) to center on given point, etc.
551IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2 &size,
552 ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on
553 // this axis. call before Begin()
554IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(
555 const ImVec2 &size_min, const ImVec2 &size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback = NULL,
556 void *custom_callback_data =
557 NULL); // set next window size limits. use 0.0f or FLT_MAX if you don't want limits. Use -1 for both min and max
558 // of same axis to preserve current size (which itself is a constraint). Use callback to apply
559 // non-trivial programmatic constraints.
560IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowContentSize(
561 const ImVec2 &size); // set next window content size (~ scrollable client area, which enforce the range of
562 // scrollbars). Not including window decorations (title bar, menu bar, etc.) nor WindowPadding.
563 // set an axis to 0.0f to leave it automatic. call before Begin()
564IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed,
565 ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window collapsed state. call before Begin()
566IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowFocus(); // set next window to be focused / top-most. call before Begin()
567IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowScroll(
568 const ImVec2 &scroll); // set next window scrolling value (use < 0.0f to not affect a given axis).
569IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowBgAlpha(
570 float alpha); // set next window background color alpha. helper to easily override the Alpha component of
571 // ImGuiCol_WindowBg/ChildBg/PopupBg. you may also use ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground.
572IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowViewport(ImGuiID viewport_id); // set next window viewport
573IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(
574 const ImVec2 &pos,
575 ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window position - call within Begin()/End(). prefer using
576 // SetNextWindowPos(), as this may incur tearing and side-effects.
577IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(
578 const ImVec2 &size,
579 ImGuiCond cond =
580 0); // (not recommended) set current window size - call within Begin()/End(). set to ImVec2(0, 0) to force an
581 // auto-fit. prefer using SetNextWindowSize(), as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects.
582IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(
583 bool collapsed,
584 ImGuiCond cond = 0); // (not recommended) set current window collapsed state. prefer using SetNextWindowCollapsed().
585IMGUI_API void SetWindowFocus(); // (not recommended) set current window to be focused / top-most. prefer using
586 // SetNextWindowFocus().
587IMGUI_API void SetWindowFontScale(float scale); // [OBSOLETE] set font scale. Adjust IO.FontGlobalScale if you want to
588 // scale all windows. This is an old API! For correct scaling, prefer to
589 // reload font + rebuild ImFontAtlas + call style.ScaleAllSizes().
590IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(const char *name, const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window position.
591IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(
592 const char *name, const ImVec2 &size,
593 ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis.
594IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(const char *name, bool collapsed,
595 ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set named window collapsed state
596IMGUI_API void SetWindowFocus(const char *name); // set named window to be focused / top-most. use NULL to remove focus.
597
598// Windows Scrolling
599// - Any change of Scroll will be applied at the beginning of next frame in the first call to Begin().
600// - You may instead use SetNextWindowScroll() prior to calling Begin() to avoid this delay, as an alternative to using
601// SetScrollX()/SetScrollY().
602IMGUI_API float GetScrollX(); // get scrolling amount [0 .. GetScrollMaxX()]
603IMGUI_API float GetScrollY(); // get scrolling amount [0 .. GetScrollMaxY()]
604IMGUI_API void SetScrollX(float scroll_x); // set scrolling amount [0 .. GetScrollMaxX()]
605IMGUI_API void SetScrollY(float scroll_y); // set scrolling amount [0 .. GetScrollMaxY()]
606IMGUI_API float GetScrollMaxX(); // get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.x - WindowSize.x - DecorationsSize.x
607IMGUI_API float GetScrollMaxY(); // get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.y - WindowSize.y - DecorationsSize.y
608IMGUI_API void SetScrollHereX(
609 float center_x_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible.
610 // center_x_ratio=0.0: left, 0.5: center, 1.0: right. When using to make a
611 // "default/current item" visible, consider using SetItemDefaultFocus() instead.
612IMGUI_API void SetScrollHereY(
613 float center_y_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible.
614 // center_y_ratio=0.0: top, 0.5: center, 1.0: bottom. When using to make a
615 // "default/current item" visible, consider using SetItemDefaultFocus() instead.
616IMGUI_API void SetScrollFromPosX(
617 float local_x, float center_x_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible. Generally
618 // GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.
619IMGUI_API void SetScrollFromPosY(
620 float local_y, float center_y_ratio = 0.5f); // adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible. Generally
621 // GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.
622
623// Parameters stacks (shared)
624IMGUI_API void PushFont(ImFont *font); // use NULL as a shortcut to push default font
625IMGUI_API void PopFont();
626IMGUI_API void PushStyleColor(
627 ImGuiCol idx, ImU32 col); // modify a style color. always use this if you modify the style after NewFrame().
628IMGUI_API void PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, const ImVec4 &col);
629IMGUI_API void PopStyleColor(int count = 1);
630IMGUI_API void PushStyleVar(
631 ImGuiStyleVar idx,
632 float val); // modify a style float variable. always use this if you modify the style after NewFrame()!
633IMGUI_API void PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, const ImVec2 &val); // modify a style ImVec2 variable. "
634IMGUI_API void PushStyleVarX(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float val_x); // modify X component of a style ImVec2 variable. "
635IMGUI_API void PushStyleVarY(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float val_y); // modify Y component of a style ImVec2 variable. "
636IMGUI_API void PopStyleVar(int count = 1);
637IMGUI_API void PushItemFlag(
638 ImGuiItemFlags option,
639 bool enabled); // modify specified shared item flag, e.g. PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, true)
640IMGUI_API void PopItemFlag();
641
642// Parameters stacks (current window)
643IMGUI_API void PushItemWidth(
644 float item_width); // push width of items for common large "item+label" widgets. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align
645 // xx pixels to the right of window (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side).
646IMGUI_API void PopItemWidth();
647IMGUI_API void SetNextItemWidth(
648 float item_width); // set width of the _next_ common large "item+label" widget. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align
649 // xx pixels to the right of window (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side)
650IMGUI_API float CalcItemWidth(); // width of item given pushed settings and current cursor position. NOT necessarily the
651 // width of last item unlike most 'Item' functions.
652IMGUI_API void PushTextWrapPos(
653 float wrap_local_pos_x =
654 0.0f); // push word-wrapping position for Text*() commands. < 0.0f: no wrapping; 0.0f: wrap to end of window (or
655 // column); > 0.0f: wrap at 'wrap_pos_x' position in window local space
656IMGUI_API void PopTextWrapPos();
657
658// Style read access
659// - Use the ShowStyleEditor() function to interactively see/edit the colors.
660IMGUI_API ImFont *GetFont(); // get current font
661IMGUI_API float GetFontSize(); // get current font size (= height in pixels) of current font with current scale applied
662IMGUI_API ImVec2
663GetFontTexUvWhitePixel(); // get UV coordinate for a white pixel, useful to draw custom shapes via the ImDrawList API
664IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(
665 ImGuiCol idx, float alpha_mul = 1.0f); // retrieve given style color with style alpha applied and optional extra
666 // alpha multiplier, packed as a 32-bit value suitable for ImDrawList
667IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(const ImVec4 &col); // retrieve given color with style alpha applied, packed as a 32-bit
668 // value suitable for ImDrawList
669IMGUI_API ImU32 GetColorU32(ImU32 col, float alpha_mul = 1.0f); // retrieve given color with style alpha applied, packed
670 // as a 32-bit value suitable for ImDrawList
671IMGUI_API const ImVec4 &GetStyleColorVec4(
672 ImGuiCol idx); // retrieve style color as stored in ImGuiStyle structure. use to feed back into PushStyleColor(),
673 // otherwise use GetColorU32() to get style color with style alpha baked in.
674
675// Layout cursor positioning
676// - By "cursor" we mean the current output position.
677// - The typical widget behavior is to output themselves at the current cursor position, then move the cursor one line
678// down.
679// - You can call SameLine() between widgets to undo the last carriage return and output at the right of the preceding
680// widget.
681// - YOU CAN DO 99% OF WHAT YOU NEED WITH ONLY GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail().
682// - Attention! We currently have inconsistencies between window-local and absolute positions we will aim to fix with
683// future API:
684// - Absolute coordinate: GetCursorScreenPos(), SetCursorScreenPos(), all ImDrawList:: functions. -> this is
685// the preferred way forward.
686// - Window-local coordinates: SameLine(offset), GetCursorPos(), SetCursorPos(), GetCursorStartPos(),
687// PushTextWrapPos()
688// - Window-local coordinates: GetContentRegionMax(), GetWindowContentRegionMin(), GetWindowContentRegionMax() -->
689// all obsoleted. YOU DON'T NEED THEM.
690// - GetCursorScreenPos() = GetCursorPos() + GetWindowPos(). GetWindowPos() is almost only ever useful to convert from
691// window-local to absolute coordinates. Try not to use it.
692IMGUI_API ImVec2
693GetCursorScreenPos(); // cursor position, absolute coordinates. THIS IS YOUR BEST FRIEND (prefer using this rather than
694 // GetCursorPos(), also more useful to work with ImDrawList API).
695IMGUI_API void SetCursorScreenPos(
696 const ImVec2 &pos); // cursor position, absolute coordinates. THIS IS YOUR BEST FRIEND.
697IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetContentRegionAvail(); // available space from current position. THIS IS YOUR BEST FRIEND.
698IMGUI_API ImVec2
699GetCursorPos(); // [window-local] cursor position in window-local coordinates. This is not your best friend.
700IMGUI_API float GetCursorPosX(); // [window-local] "
701IMGUI_API float GetCursorPosY(); // [window-local] "
702IMGUI_API void SetCursorPos(const ImVec2 &local_pos); // [window-local] "
703IMGUI_API void SetCursorPosX(float local_x); // [window-local] "
704IMGUI_API void SetCursorPosY(float local_y); // [window-local] "
705IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetCursorStartPos(); // [window-local] initial cursor position, in window-local coordinates. Call
706 // GetCursorScreenPos() after Begin() to get the absolute coordinates version.
707
708// Other layout functions
709IMGUI_API void Separator(); // separator, generally horizontal. inside a menu bar or in horizontal layout mode, this
710 // becomes a vertical separator.
711IMGUI_API void SameLine(float offset_from_start_x = 0.0f,
712 float spacing = -1.0f); // call between widgets or groups to layout them horizontally. X
713 // position given in window coordinates.
714IMGUI_API void NewLine(); // undo a SameLine() or force a new line when in a horizontal-layout context.
715IMGUI_API void Spacing(); // add vertical spacing.
716IMGUI_API void Dummy(const ImVec2 &size); // add a dummy item of given size. unlike InvisibleButton(), Dummy() won't
717 // take the mouse click or be navigable into.
718IMGUI_API void Indent(float indent_w = 0.0f); // move content position toward the right, by indent_w, or
719 // style.IndentSpacing if indent_w <= 0
720IMGUI_API void Unindent(float indent_w = 0.0f); // move content position back to the left, by indent_w, or
721 // style.IndentSpacing if indent_w <= 0
722IMGUI_API void BeginGroup(); // lock horizontal starting position
723IMGUI_API void EndGroup(); // unlock horizontal starting position + capture the whole group bounding box into one "item"
724 // (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group,
725 // etc.)
726IMGUI_API void AlignTextToFramePadding(); // vertically align upcoming text baseline to FramePadding.y so that it will
727 // align properly to regularly framed items (call if you have text on a line
728 // before a framed item)
729IMGUI_API float GetTextLineHeight(); // ~ FontSize
730IMGUI_API float GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing(); // ~ FontSize + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2
731 // consecutive lines of text)
732IMGUI_API float GetFrameHeight(); // ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2
733IMGUI_API float GetFrameHeightWithSpacing(); // ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2 + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in
734 // pixels between 2 consecutive lines of framed widgets)
735
736// ID stack/scopes
737// Read the FAQ (docs/FAQ.md or http://dearimgui.com/faq) for more details about how ID are handled in dear imgui.
738// - Those questions are answered and impacted by understanding of the ID stack system:
739// - "Q: Why is my widget not reacting when I click on it?"
740// - "Q: How can I have widgets with an empty label?"
741// - "Q: How can I have multiple widgets with the same label?"
742// - Short version: ID are hashes of the entire ID stack. If you are creating widgets in a loop you most likely
743// want to push a unique identifier (e.g. object pointer, loop index) to uniquely differentiate them.
744// - You can also use the "Label##foobar" syntax within widget label to distinguish them from each others.
745// - In this header file we use the "label"/"name" terminology to denote a string that will be displayed + used as an
746// ID,
747// whereas "str_id" denote a string that is only used as an ID and not normally displayed.
748IMGUI_API void PushID(const char *str_id); // push string into the ID stack (will hash string).
749IMGUI_API void PushID(const char *str_id_begin,
750 const char *str_id_end); // push string into the ID stack (will hash string).
751IMGUI_API void PushID(const void *ptr_id); // push pointer into the ID stack (will hash pointer).
752IMGUI_API void PushID(int int_id); // push integer into the ID stack (will hash integer).
753IMGUI_API void PopID(); // pop from the ID stack.
754IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const char *str_id); // calculate unique ID (hash of whole ID stack + given parameter). e.g. if
755 // you want to query into ImGuiStorage yourself
756IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const char *str_id_begin, const char *str_id_end);
757IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(const void *ptr_id);
758IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetID(int int_id);
759
760// Widgets: Text
761IMGUI_API void TextUnformatted(
762 const char *text,
763 const char *text_end = NULL); // raw text without formatting. Roughly equivalent to Text("%s", text) but: A) doesn't
764 // require null terminated string if 'text_end' is specified, B) it's faster, no
765 // memory copy is done, no buffer size limits, recommended for long chunks of text.
766IMGUI_API void Text(const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // formatted text
767IMGUI_API void TextV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
768IMGUI_API void TextColored(const ImVec4 &col, const char *fmt, ...)
769 IM_FMTARGS(2); // shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, col); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor();
770IMGUI_API void TextColoredV(const ImVec4 &col, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
771IMGUI_API void TextDisabled(const char *fmt, ...)
772 IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]); Text(fmt, ...);
773 // PopStyleColor();
774IMGUI_API void TextDisabledV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
775IMGUI_API void TextWrapped(const char *fmt, ...)
776 IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for PushTextWrapPos(0.0f); Text(fmt, ...); PopTextWrapPos();. Note that this won't work
777 // on an auto-resizing window if there's no other widgets to extend the window width, yoy may need to
778 // set a size using SetNextWindowSize().
779IMGUI_API void TextWrappedV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
780IMGUI_API void LabelText(const char *label, const char *fmt, ...)
781 IM_FMTARGS(2); // display text+label aligned the same way as value+label widgets
782IMGUI_API void LabelTextV(const char *label, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
783IMGUI_API void BulletText(const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // shortcut for Bullet()+Text()
784IMGUI_API void BulletTextV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
785IMGUI_API void SeparatorText(const char *label); // currently: formatted text with a horizontal line
786
787// Widgets: Main
788// - Most widgets return true when the value has been changed or when pressed/selected
789// - You may also use one of the many IsItemXXX functions (e.g. IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.) to query widget
790// state.
791IMGUI_API bool Button(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // button
792IMGUI_API bool SmallButton(const char *label); // button with (FramePadding.y == 0) to easily embed within text
793IMGUI_API bool InvisibleButton(
794 const char *str_id, const ImVec2 &size,
795 ImGuiButtonFlags flags = 0); // flexible button behavior without the visuals, frequently useful to build custom
796 // behaviors using the public api (along with IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.)
797IMGUI_API bool ArrowButton(const char *str_id, ImGuiDir dir); // square button with an arrow shape
798IMGUI_API bool Checkbox(const char *label, bool *v);
799IMGUI_API bool CheckboxFlags(const char *label, int *flags, int flags_value);
800IMGUI_API bool CheckboxFlags(const char *label, unsigned int *flags, unsigned int flags_value);
801IMGUI_API bool RadioButton(const char *label,
802 bool active); // use with e.g. if (RadioButton("one", my_value==1)) { my_value = 1; }
803IMGUI_API bool RadioButton(const char *label, int *v,
804 int v_button); // shortcut to handle the above pattern when value is an integer
805IMGUI_API void ProgressBar(float fraction, const ImVec2 &size_arg = ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0), const char *overlay = NULL);
806IMGUI_API void Bullet(); // draw a small circle + keep the cursor on the same line. advance cursor x position by
807 // GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(), same distance that TreeNode() uses
808IMGUI_API bool TextLink(const char *label); // hyperlink text button, return true when clicked
809IMGUI_API void TextLinkOpenURL(
810 const char *label, const char *url = NULL); // hyperlink text button, automatically open file/url when clicked
811
812// Widgets: Images
813// - Read about ImTextureID here: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Image-Loading-and-Displaying-Examples
814// - 'uv0' and 'uv1' are texture coordinates. Read about them from the same link above.
815// - Image() pads adds style.ImageBorderSize on each side, ImageButton() adds style.FramePadding on each side.
816// - ImageButton() draws a background based on regular Button() color + optionally an inner background if specified.
817IMGUI_API void Image(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &image_size, const ImVec2 &uv0 = ImVec2(0, 0),
818 const ImVec2 &uv1 = ImVec2(1, 1));
819IMGUI_API void ImageWithBg(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &image_size, const ImVec2 &uv0 = ImVec2(0, 0),
820 const ImVec2 &uv1 = ImVec2(1, 1), const ImVec4 &bg_col = ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0),
821 const ImVec4 &tint_col = ImVec4(1, 1, 1, 1));
822IMGUI_API bool ImageButton(const char *str_id, ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &image_size,
823 const ImVec2 &uv0 = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2 &uv1 = ImVec2(1, 1),
824 const ImVec4 &bg_col = ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0), const ImVec4 &tint_col = ImVec4(1, 1, 1, 1));
825
826// Widgets: Combo Box (Dropdown)
827// - The BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api allows you to manage your contents and selection state however you want it, by
828// creating e.g. Selectable() items.
829// - The old Combo() api are helpers over BeginCombo()/EndCombo() which are kept available for convenience purpose. This
830// is analogous to how ListBox are created.
831IMGUI_API bool BeginCombo(const char *label, const char *preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags flags = 0);
832IMGUI_API void EndCombo(); // only call EndCombo() if BeginCombo() returns true!
833IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *const items[], int items_count,
834 int popup_max_height_in_items = -1);
835IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *items_separated_by_zeros,
836 int popup_max_height_in_items = -1); // Separate items with \0 within a string, end item-list with
837 // \0\0. e.g. "One\0Two\0Three\0"
838IMGUI_API bool Combo(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *(*getter)(void *user_data, int idx),
839 void *user_data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1);
840
841// Widgets: Drag Sliders
842// - CTRL+Click on any drag box to turn them into an input box. Manually input values aren't clamped by default and can
843// go off-bounds. Use ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp to always clamp.
844// - For all the Float2/Float3/Float4/Int2/Int3/Int4 versions of every function, note that a 'float v[X]' function
845// argument is the same as 'float* v',
846// the array syntax is just a way to document the number of elements that are expected to be accessible. You can pass
847// address of your first element out of a contiguous set, e.g. &myvector.x
848// - Adjust format string to decorate the value with a prefix, a suffix, or adapt the editing and display precision e.g.
849// "%.3f" -> 1.234; "%5.2f secs" -> 01.23 secs; "Biscuit: %.0f" -> Biscuit: 1; etc.
850// - Format string may also be set to NULL or use the default format ("%f" or "%d").
851// - Speed are per-pixel of mouse movement (v_speed=0.2f: mouse needs to move by 5 pixels to increase value by 1). For
852// keyboard/gamepad navigation, minimum speed is Max(v_speed, minimum_step_at_given_precision).
853// - Use v_min < v_max to clamp edits to given limits. Note that CTRL+Click manual input can override those limits if
854// ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp is not used.
855// - Use v_max = FLT_MAX / INT_MAX etc to avoid clamping to a maximum, same with v_min = -FLT_MAX / INT_MIN to avoid
856// clamping to a minimum.
857// - We use the same sets of flags for DragXXX() and SliderXXX() functions as the features are the same and it makes it
858// easier to swap them.
859// - Legacy: Pre-1.78 there are DragXXX() function signatures that take a final `float power=1.0f' argument instead of
860// the `ImGuiSliderFlags flags=0' argument.
861// If you get a warning converting a float to ImGuiSliderFlags, read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/3361
862IMGUI_API bool DragFloat(const char *label, float *v, float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f,
863 const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0); // If v_min >= v_max we have no bound
864IMGUI_API bool DragFloat2(const char *label, float v[2], float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f,
865 const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
866IMGUI_API bool DragFloat3(const char *label, float v[3], float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f,
867 const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
868IMGUI_API bool DragFloat4(const char *label, float v[4], float v_speed = 1.0f, float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f,
869 const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
870IMGUI_API bool DragFloatRange2(const char *label, float *v_current_min, float *v_current_max, float v_speed = 1.0f,
871 float v_min = 0.0f, float v_max = 0.0f, const char *format = "%.3f",
872 const char *format_max = NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
873IMGUI_API bool DragInt(const char *label, int *v, float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0,
874 const char *format = "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0); // If v_min >= v_max we have no bound
875IMGUI_API bool DragInt2(const char *label, int v[2], float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0,
876 const char *format = "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
877IMGUI_API bool DragInt3(const char *label, int v[3], float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0,
878 const char *format = "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
879IMGUI_API bool DragInt4(const char *label, int v[4], float v_speed = 1.0f, int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0,
880 const char *format = "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
881IMGUI_API bool DragIntRange2(const char *label, int *v_current_min, int *v_current_max, float v_speed = 1.0f,
882 int v_min = 0, int v_max = 0, const char *format = "%d", const char *format_max = NULL,
883 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
884IMGUI_API bool DragScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, float v_speed = 1.0f,
885 const void *p_min = NULL, const void *p_max = NULL, const char *format = NULL,
886 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
887IMGUI_API bool DragScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, int components,
888 float v_speed = 1.0f, const void *p_min = NULL, const void *p_max = NULL,
889 const char *format = NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
890
891// Widgets: Regular Sliders
892// - CTRL+Click on any slider to turn them into an input box. Manually input values aren't clamped by default and can go
893// off-bounds. Use ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp to always clamp.
894// - Adjust format string to decorate the value with a prefix, a suffix, or adapt the editing and display precision e.g.
895// "%.3f" -> 1.234; "%5.2f secs" -> 01.23 secs; "Biscuit: %.0f" -> Biscuit: 1; etc.
896// - Format string may also be set to NULL or use the default format ("%f" or "%d").
897// - Legacy: Pre-1.78 there are SliderXXX() function signatures that take a final `float power=1.0f' argument instead of
898// the `ImGuiSliderFlags flags=0' argument.
899// If you get a warning converting a float to ImGuiSliderFlags, read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/3361
900IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat(const char *label, float *v, float v_min, float v_max, const char *format = "%.3f",
901 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0); // adjust format to decorate the value with a prefix or a suffix
902 // for in-slider labels or unit display.
903IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat2(const char *label, float v[2], float v_min, float v_max, const char *format = "%.3f",
904 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
905IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat3(const char *label, float v[3], float v_min, float v_max, const char *format = "%.3f",
906 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
907IMGUI_API bool SliderFloat4(const char *label, float v[4], float v_min, float v_max, const char *format = "%.3f",
908 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
909IMGUI_API bool SliderAngle(const char *label, float *v_rad, float v_degrees_min = -360.0f,
910 float v_degrees_max = +360.0f, const char *format = "%.0f deg", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
911IMGUI_API bool SliderInt(const char *label, int *v, int v_min, int v_max, const char *format = "%d",
912 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
913IMGUI_API bool SliderInt2(const char *label, int v[2], int v_min, int v_max, const char *format = "%d",
914 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
915IMGUI_API bool SliderInt3(const char *label, int v[3], int v_min, int v_max, const char *format = "%d",
916 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
917IMGUI_API bool SliderInt4(const char *label, int v[4], int v_min, int v_max, const char *format = "%d",
918 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
919IMGUI_API bool SliderScalar(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_min,
920 const void *p_max, const char *format = NULL, ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
921IMGUI_API bool SliderScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, int components,
922 const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format = NULL,
923 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
924IMGUI_API bool VSliderFloat(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size, float *v, float v_min, float v_max,
925 const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
926IMGUI_API bool VSliderInt(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size, int *v, int v_min, int v_max,
927 const char *format = "%d", ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
928IMGUI_API bool VSliderScalar(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data,
929 const void *p_min, const void *p_max, const char *format = NULL,
930 ImGuiSliderFlags flags = 0);
931
932// Widgets: Input with Keyboard
933// - If you want to use InputText() with std::string or any custom dynamic string type, see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h and
934// comments in imgui_demo.cpp.
935// - Most of the ImGuiInputTextFlags flags are only useful for InputText() and not for InputFloatX, InputIntX,
936// InputDouble etc.
937IMGUI_API bool InputText(const char *label, char *buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0,
938 ImGuiInputTextCallback callback = NULL, void *user_data = NULL);
939IMGUI_API bool InputTextMultiline(const char *label, char *buf, size_t buf_size, const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0),
940 ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback = NULL,
941 void *user_data = NULL);
942IMGUI_API bool InputTextWithHint(const char *label, const char *hint, char *buf, size_t buf_size,
943 ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback = NULL,
944 void *user_data = NULL);
945IMGUI_API bool InputFloat(const char *label, float *v, float step = 0.0f, float step_fast = 0.0f,
946 const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
947IMGUI_API bool InputFloat2(const char *label, float v[2], const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
948IMGUI_API bool InputFloat3(const char *label, float v[3], const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
949IMGUI_API bool InputFloat4(const char *label, float v[4], const char *format = "%.3f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
950IMGUI_API bool InputInt(const char *label, int *v, int step = 1, int step_fast = 100, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
951IMGUI_API bool InputInt2(const char *label, int v[2], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
952IMGUI_API bool InputInt3(const char *label, int v[3], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
953IMGUI_API bool InputInt4(const char *label, int v[4], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
954IMGUI_API bool InputDouble(const char *label, double *v, double step = 0.0, double step_fast = 0.0,
955 const char *format = "%.6f", ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);

957 const void *p_step_fast = NULL, const char *format = NULL, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0);
958IMGUI_API bool InputScalarN(const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, int components,
959 const void *p_step = NULL, const void *p_step_fast = NULL, const char *format = NULL,

961
962// Widgets: Color Editor/Picker (tip: the ColorEdit* functions have a little color square that can be left-clicked to
963// open a picker, and right-clicked to open an option menu.)
964// - Note that in C++ a 'float v[X]' function argument is the _same_ as 'float* v', the array syntax is just a way to
965// document the number of elements that are expected to be accessible.
966// - You can pass the address of a first float element out of a contiguous structure, e.g. &myvector.x
967IMGUI_API bool ColorEdit3(const char *label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0);
968IMGUI_API bool ColorEdit4(const char *label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0);
969IMGUI_API bool ColorPicker3(const char *label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0);
970IMGUI_API bool ColorPicker4(const char *label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0,
971 const float *ref_col = NULL);
972IMGUI_API bool ColorButton(
973 const char *desc_id, const ImVec4 &col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0,
974 const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // display a color square/button, hover for details, return true when pressed.
975IMGUI_API void SetColorEditOptions(
976 ImGuiColorEditFlags flags); // initialize current options (generally on application startup) if you want to select a
977 // default format, picker type, etc. User will be able to change many settings, unless
978 // you pass the _NoOptions flag to your calls.
979
980// Widgets: Trees
981// - TreeNode functions return true when the node is open, in which case you need to also call TreePop() when you are
982// finished displaying the tree node contents.
983IMGUI_API bool TreeNode(const char *label);
984IMGUI_API bool TreeNode(const char *str_id, const char *fmt, ...)
985 IM_FMTARGS(2); // helper variation to easily decorelate the id from the displayed string. Read the FAQ about why and
986 // how to use ID. to align arbitrary text at the same level as a TreeNode() you can use Bullet().
987IMGUI_API bool TreeNode(const void *ptr_id, const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2); // "
988IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeV(const char *str_id, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
989IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeV(const void *ptr_id, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
990IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeEx(const char *label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0);
991IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeEx(const char *str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(3);
992IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeEx(const void *ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(3);
993IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeExV(const char *str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(3);
994IMGUI_API bool TreeNodeExV(const void *ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(3);
995IMGUI_API void TreePush(const char *str_id); // ~ Indent()+PushID(). Already called by TreeNode() when returning true,
996 // but you can call TreePush/TreePop yourself if desired.
997IMGUI_API void TreePush(const void *ptr_id); // "
998IMGUI_API void TreePop(); // ~ Unindent()+PopID()
999IMGUI_API float GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(); // horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode*() or Bullet()
1000 // == (g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x*2) for a regular unframed TreeNode
1001IMGUI_API bool CollapsingHeader(
1002 const char *label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0); // if returning 'true' the header is open. doesn't indent nor push
1003 // on ID stack. user doesn't have to call TreePop().
1004IMGUI_API bool CollapsingHeader(
1005 const char *label, bool *p_visible,
1006 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0); // when 'p_visible != NULL': if '*p_visible==true' display an additional small close
1007 // button on upper right of the header which will set the bool to false when clicked,
1008 // if '*p_visible==false' don't display the header.
1009IMGUI_API void SetNextItemOpen(bool is_open, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state.
1010IMGUI_API void SetNextItemStorageID(
1011 ImGuiID storage_id); // set id to use for open/close storage (default to same as item id).
1012
1013// Widgets: Selectables
1014// - A selectable highlights when hovered, and can display another color when selected.
1015// - Neighbors selectable extend their highlight bounds in order to leave no gap between them. This is so a series of
1016// selected Selectable appear contiguous.
1017IMGUI_API bool Selectable(
1018 const char *label, bool selected = false, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = 0,
1019 const ImVec2 &size =
1020 ImVec2(0, 0)); // "bool selected" carry the selection state (read-only). Selectable() is clicked is returns true
1021 // so you can modify your selection state. size.x==0.0: use remaining width, size.x>0.0: specify
1022 // width. size.y==0.0: use label height, size.y>0.0: specify height
1023IMGUI_API bool Selectable(const char *label, bool *p_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags = 0,
1024 const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // "bool* p_selected" point to the selection state
1025 // (read-write), as a convenient helper.
1026
1027// Multi-selection system for Selectable(), Checkbox(), TreeNode() functions [BETA]
1028// - This enables standard multi-selection/range-selection idioms (CTRL+Mouse/Keyboard, SHIFT+Mouse/Keyboard, etc.) in a
1029// way that also allow a clipper to be used.
1030// - ImGuiSelectionUserData is often used to store your item index within the current view (but may store something
1031// else).
1032// - Read comments near ImGuiMultiSelectIO for instructions/details and see 'Demo->Widgets->Selection State &
1033// Multi-Select' for demo.
1034// - TreeNode() is technically supported but... using this correctly is more complicated. You need some sort of
1035// linear/random access to your tree,
1036// which is suited to advanced trees setups already implementing filters and clipper. We will work simplifying the
1037// current demo.
1038// - 'selection_size' and 'items_count' parameters are optional and used by a few features. If they are costly for you
1039// to compute, you may avoid them.
1040IMGUI_API ImGuiMultiSelectIO *BeginMultiSelect(ImGuiMultiSelectFlags flags, int selection_size = -1,
1041 int items_count = -1);
1042IMGUI_API ImGuiMultiSelectIO *EndMultiSelect();
1043IMGUI_API void SetNextItemSelectionUserData(ImGuiSelectionUserData selection_user_data);
1044IMGUI_API bool IsItemToggledSelection(); // Was the last item selection state toggled? Useful if you need the per-item
1045 // information _before_ reaching EndMultiSelect(). We only returns toggle
1046 // _event_ in order to handle clipping correctly.
1047
1048// Widgets: List Boxes
1049// - This is essentially a thin wrapper to using BeginChild/EndChild with the ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle flag for
1050// stylistic changes + displaying a label.
1051// - If you don't need a label you can probably simply use BeginChild() with the ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle flag for the
1052// same result.
1053// - You can submit contents and manage your selection state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable() or any
1054// other items.
1055// - The simplified/old ListBox() api are helpers over BeginListBox()/EndListBox() which are kept available for
1056// convenience purpose. This is analogous to how Combos are created.
1057// - Choose frame width: size.x > 0.0f: custom / size.x < 0.0f or -FLT_MIN: right-align / size.x = 0.0f
1058// (default): use current ItemWidth
1059// - Choose frame height: size.y > 0.0f: custom / size.y < 0.0f or -FLT_MIN: bottom-align / size.y = 0.0f
1060// (default): arbitrary default height which can fit ~7 items
1061IMGUI_API bool BeginListBox(const char *label, const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0)); // open a framed scrolling region
1062IMGUI_API void EndListBox(); // only call EndListBox() if BeginListBox() returned true!
1063IMGUI_API bool ListBox(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *const items[], int items_count,
1064 int height_in_items = -1);
1065IMGUI_API bool ListBox(const char *label, int *current_item, const char *(*getter)(void *user_data, int idx),
1066 void *user_data, int items_count, int height_in_items = -1);
1067
1068// Widgets: Data Plotting
1069// - Consider using ImPlot (https://github.com/epezent/implot) which is much better!
1070IMGUI_API void PlotLines(const char *label, const float *values, int values_count, int values_offset = 0,
1071 const char *overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX,
1072 ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0), int stride = sizeof(float));
1073IMGUI_API void PlotLines(const char *label, float (*values_getter)(void *data, int idx), void *data, int values_count,
1074 int values_offset = 0, const char *overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX,
1075 float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0));
1076IMGUI_API void PlotHistogram(const char *label, const float *values, int values_count, int values_offset = 0,
1077 const char *overlay_text = NULL, float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX,
1078 ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0), int stride = sizeof(float));
1079IMGUI_API void PlotHistogram(const char *label, float (*values_getter)(void *data, int idx), void *data,
1080 int values_count, int values_offset = 0, const char *overlay_text = NULL,
1081 float scale_min = FLT_MAX, float scale_max = FLT_MAX, ImVec2 graph_size = ImVec2(0, 0));
1082
1083// Widgets: Value() Helpers.
1084// - Those are merely shortcut to calling Text() with a format string. Output single value in "name: value" format (tip:
1085// freely declare more in your code to handle your types. you can add functions to the ImGui namespace)
1086IMGUI_API void Value(const char *prefix, bool b);
1087IMGUI_API void Value(const char *prefix, int v);
1088IMGUI_API void Value(const char *prefix, unsigned int v);
1089IMGUI_API void Value(const char *prefix, float v, const char *float_format = NULL);
1090
1091// Widgets: Menus
1092// - Use BeginMenuBar() on a window ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar to append to its menu bar.
1093// - Use BeginMainMenuBar() to create a menu bar at the top of the screen and append to it.
1094// - Use BeginMenu() to create a menu. You can call BeginMenu() multiple time with the same identifier to append more
1095// items to it.
1096// - Not that MenuItem() keyboardshortcuts are displayed as a convenience but _not processed_ by Dear ImGui at the
1097// moment.
1098IMGUI_API bool BeginMenuBar(); // append to menu-bar of current window (requires ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar flag set on
1099 // parent window).
1100IMGUI_API void EndMenuBar(); // only call EndMenuBar() if BeginMenuBar() returns true!
1101IMGUI_API bool BeginMainMenuBar(); // create and append to a full screen menu-bar.
1102IMGUI_API void EndMainMenuBar(); // only call EndMainMenuBar() if BeginMainMenuBar() returns true!
1103IMGUI_API bool BeginMenu(const char *label,
1104 bool enabled = true); // create a sub-menu entry. only call EndMenu() if this returns true!
1105IMGUI_API void EndMenu(); // only call EndMenu() if BeginMenu() returns true!
1106IMGUI_API bool MenuItem(const char *label, const char *shortcut = NULL, bool selected = false,
1107 bool enabled = true); // return true when activated.
1108IMGUI_API bool MenuItem(const char *label, const char *shortcut, bool *p_selected,
1109 bool enabled = true); // return true when activated + toggle (*p_selected) if p_selected != NULL
1110
1111// Tooltips
1112// - Tooltips are windows following the mouse. They do not take focus away.
1113// - A tooltip window can contain items of any types.
1114// - SetTooltip() is more or less a shortcut for the 'if (BeginTooltip()) { Text(...); EndTooltip(); }' idiom (with a
1115// subtlety that it discard any previously submitted tooltip)
1116IMGUI_API bool BeginTooltip(); // begin/append a tooltip window.
1117IMGUI_API void EndTooltip(); // only call EndTooltip() if BeginTooltip()/BeginItemTooltip() returns true!
1118IMGUI_API void SetTooltip(const char *fmt, ...)
1119 IM_FMTARGS(1); // set a text-only tooltip. Often used after a ImGui::IsItemHovered() check. Override any previous
1120 // call to SetTooltip().
1121IMGUI_API void SetTooltipV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
1122
1123// Tooltips: helpers for showing a tooltip when hovering an item
1124// - BeginItemTooltip() is a shortcut for the 'if (IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip) && BeginTooltip())'
1125// idiom.
1126// - SetItemTooltip() is a shortcut for the 'if (IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip)) { SetTooltip(...); }'
1127// idiom.
1128// - Where 'ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip' itself is a shortcut to use 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse' or
1129// 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav' depending on active input type. For mouse it defaults to
1130// 'ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort'.
1131IMGUI_API bool BeginItemTooltip(); // begin/append a tooltip window if preceding item was hovered.
1132IMGUI_API void SetItemTooltip(const char *fmt, ...)
1133 IM_FMTARGS(1); // set a text-only tooltip if preceding item was hovered. override any previous call to SetTooltip().
1134IMGUI_API void SetItemTooltipV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
1135
1136// Popups, Modals
1137// - They block normal mouse hovering detection (and therefore most mouse interactions) behind them.
1138// - If not modal: they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
1139// - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally instead of being held by the programmer as we are used to with
1140// regular Begin*() calls.
1141// - The 3 properties above are related: we need to retain popup visibility state in the library because popups may be
1142// closed as any time.
1143// - You can bypass the hovering restriction by using ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup when calling
1144// IsItemHovered() or IsWindowHovered().
1145// - IMPORTANT: Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID stack, so OpenPopup and BeginPopup generally needs to
1146// be at the same level of the stack.
1147// This is sometimes leading to confusing mistakes. May rework this in the future.
