1148// - BeginPopup(): query popup state, if open start appending into the window. Call EndPopup() afterwards if returned
1149// true. ImGuiWindowFlags are forwarded to the window.
1150// - BeginPopupModal(): block every interaction behind the window, cannot be closed by user, add a dimming background,
1151// has a title bar.
1152IMGUI_API bool BeginPopup(
1153 const char *str_id,
1154 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // return true if the popup is open, and you can start outputting to it.
1155IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupModal(
1156 const char *name, bool *p_open = NULL,
1157 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = 0); // return true if the modal is open, and you can start outputting to it.
1158IMGUI_API void EndPopup(); // only call EndPopup() if BeginPopupXXX() returns true!
1159
1160// Popups: open/close functions
1161// - OpenPopup(): set popup state to open. ImGuiPopupFlags are available for opening options.
1162// - If not modal: they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
1163// - CloseCurrentPopup(): use inside the BeginPopup()/EndPopup() scope to close manually.
1164// - CloseCurrentPopup() is called by default by Selectable()/MenuItem() when activated (FIXME: need some options).
1165// - Use ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup to avoid opening a popup if there's already one at the same level.
1166// This is equivalent to e.g. testing for !IsAnyPopupOpen() prior to OpenPopup().
1167// - Use IsWindowAppearing() after BeginPopup() to tell if a window just opened.
1168// - IMPORTANT: Notice that for OpenPopupOnItemClick() we exceptionally default flags to 1 (==
1169// ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight) for backward compatibility with older API taking 'int mouse_button = 1' parameter
1170IMGUI_API void OpenPopup(const char *str_id,
1171 ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 0); // call to mark popup as open (don't call every frame!).
1172IMGUI_API void OpenPopup(ImGuiID id,
1173 ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 0); // id overload to facilitate calling from nested stacks
1174IMGUI_API void OpenPopupOnItemClick(
1175 const char *str_id = NULL,
1176 ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags =
1177 1); // helper to open popup when clicked on last item. Default to ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight == 1. (note:
1178 // actually triggers on the mouse _released_ event to be consistent with popup behaviors)
1179IMGUI_API void CloseCurrentPopup(); // manually close the popup we have begin-ed into.
1180
1181// Popups: open+begin combined functions helpers
1182// - Helpers to do OpenPopup+BeginPopup where the Open action is triggered by e.g. hovering an item and right-clicking.
1183// - They are convenient to easily create context menus, hence the name.
1184// - IMPORTANT: Notice that BeginPopupContextXXX takes ImGuiPopupFlags just like OpenPopup() and unlike BeginPopup().
1185// For full consistency, we may add ImGuiWindowFlags to the BeginPopupContextXXX functions in the future.
1186// - IMPORTANT: Notice that we exceptionally default their flags to 1 (== ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight) for
1187// backward compatibility with older API taking 'int mouse_button = 1' parameter, so if you add other flags remember to
1188// re-add the ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight.
1189IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextItem(
1190 const char *str_id = NULL,
1191 ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1); // open+begin popup when clicked on last item. Use str_id==NULL to associate the
1192 // popup to previous item. If you want to use that on a non-interactive item such
1193 // as Text() you need to pass in an explicit ID here. read comments in .cpp!
1194IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextWindow(
1195 const char *str_id = NULL, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1); // open+begin popup when clicked on current window.
1196IMGUI_API bool BeginPopupContextVoid(
1197 const char *str_id = NULL,
1198 ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags = 1); // open+begin popup when clicked in void (where there are no windows).
1199
1200// Popups: query functions
1201// - IsPopupOpen(): return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack.
1202// - IsPopupOpen() with ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId: return true if any popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level
1203// of the popup stack.
1204// - IsPopupOpen() with ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId + ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel: return true if any popup is open.
1205IMGUI_API bool IsPopupOpen(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags flags = 0); // return true if the popup is open.
1206
1207// Tables
1208// - Full-featured replacement for old Columns API.
1209// - See Demo->Tables for demo code. See top of imgui_tables.cpp for general commentary.
1210// - See ImGuiTableFlags_ and ImGuiTableColumnFlags_ enums for a description of available flags.
1211// The typical call flow is:
1212// - 1. Call BeginTable(), early out if returning false.
1213// - 2. Optionally call TableSetupColumn() to submit column name/flags/defaults.
1214// - 3. Optionally call TableSetupScrollFreeze() to request scroll freezing of columns/rows.
1215// - 4. Optionally call TableHeadersRow() to submit a header row. Names are pulled from TableSetupColumn() data.
1216// - 5. Populate contents:
1217// - In most situations you can use TableNextRow() + TableSetColumnIndex(N) to start appending into a column.
1218// - If you are using tables as a sort of grid, where every column is holding the same type of contents,
1219// you may prefer using TableNextColumn() instead of TableNextRow() + TableSetColumnIndex().
1220// TableNextColumn() will automatically wrap-around into the next row if needed.
1221// - IMPORTANT: Comparatively to the old Columns() API, we need to call TableNextColumn() for the first column!
1222// - Summary of possible call flow:
1223// - TableNextRow() -> TableSetColumnIndex(0) -> Text("Hello 0") -> TableSetColumnIndex(1) -> Text("Hello 1") //
1224// OK
1225// - TableNextRow() -> TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 0") -> TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 1") //
1226// OK
1227// - TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 0") -> TableNextColumn() -> Text("Hello 1") //
1228// OK: TableNextColumn() automatically gets to next row!
1229// - TableNextRow() -> Text("Hello 0") //
1230// Not OK! Missing TableSetColumnIndex() or TableNextColumn()! Text will not appear!
1231// - 5. Call EndTable()
1232IMGUI_API bool BeginTable(const char *str_id, int columns, ImGuiTableFlags flags = 0,
1233 const ImVec2 &outer_size = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), float inner_width = 0.0f);
1234IMGUI_API void EndTable(); // only call EndTable() if BeginTable() returns true!
1235IMGUI_API void TableNextRow(ImGuiTableRowFlags row_flags = 0,
1236 float min_row_height = 0.0f); // append into the first cell of a new row.
1237IMGUI_API bool TableNextColumn(); // append into the next column (or first column of next row if currently in last
1238 // column). Return true when column is visible.
1239IMGUI_API bool TableSetColumnIndex(
1240 int column_n); // append into the specified column. Return true when column is visible.
1241
1242// Tables: Headers & Columns declaration
1243// - Use TableSetupColumn() to specify label, resizing policy, default width/weight, id, various other flags etc.
1244// - Use TableHeadersRow() to create a header row and automatically submit a TableHeader() for each column.
1245// Headers are required to perform: reordering, sorting, and opening the context menu.
1246// The context menu can also be made available in columns body using ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody.
1247// - You may manually submit headers using TableNextRow() + TableHeader() calls, but this is only useful in
1248// some advanced use cases (e.g. adding custom widgets in header row).
1249// - Use TableSetupScrollFreeze() to lock columns/rows so they stay visible when scrolled.
1250IMGUI_API void TableSetupColumn(const char *label, ImGuiTableColumnFlags flags = 0, float init_width_or_weight = 0.0f,
1251 ImGuiID user_id = 0);
1252IMGUI_API void TableSetupScrollFreeze(int cols, int rows); // lock columns/rows so they stay visible when scrolled.
1253IMGUI_API void TableHeader(const char *label); // submit one header cell manually (rarely used)
1254IMGUI_API void TableHeadersRow(); // submit a row with headers cells based on data provided to TableSetupColumn() +
1255 // submit context menu
1256IMGUI_API void TableAngledHeadersRow(); // submit a row with angled headers for every column with the
1257 // ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader flag. MUST BE FIRST ROW.
1258
1259// Tables: Sorting & Miscellaneous functions
1260// - Sorting: call TableGetSortSpecs() to retrieve latest sort specs for the table. NULL when not sorting.
1261// When 'sort_specs->SpecsDirty == true' you should sort your data. It will be true when sorting specs have
1262// changed since last call, or the first time. Make sure to set 'SpecsDirty = false' after sorting,
1263// else you may wastefully sort your data every frame!
1264// - Functions args 'int column_n' treat the default value of -1 as the same as passing the current column index.
1265IMGUI_API ImGuiTableSortSpecs *TableGetSortSpecs(); // get latest sort specs for the table (NULL if not sorting).
1266 // Lifetime: don't hold on this pointer over multiple frames or past
1267 // any subsequent call to BeginTable().
1268IMGUI_API int TableGetColumnCount(); // return number of columns (value passed to BeginTable)
1269IMGUI_API int TableGetColumnIndex(); // return current column index.
1270IMGUI_API int TableGetRowIndex(); // return current row index.
1271IMGUI_API const char *TableGetColumnName(int column_n = -1); // return "" if column didn't have a name declared by
1272 // TableSetupColumn(). Pass -1 to use current column.
1273IMGUI_API ImGuiTableColumnFlags
1274TableGetColumnFlags(int column_n = -1); // return column flags so you can query their Enabled/Visible/Sorted/Hovered
1275 // status flags. Pass -1 to use current column.
1276IMGUI_API void TableSetColumnEnabled(
1277 int column_n, bool v); // change user accessible enabled/disabled state of a column. Set to false to hide the
1278 // column. User can use the context menu to change this themselves (right-click in headers,
1279 // or right-click in columns body with ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody)
1280IMGUI_API int TableGetHoveredColumn(); // return hovered column. return -1 when table is not hovered. return
1281 // columns_count if the unused space at the right of visible columns is hovered.
1282 // Can also use (TableGetColumnFlags() & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered)
1283 // instead.
1284IMGUI_API void TableSetBgColor(
1285 ImGuiTableBgTarget target, ImU32 color,
1286 int column_n = -1); // change the color of a cell, row, or column. See ImGuiTableBgTarget_ flags for details.
1287
1288// Legacy Columns API (prefer using Tables!)
1289// - You can also use SameLine(pos_x) to mimic simplified columns.
1290IMGUI_API void Columns(int count = 1, const char *id = NULL, bool borders = true);
1291IMGUI_API void NextColumn(); // next column, defaults to current row or next row if the current row is finished
1292IMGUI_API int GetColumnIndex(); // get current column index
1293IMGUI_API float GetColumnWidth(int column_index = -1); // get column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column
1294IMGUI_API void SetColumnWidth(int column_index,
1295 float width); // set column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column
1296IMGUI_API float GetColumnOffset(
1297 int column_index =
1298 -1); // get position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use
1299 // current column, otherwise 0..GetColumnsCount() inclusive. column 0 is typically 0.0f
1300IMGUI_API void SetColumnOffset(int column_index,
1301 float offset_x); // set position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the
1302 // contents region). pass -1 to use current column
1303IMGUI_API int GetColumnsCount();
1304
1305// Tab Bars, Tabs
1306// - Note: Tabs are automatically created by the docking system (when in 'docking' branch). Use this to create tab
1307// bars/tabs yourself.
1308IMGUI_API bool BeginTabBar(const char *str_id, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags = 0); // create and append into a TabBar
1309IMGUI_API void EndTabBar(); // only call EndTabBar() if BeginTabBar() returns true!
1310IMGUI_API bool BeginTabItem(const char *label, bool *p_open = NULL,
1311 ImGuiTabItemFlags flags = 0); // create a Tab. Returns true if the Tab is selected.
1312IMGUI_API void EndTabItem(); // only call EndTabItem() if BeginTabItem() returns true!
1313IMGUI_API bool TabItemButton(const char *label,
1314 ImGuiTabItemFlags flags = 0); // create a Tab behaving like a button. return true when
1315 // clicked. cannot be selected in the tab bar.
1316IMGUI_API void SetTabItemClosed(
1317 const char
1318 *tab_or_docked_window_label); // notify TabBar or Docking system of a closed tab/window ahead (useful to reduce
1319 // visual flicker on reorderable tab bars). For tab-bar: call after BeginTabBar()
1320 // and before Tab submissions. Otherwise call with a window name.
1321
1322// Docking
1323// [BETA API] Enable with io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable.
1324// Note: You can use most Docking facilities without calling any API. You DO NOT need to call DockSpace() to use
1325// Docking!
1326// - Drag from window title bar or their tab to dock/undock. Hold SHIFT to disable docking.
1327// - Drag from window menu button (upper-left button) to undock an entire node (all windows).
1328// - When io.ConfigDockingWithShift == true, you instead need to hold SHIFT to enable docking.
1329// About dockspaces:
1330// - Use DockSpaceOverViewport() to create a window covering the screen or a specific viewport + a dockspace inside it.
1331// This is often used with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode to make it transparent.
1332// - Use DockSpace() to create an explicit dock node _within_ an existing window. See Docking demo for details.
1333// - Important: Dockspaces need to be submitted _before_ any window they can host. Submit it early in your frame!
1334// - Important: Dockspaces need to be kept alive if hidden, otherwise windows docked into it will be undocked.
1335// e.g. if you have multiple tabs with a dockspace inside each tab: submit the non-visible dockspaces with
1336// ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly.
1337IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpace(ImGuiID dockspace_id, const ImVec2 &size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0,
1338 const ImGuiWindowClass *window_class = NULL);
1339IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockSpaceOverViewport(ImGuiID dockspace_id = 0, const ImGuiViewport *viewport = NULL,
1340 ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0, const ImGuiWindowClass *window_class = NULL);
1341IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowDockID(ImGuiID dock_id, ImGuiCond cond = 0); // set next window dock id
1342IMGUI_API void SetNextWindowClass(
1343 const ImGuiWindowClass
1344 *window_class); // set next window class (control docking compatibility + provide hints to platform backend via
1345 // custom viewport flags and platform parent/child relationship)
1346IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetWindowDockID();
1347IMGUI_API bool IsWindowDocked(); // is current window docked into another window?
1348
1349// Logging/Capture
1350// - All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard. By default, tree nodes are
1351// automatically opened during logging.
1352IMGUI_API void LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth = -1); // start logging to tty (stdout)
1353IMGUI_API void LogToFile(int auto_open_depth = -1, const char *filename = NULL); // start logging to file
1354IMGUI_API void LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth = -1); // start logging to OS clipboard
1355IMGUI_API void LogFinish(); // stop logging (close file, etc.)
1356IMGUI_API void LogButtons(); // helper to display buttons for logging to tty/file/clipboard
1357IMGUI_API void LogText(const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(1); // pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
1358IMGUI_API void LogTextV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
1359
1360// Drag and Drop
1361// - On source items, call BeginDragDropSource(), if it returns true also call SetDragDropPayload() +
1362// EndDragDropSource().
1363// - On target candidates, call BeginDragDropTarget(), if it returns true also call AcceptDragDropPayload() +
1364// EndDragDropTarget().
1365// - If you stop calling BeginDragDropSource() the payload is preserved however it won't have a preview tooltip (we
1366// currently display a fallback "..." tooltip, see #1725)
1367// - An item can be both drag source and drop target.
1368IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropSource(
1369 ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // call after submitting an item which may be dragged. when this return true, you can
1370 // call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource()
1371IMGUI_API bool SetDragDropPayload(
1372 const char *type, const void *data, size_t sz,
1373 ImGuiCond cond =
1374 0); // type is a user defined string of maximum 32 characters. Strings starting with '_' are reserved for dear
1375 // imgui internal types. Data is copied and held by imgui. Return true when payload has been accepted.
1376IMGUI_API void EndDragDropSource(); // only call EndDragDropSource() if BeginDragDropSource() returns true!
1377IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropTarget(); // call after submitting an item that may receive a payload. If this returns true,
1378 // you can call AcceptDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropTarget()
1379IMGUI_API const ImGuiPayload *AcceptDragDropPayload(
1380 const char *type,
1381 ImGuiDragDropFlags flags = 0); // accept contents of a given type. If ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery is set
1382 // you can peek into the payload before the mouse button is released.
1383IMGUI_API void EndDragDropTarget(); // only call EndDragDropTarget() if BeginDragDropTarget() returns true!
1384IMGUI_API const ImGuiPayload *GetDragDropPayload(); // peek directly into the current payload from anywhere. returns
1385 // NULL when drag and drop is finished or inactive. use
1386 // ImGuiPayload::IsDataType() to test for the payload type.
1387
1388// Disabling [BETA API]
1389// - Disable all user interactions and dim items visuals (applying style.DisabledAlpha over current colors)
1390// - Those can be nested but it cannot be used to enable an already disabled section (a single BeginDisabled(true) in
1391// the stack is enough to keep everything disabled)
1392// - Tooltips windows by exception are opted out of disabling.
1393// - BeginDisabled(false)/EndDisabled() essentially does nothing but is provided to facilitate use of boolean
1394// expressions (as a micro-optimization: if you have tens of thousands of BeginDisabled(false)/EndDisabled() pairs, you
1395// might want to reformulate your code to avoid making those calls)
1396IMGUI_API void BeginDisabled(bool disabled = true);
1397IMGUI_API void EndDisabled();
1398
1399// Clipping
1400// - Mouse hovering is affected by ImGui::PushClipRect() calls, unlike direct calls to ImDrawList::PushClipRect() which
1401// are render only.
1402IMGUI_API void PushClipRect(const ImVec2 &clip_rect_min, const ImVec2 &clip_rect_max,
1403 bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
1404IMGUI_API void PopClipRect();
1405
1406// Focus, Activation
1407IMGUI_API void SetItemDefaultFocus(); // make last item the default focused item of a newly appearing window.
1408IMGUI_API void SetKeyboardFocusHere(
1409 int offset = 0); // focus keyboard on the next widget. Use positive 'offset' to access sub components of a multiple
1410 // component widget. Use -1 to access previous widget.
1411
1412// Keyboard/Gamepad Navigation
1413IMGUI_API void SetNavCursorVisible(bool visible); // alter visibility of keyboard/gamepad cursor. by default: show when
1414 // using an arrow key, hide when clicking with mouse.
1415
1416// Overlapping mode
1417IMGUI_API void SetNextItemAllowOverlap(); // allow next item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. Useful with
1418 // invisible buttons, selectable, treenode covering an area where subsequent
1419 // items may need to be added. Note that both Selectable() and TreeNode() have
1420 // dedicated flags doing this.
1421
1422// Item/Widgets Utilities and Query Functions
1423// - Most of the functions are referring to the previous Item that has been submitted.
1424// - See Demo Window under "Widgets->Querying Status" for an interactive visualization of most of those functions.
1425IMGUI_API bool IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags = 0); // is the last item hovered? (and usable, aka not blocked by
1426 // a popup, etc.). See ImGuiHoveredFlags for more options.
1427IMGUI_API bool IsItemActive(); // is the last item active? (e.g. button being held, text field being edited. This will
1428 // continuously return true while holding mouse button on an item. Items that don't
1429 // interact will always return false)
1430IMGUI_API bool IsItemFocused(); // is the last item focused for keyboard/gamepad navigation?
1431IMGUI_API bool IsItemClicked(
1432 ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button =
1433 0); // is the last item hovered and mouse clicked on? (**) == IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) &&
1434 // IsItemHovered()Important. (**) this is NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g. Button(). Read comments in
1435 // function definition.
1436IMGUI_API bool IsItemVisible(); // is the last item visible? (items may be out of sight because of clipping/scrolling)
1437IMGUI_API bool IsItemEdited(); // did the last item modify its underlying value this frame? or was pressed? This is
1438 // generally the same as the "bool" return value of many widgets.
1439IMGUI_API bool IsItemActivated(); // was the last item just made active (item was previously inactive).
1440IMGUI_API bool IsItemDeactivated(); // was the last item just made inactive (item was previously active). Useful for
1441 // Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that require continuous editing.
1442IMGUI_API bool IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(); // was the last item just made inactive and made a value change when it was
1443 // active? (e.g. Slider/Drag moved). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with
1444 // widgets that require continuous editing. Note that you may get false
1445 // positives (some widgets such as Combo()/ListBox()/Selectable() will
1446 // return true even when clicking an already selected item).
1447IMGUI_API bool IsItemToggledOpen(); // was the last item open state toggled? set by TreeNode().
1448IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemHovered(); // is any item hovered?
1449IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemActive(); // is any item active?
1450IMGUI_API bool IsAnyItemFocused(); // is any item focused?
1451IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetItemID(); // get ID of last item (~~ often same ImGui::GetID(label) beforehand)
1452IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectMin(); // get upper-left bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)
1453IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectMax(); // get lower-right bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)
1454IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetItemRectSize(); // get size of last item
1455
1456// Viewports
1457// - Currently represents the Platform Window created by the application which is hosting our Dear ImGui windows.
1458// - In 'docking' branch with multi-viewport enabled, we extend this concept to have multiple active viewports.
1459// - In the future we will extend this concept further to also represent Platform Monitor and support a "no main
1460// platform window" operation mode.
1461IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport *GetMainViewport(); // return primary/default viewport. This can never be NULL.
1462
1463// Background/Foreground Draw Lists
1464IMGUI_API ImDrawList *GetBackgroundDrawList(
1465 ImGuiViewport *viewport = NULL); // get background draw list for the given viewport or viewport associated to the
1466 // current window. this draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to
1467 // quickly draw shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.
1468IMGUI_API ImDrawList *GetForegroundDrawList(
1469 ImGuiViewport *viewport = NULL); // get foreground draw list for the given viewport or viewport associated to the
1470 // current window. this draw list will be the top-most rendered one. Useful to
1471 // quickly draw shapes/text over dear imgui contents.
1472
1473// Miscellaneous Utilities
1474IMGUI_API bool IsRectVisible(
1475 const ImVec2 &size); // test if rectangle (of given size, starting from cursor position) is visible / not clipped.
1476IMGUI_API bool IsRectVisible(const ImVec2 &rect_min,
1477 const ImVec2 &rect_max); // test if rectangle (in screen space) is visible / not clipped.
1478 // to perform coarse clipping on user's side.
1479IMGUI_API double GetTime(); // get global imgui time. incremented by io.DeltaTime every frame.
1480IMGUI_API int GetFrameCount(); // get global imgui frame count. incremented by 1 every frame.
1481IMGUI_API ImDrawListSharedData *GetDrawListSharedData(); // you may use this when creating your own ImDrawList
1482 // instances.
1483IMGUI_API const char *GetStyleColorName(
1484 ImGuiCol idx); // get a string corresponding to the enum value (for display, saving, etc.).
1485IMGUI_API void SetStateStorage(ImGuiStorage *storage); // replace current window storage with our own (if you want to
1486 // manipulate it yourself, typically clear subsection of it)
1487IMGUI_API ImGuiStorage *GetStateStorage();
1488
1489// Text Utilities
1490IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSize(const char *text, const char *text_end = NULL, bool hide_text_after_double_hash = false,
1491 float wrap_width = -1.0f);
1492
1493// Color Utilities
1494IMGUI_API ImVec4 ColorConvertU32ToFloat4(ImU32 in);
1495IMGUI_API ImU32 ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(const ImVec4 &in);
1496IMGUI_API void ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(float r, float g, float b, float &out_h, float &out_s, float &out_v);
1497IMGUI_API void ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(float h, float s, float v, float &out_r, float &out_g, float &out_b);
1498
1499// Inputs Utilities: Keyboard/Mouse/Gamepad
1500// - the ImGuiKey enum contains all possible keyboard, mouse and gamepad inputs (e.g. ImGuiKey_A, ImGuiKey_MouseLeft,
1501// ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp...).
1502// - (legacy: before v1.87, we used ImGuiKey to carry native/user indices as defined by each backends. This was
1503// obsoleted in 1.87 (2022-02) and completely removed in 1.91.5 (2024-11). See
1504// https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4921)
1505// - (legacy: any use of ImGuiKey will assert when key < 512 to detect passing legacy native/user indices)
1506IMGUI_API bool IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey key); // is key being held.
1507IMGUI_API bool IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey key, bool repeat = true); // was key pressed (went from !Down to Down)? if
1508 // repeat=true, uses io.KeyRepeatDelay / KeyRepeatRate
1509IMGUI_API bool IsKeyReleased(ImGuiKey key); // was key released (went from Down to !Down)?
1510IMGUI_API bool IsKeyChordPressed(
1511 ImGuiKeyChord key_chord); // was key chord (mods + key) pressed, e.g. you can pass 'ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_S' as a
1512 // key-chord. This doesn't do any routing or focus check, please consider using Shortcut()
1513 // function instead.
1514IMGUI_API int GetKeyPressedAmount(ImGuiKey key, float repeat_delay,
1515 float rate); // uses provided repeat rate/delay. return a count, most often 0 or 1 but
1516 // might be >1 if RepeatRate is small enough that DeltaTime > RepeatRate
1517IMGUI_API const char *GetKeyName(
1518 ImGuiKey key); // [DEBUG] returns English name of the key. Those names are provided for debugging purpose and are
1519 // not meant to be saved persistently nor compared.
1520IMGUI_API void SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard(
1521 bool want_capture_keyboard); // Override io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag next frame (said flag is left for your
1522 // application to handle, typically when true it instructs your app to ignore inputs).
1523 // e.g. force capture keyboard when your widget is being hovered. This is equivalent to
1524 // setting "io.WantCaptureKeyboard = want_capture_keyboard"; after the next NewFrame()
1525 // call.
1526
1527// Inputs Utilities: Shortcut Testing & Routing [BETA]
1528// - ImGuiKeyChord = a ImGuiKey + optional ImGuiMod_Alt/ImGuiMod_Ctrl/ImGuiMod_Shift/ImGuiMod_Super.
1529// ImGuiKey_C // Accepted by functions taking ImGuiKey or ImGuiKeyChord arguments)
1530// ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_C // Accepted by functions taking ImGuiKeyChord arguments)
1531// only ImGuiMod_XXX values are legal to combine with an ImGuiKey. You CANNOT combine two ImGuiKey values.
1532// - The general idea is that several callers may register interest in a shortcut, and only one owner gets it.
1533// Parent -> call Shortcut(Ctrl+S) // When Parent is focused, Parent gets the shortcut.
1534// Child1 -> call Shortcut(Ctrl+S) // When Child1 is focused, Child1 gets the shortcut (Child1 overrides
1535// Parent shortcuts) Child2 -> no call // When Child2 is focused, Parent gets the shortcut.
1536// The whole system is order independent, so if Child1 makes its calls before Parent, results will be identical.
1537// This is an important property as it facilitate working with foreign code or larger codebase.
1538// - To understand the difference:
1539// - IsKeyChordPressed() compares mods and call IsKeyPressed() -> function has no side-effect.
1540// - Shortcut() submits a route, routes are resolved, if it currently can be routed it calls IsKeyChordPressed() ->
1541// function has (desirable) side-effects as it can prevents another call from getting the route.
1542// - Visualize registered routes in 'Metrics/Debugger->Inputs'.
1543IMGUI_API bool Shortcut(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0);
1544IMGUI_API void SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0);
1545
1546// Inputs Utilities: Key/Input Ownership [BETA]
1547// - One common use case would be to allow your items to disable standard inputs behaviors such
1548// as Tab or Alt key handling, Mouse Wheel scrolling, etc.
1549// e.g. Button(...); SetItemKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY); to make hovering/activating a button disable wheel for
1550// scrolling.
1551// - Reminder ImGuiKey enum include access to mouse buttons and gamepad, so key ownership can apply to them.
1552// - Many related features are still in imgui_internal.h. For instance, most IsKeyXXX()/IsMouseXXX() functions have an
1553// owner-id-aware version.
1554IMGUI_API void SetItemKeyOwner(
1555 ImGuiKey key); // Set key owner to last item ID if it is hovered or active. Equivalent to 'if (IsItemHovered() ||
1556 // IsItemActive()) { SetKeyOwner(key, GetItemID());'.
1557
1558// Inputs Utilities: Mouse
1559// - To refer to a mouse button, you may use named enums in your code e.g. ImGuiMouseButton_Left,
1560// ImGuiMouseButton_Right.
1561// - You can also use regular integer: it is forever guaranteed that 0=Left, 1=Right, 2=Middle.
1562// - Dragging operations are only reported after mouse has moved a certain distance away from the initial clicking
1563// position (see 'lock_threshold' and 'io.MouseDraggingThreshold')
1564IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button); // is mouse button held?
1565IMGUI_API bool IsMouseClicked(
1566 ImGuiMouseButton button,
1567 bool repeat = false); // did mouse button clicked? (went from !Down to Down). Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 1.
1568IMGUI_API bool IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button); // did mouse button released? (went from Down to !Down)
1569IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDoubleClicked(
1570 ImGuiMouseButton button); // did mouse button double-clicked? Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 2. (note that a
1571 // double-click will also report IsMouseClicked() == true)
1572IMGUI_API bool IsMouseReleasedWithDelay(
1573 ImGuiMouseButton button,
1574 float delay); // delayed mouse release (use very sparingly!). Generally used with 'delay >= io.MouseDoubleClickTime'
1575 // + combined with a 'io.MouseClickedLastCount==1' test. This is a very rarely used UI idiom, but some
1576 // apps use this: e.g. MS Explorer single click on an icon to rename.
1577IMGUI_API int GetMouseClickedCount(ImGuiMouseButton button); // return the number of successive mouse-clicks at the time
1578 // where a click happen (otherwise 0).
1579IMGUI_API bool IsMouseHoveringRect(
1580 const ImVec2 &r_min, const ImVec2 &r_max,
1581 bool clip = true); // is mouse hovering given bounding rect (in screen space). clipped by current clipping settings,
1582 // but disregarding of other consideration of focus/window ordering/popup-block.
1583IMGUI_API bool IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2 *mouse_pos = NULL); // by convention we use (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote
1584 // that there is no mouse available
1585IMGUI_API bool IsAnyMouseDown(); // [WILL OBSOLETE] is any mouse button held? This was designed for backends, but prefer
1586 // having backend maintain a mask of held mouse buttons, because upcoming input queue
1587 // system will make this invalid.
1588IMGUI_API ImVec2
1589GetMousePos(); // shortcut to ImGui::GetIO().MousePos provided by user, to be consistent with other calls
1590IMGUI_API ImVec2
1591GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup(); // retrieve mouse position at the time of opening popup we have BeginPopup() into
1592 // (helper to avoid user backing that value themselves)
1593IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDragging(
1594 ImGuiMouseButton button,
1595 float lock_threshold = -1.0f); // is mouse dragging? (uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold if lock_threshold < 0.0f)
1596IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetMouseDragDelta(
1597 ImGuiMouseButton button = 0,
1598 float lock_threshold =
1599 -1.0f); // return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is pressed or was just
1600 // released. This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least
1601 // once (uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold if lock_threshold < 0.0f)
1602IMGUI_API void ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button = 0); //
1603IMGUI_API ImGuiMouseCursor
1604GetMouseCursor(); // get desired mouse cursor shape. Important: reset in ImGui::NewFrame(), this is updated during the
1605 // frame. valid before Render(). If you use software rendering by setting io.MouseDrawCursor ImGui
1606 // will render those for you
1607IMGUI_API void SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type); // set desired mouse cursor shape
1608IMGUI_API void SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse(
1609 bool want_capture_mouse); // Override io.WantCaptureMouse flag next frame (said flag is left for your application to
1610 // handle, typical when true it instructs your app to ignore inputs). This is equivalent
1611 // to setting "io.WantCaptureMouse = want_capture_mouse;" after the next NewFrame() call.
1612
1613// Clipboard Utilities
1614// - Also see the LogToClipboard() function to capture GUI into clipboard, or easily output text data to the clipboard.
1615IMGUI_API const char *GetClipboardText();
1616IMGUI_API void SetClipboardText(const char *text);
1617
1618// Settings/.Ini Utilities
1619// - The disk functions are automatically called if io.IniFilename != NULL (default is "imgui.ini").
1620// - Set io.IniFilename to NULL to load/save manually. Read io.WantSaveIniSettings description about handling .ini
1621// saving manually.
1622// - Important: default value "imgui.ini" is relative to current working dir! Most apps will want to lock this to an
1623// absolute path (e.g. same path as executables).
1624IMGUI_API void LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(
1625 const char *ini_filename); // call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame(). NewFrame()
1626 // automatically calls LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(io.IniFilename).
1627IMGUI_API void LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(
1628 const char *ini_data, size_t ini_size = 0); // call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame() to
1629 // provide .ini data from your own data source.
1630IMGUI_API void SaveIniSettingsToDisk(
1631 const char *ini_filename); // this is automatically called (if io.IniFilename is not empty) a few seconds after any
1632 // modification that should be reflected in the .ini file (and also by DestroyContext).
1633IMGUI_API const char *SaveIniSettingsToMemory(
1634 size_t *out_ini_size =
1635 NULL); // return a zero-terminated string with the .ini data which you can save by your own mean. call when
1636 // io.WantSaveIniSettings is set, then save data by your own mean and clear io.WantSaveIniSettings.
1637
1638// Debug Utilities
1639// - Your main debugging friend is the ShowMetricsWindow() function, which is also accessible from Demo->Tools->Metrics
1640// Debugger
1641IMGUI_API void DebugTextEncoding(const char *text);
1642IMGUI_API void DebugFlashStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx);
1643IMGUI_API void DebugStartItemPicker();
1644IMGUI_API bool DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char *version_str, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2,
1645 size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_drawvert,
1646 size_t sz_drawidx); // This is called by IMGUI_CHECKVERSION() macro.
1647#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
1648IMGUI_API void DebugLog(const char *fmt, ...)
1649 IM_FMTARGS(1); // Call via IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG() for maximum stripping in caller code!
1650IMGUI_API void DebugLogV(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(1);
1651#endif
1652
1653// Memory Allocators
1654// - Those functions are not reliant on the current context.
1655// - DLL users: heaps and globals are not shared across DLL boundaries! You will need to call SetCurrentContext() +
1656// SetAllocatorFunctions()
1657// for each static/DLL boundary you are calling from. Read "Context and Memory Allocators" section of imgui.cpp for
1658// more details.
1659IMGUI_API void SetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc free_func, void *user_data = NULL);
1660IMGUI_API void GetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc *p_alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc *p_free_func,
1661 void **p_user_data);
1662IMGUI_API void *MemAlloc(size_t size);
1663IMGUI_API void MemFree(void *ptr);
1664
1665// (Optional) Platform/OS interface for multi-viewport support
1666// Read comments around the ImGuiPlatformIO structure for more details.
1667// Note: You may use GetWindowViewport() to get the current viewport of the current window.
1668IMGUI_API void UpdatePlatformWindows(); // call in main loop. will call CreateWindow/ResizeWindow/etc. platform
1669 // functions for each secondary viewport, and DestroyWindow for each inactive
1670 // viewport.
1671IMGUI_API void RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(
1672 void *platform_render_arg = NULL,
1673 void *renderer_render_arg = NULL); // call in main loop. will call RenderWindow/SwapBuffers platform functions for
1674 // each secondary viewport which doesn't have the ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized
1675 // flag set. May be reimplemented by user for custom rendering needs.
1676IMGUI_API void DestroyPlatformWindows(); // call DestroyWindow platform functions for all viewports. call from backend
1677 // Shutdown() if you need to close platform windows before imgui shutdown.
1678 // otherwise will be called by DestroyContext().
1679IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport *FindViewportByID(ImGuiID id); // this is a helper for backends.
1680IMGUI_API ImGuiViewport *FindViewportByPlatformHandle(
1681 void *platform_handle); // this is a helper for backends. the type platform_handle is decided by the backend (e.g.
1682 // HWND, MyWindow*, GLFWwindow* etc.)
1683
1684} // namespace ImGui
1685
1686//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1687// [SECTION] Flags & Enumerations
1688//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1689
1690// Flags for ImGui::Begin()
1691// (Those are per-window flags. There are shared flags in ImGuiIO: io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges and
1692// io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly)
1693enum ImGuiWindowFlags_
1694{
1695 ImGuiWindowFlags_None = 0,
1696 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar = 1 << 0, // Disable title-bar
1697 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize = 1 << 1, // Disable user resizing with the lower-right grip
1698 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove = 1 << 2, // Disable user moving the window
1699 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar =
1700 1 << 3, // Disable scrollbars (window can still scroll with mouse or programmatically)
1701 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse =
1702 1 << 4, // Disable user vertically scrolling with mouse wheel. On child window, mouse wheel will be forwarded to
1703 // the parent unless NoScrollbar is also set.
1704 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse = 1 << 5, // Disable user collapsing window by double-clicking on it. Also referred to
1705 // as Window Menu Button (e.g. within a docking node).
1706 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize = 1 << 6, // Resize every window to its content every frame
1707 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground = 1 << 7, // Disable drawing background color (WindowBg, etc.) and outside border.
1708 // Similar as using SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f).
1709 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings = 1 << 8, // Never load/save settings in .ini file
1710 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs = 1 << 9, // Disable catching mouse, hovering test with pass through.
1711 ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar = 1 << 10, // Has a menu-bar
1712 ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar =
1713 1 << 11, // Allow horizontal scrollbar to appear (off by default). You may use
1714 // SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(width,0.0f)); prior to calling Begin() to specify width. Read code
1715 // in imgui_demo in the "Horizontal Scrolling" section.
1716 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1
1717 << 12, // Disable taking focus when transitioning from hidden to visible state
1718 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus = 1 << 13, // Disable bringing window to front when taking focus (e.g.
1719 // clicking on it or programmatically giving it focus)
1720 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar = 1
1721 << 14, // Always show vertical scrollbar (even if ContentSize.y < Size.y)
1722 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar =
1723 1 << 15, // Always show horizontal scrollbar (even if ContentSize.x < Size.x)
1724 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs = 1 << 16, // No keyboard/gamepad navigation within the window
1725 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus =
1726 1 << 17, // No focusing toward this window with keyboard/gamepad navigation (e.g. skipped by CTRL+TAB)
1727 ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument =
1728 1 << 18, // Display a dot next to the title. When used in a tab/docking context, tab is selected when clicking
1729 // the X + closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab). Otherwise closure is
1730 // assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.
1731 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking = 1 << 19, // Disable docking of this window
1732 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus,
1733 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDecoration = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize |
1734 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse,
1735 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs =
1736 ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus,
1737
1738 // [Internal]
1739 ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost = 1 << 23, // Don't use! For internal use by Begin()/NewFrame()
1740 ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow = 1 << 24, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginChild()
1741 ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip = 1 << 25, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginTooltip()
1742 ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup = 1 << 26, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopup()
1743 ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal = 1 << 27, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopupModal()
1744 ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu = 1 << 28, // Don't use! For internal use by BeginMenu()
1745
1746 // Obsolete names
1747#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1748 ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened =
1749 1 << 29, // Obsoleted in 1.90.9: Use ImGuiChildFlags_NavFlattened in BeginChild() call.
1750 ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding =
1751 1 << 30, // Obsoleted in 1.90.0: Use ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding in BeginChild() call.
1752#endif
1753};
1754
1755// Flags for ImGui::BeginChild()
1756// (Legacy: bit 0 must always correspond to ImGuiChildFlags_Borders to be backward compatible with old API using 'bool
1757// border = false'. About using AutoResizeX/AutoResizeY flags:
1758// - May be combined with SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() to set a min/max size for each axis (see
1759// "Demo->Child->Auto-resize with Constraints").
1760// - Size measurement for a given axis is only performed when the child window is within visible boundaries, or is just
1761// appearing.
1762// - This allows BeginChild() to return false when not within boundaries (e.g. when scrolling), which is more optimal.
1763// BUT it won't update its auto-size while clipped.
1764// While not perfect, it is a better default behavior as the always-on performance gain is more valuable than the
1765// occasional "resizing after becoming visible again" glitch.
1766// - You may also use ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysAutoResize to force an update even when child window is not in view.
1767// HOWEVER PLEASE UNDERSTAND THAT DOING SO WILL PREVENT BeginChild() FROM EVER RETURNING FALSE, disabling benefits
1768// of coarse clipping.
1769enum ImGuiChildFlags_
1770{
1771 ImGuiChildFlags_None = 0,
1772 ImGuiChildFlags_Borders = 1 << 0, // Show an outer border and enable WindowPadding. (IMPORTANT: this is always == 1
1773 // == true for legacy reason)
1774 ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding =
1775 1 << 1, // Pad with style.WindowPadding even if no border are drawn (no padding by default for non-bordered
1776 // child windows because it makes more sense)
1777 ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeX = 1 << 2, // Allow resize from right border (layout direction). Enable .ini saving (unless
1778 // ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings passed to window flags)
1779 ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY = 1 << 3, // Allow resize from bottom border (layout direction). "
1780 ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeX =
1781 1 << 4, // Enable auto-resizing width. Read "IMPORTANT: Size measurement" details above.
1782 ImGuiChildFlags_AutoResizeY =
1783 1 << 5, // Enable auto-resizing height. Read "IMPORTANT: Size measurement" details above.
1784 ImGuiChildFlags_AlwaysAutoResize =
1785 1 << 6, // Combined with AutoResizeX/AutoResizeY. Always measure size even when child is hidden, always return
1786 // true, always disable clipping optimization! NOT RECOMMENDED.
1787 ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle =
1788 1 << 7, // Style the child window like a framed item: use FrameBg, FrameRounding, FrameBorderSize, FramePadding
1789 // instead of ChildBg, ChildRounding, ChildBorderSize, WindowPadding.
1790 ImGuiChildFlags_NavFlattened = 1 << 8, // [BETA] Share focus scope, allow keyboard/gamepad navigation to cross over
1791 // parent border to this child or between sibling child windows.
1792
1793 // Obsolete names
1794#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1795 ImGuiChildFlags_Border = ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, // Renamed in 1.91.1 (August 2024) for consistency.
1796#endif
1797};
1798
1799// Flags for ImGui::PushItemFlag()
1800// (Those are shared by all items)
1801enum ImGuiItemFlags_
1802{
1803 ImGuiItemFlags_None = 0, // (Default)
1804 ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop =
1805 1 << 0, // false // Disable keyboard tabbing. This is a "lighter" version of ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav.
1806 ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav = 1 << 1, // false // Disable any form of focusing (keyboard/gamepad directional navigation
1807 // and SetKeyboardFocusHere() calls).
1808 ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus =
1809 1 << 2, // false // Disable item being a candidate for default focus (e.g. used by title bar items).
1810 ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat = 1 << 3, // false // Any button-like behavior will have repeat mode enabled (based
1811 // on io.KeyRepeatDelay and io.KeyRepeatRate values). Note that you can also
1812 // call IsItemActive() after any button to tell if it is being held.
1813 ImGuiItemFlags_AutoClosePopups =
1814 1 << 4, // true // MenuItem()/Selectable() automatically close their parent popup window.
1815 ImGuiItemFlags_AllowDuplicateId =
1816 1 << 5, // false // Allow submitting an item with the same identifier as an item already submitted this frame
1817 // without triggering a warning tooltip if io.ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflicts is set.
1818};
1819
1820// Flags for ImGui::InputText()
1821// (Those are per-item flags. There are shared flags in ImGuiIO: io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink and
1822// io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive)
1823enum ImGuiInputTextFlags_
1824{
1825 // Basic filters (also see ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter)
1826 ImGuiInputTextFlags_None = 0,
1827 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal = 1 << 0, // Allow 0123456789.+-*/
1828 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal = 1 << 1, // Allow 0123456789ABCDEFabcdef
1829 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific = 1 << 2, // Allow 0123456789.+-*/eE (Scientific notation input)
1830 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase = 1 << 3, // Turn a..z into A..Z
1831 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank = 1 << 4, // Filter out spaces, tabs
1832
1833 // Inputs
1834 ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput = 1 << 5, // Pressing TAB input a '\t' character into the text field
1835 ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue =
1836 1 << 6, // Return 'true' when Enter is pressed (as opposed to every time the value was modified). Consider using
1837 // IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() instead!
1838 ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll = 1 << 7, // Escape key clears content if not empty, and deactivate otherwise
1839 // (contrast to default behavior of Escape to revert)
1840 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine =
1841 1 << 8, // In multi-line mode, validate with Enter, add new line with Ctrl+Enter (default is opposite: validate
1842 // with Ctrl+Enter, add line with Enter).
1843
1844 // Other options
1845 ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly = 1 << 9, // Read-only mode
1846 ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password = 1 << 10, // Password mode, display all characters as '*', disable copy
1847 ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite = 1 << 11, // Overwrite mode
1848 ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll = 1 << 12, // Select entire text when first taking mouse focus
1849 ImGuiInputTextFlags_ParseEmptyRefVal =
1850 1 << 13, // InputFloat(), InputInt(), InputScalar() etc. only: parse empty string as zero value.
1851 ImGuiInputTextFlags_DisplayEmptyRefVal =
1852 1 << 14, // InputFloat(), InputInt(), InputScalar() etc. only: when value is zero, do not display it. Generally
1853 // used with ImGuiInputTextFlags_ParseEmptyRefVal.
1854 ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll = 1 << 15, // Disable following the cursor horizontally
1855 ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo =
1856 1 << 16, // Disable undo/redo. Note that input text owns the text data while active, if you want to provide your
1857 // own undo/redo stack you need e.g. to call ClearActiveID().
1858
1859 // Elide display / Alignment
1860 ImGuiInputTextFlags_ElideLeft = 1 << 17, // When text doesn't fit, elide left side to ensure right side stays
1861 // visible. Useful for path/filenames. Single-line only!
1862
1863 // Callback features
1864 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion = 1 << 18, // Callback on pressing TAB (for completion handling)
1865 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory = 1 << 19, // Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows (for history handling)
1866 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways =
1867 1 << 20, // Callback on each iteration. User code may query cursor position, modify text buffer.
1868 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter =
1869 1 << 21, // Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard,
1870 // or return 1 in callback to discard.
1871 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize =
1872 1 << 22, // Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string
1873 // to grow. Notify when the string wants to be resized (for string types which hold a cache of their
1874 // Size). You will be provided a new BufSize in the callback and NEED to honor it. (see
1875 // misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example of using this)
1876 ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit =
1877 1 << 23, // Callback on any edit. Note that InputText() already returns true on edit + you can always use
1878 // IsItemEdited(). The callback is useful to manipulate the underlying buffer while focus is active.
1879
1880 // Obsolete names
1881 // ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysInsertMode = ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite // [renamed in 1.82] name was not
1882 // matching behavior
1883};
1884
1885// Flags for ImGui::TreeNodeEx(), ImGui::CollapsingHeader*()
1886enum ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_
1887{
1888 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None = 0,
1889 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected = 1 << 0, // Draw as selected
1890 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed = 1 << 1, // Draw frame with background (e.g. for CollapsingHeader)
1891 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap = 1 << 2, // Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one
1892 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen =
1893 1 << 3, // Don't do a TreePush() when open (e.g. for CollapsingHeader) = no extra indent nor pushing on ID stack
1894 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog = 1 << 4, // Don't automatically and temporarily open node when Logging is active
1895 // (by default logging will automatically open tree nodes)
1896 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen = 1 << 5, // Default node to be open
1897 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick =
1898 1 << 6, // Open on double-click instead of simple click (default for multi-select unless any _OpenOnXXX behavior
1899 // is set explicitly). Both behaviors may be combined.
1900 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow =
1901 1 << 7, // Open when clicking on the arrow part (default for multi-select unless any _OpenOnXXX behavior is set
1902 // explicitly). Both behaviors may be combined.
1903 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf = 1 << 8, // No collapsing, no arrow (use as a convenience for leaf nodes).
1904 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet = 1 << 9, // Display a bullet instead of arrow. IMPORTANT: node can still be marked
1905 // open/close if you don't set the _Leaf flag!
1906 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_FramePadding =
1907 1 << 10, // Use FramePadding (even for an unframed text node) to vertically align text baseline to regular
1908 // widget height. Equivalent to calling AlignTextToFramePadding() before the node.
1909 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth =
1910 1 << 11, // Extend hit box to the right-most edge, even if not framed. This is not the default in order to allow
1911 // adding other items on the same line without using AllowOverlap mode.
1912 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth =
1913 1 << 12, // Extend hit box to the left-most and right-most edges (cover the indent area).
1914 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth =
1915 1 << 13, // Narrow hit box + narrow hovering highlight, will only cover the label text.
1916 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns =
1917 1 << 14, // Frame will span all columns of its container table (label will still fit in current column)
1918 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_LabelSpanAllColumns = 1 << 15, // Label will span all columns of its container table
1919 // ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoScrollOnOpen = 1 << 16, // FIXME: TODO: Disable automatic scroll on TreePop() if node
1920 // got just open and contents is not visible
1921 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere = 1 << 17, // (WIP) Nav: left direction may move to this TreeNode() from any
1922 // of its child (items submitted between TreeNode and TreePop)
1923 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader =
1924 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog,
1925
1926#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1927 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap, // Renamed in 1.89.7
1928 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanTextWidth = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth, // Renamed in 1.90.7
1929#endif
1930};
1931
1932// Flags for OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(), IsPopupOpen() functions.
1933// - To be backward compatible with older API which took an 'int mouse_button = 1' argument instead of 'ImGuiPopupFlags
1934// flags',
1935// we need to treat small flags values as a mouse button index, so we encode the mouse button in the first few bits of
1936// the flags. It is therefore guaranteed to be legal to pass a mouse button index in ImGuiPopupFlags.
1937// - For the same reason, we exceptionally default the ImGuiPopupFlags argument of BeginPopupContextXXX functions to 1
1938// instead of 0.
1939// IMPORTANT: because the default parameter is 1 (==ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight), if you rely on the default
1940// parameter and want to use another flag, you need to pass in the ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight flag explicitly.
1941// - Multiple buttons currently cannot be combined/or-ed in those functions (we could allow it later).
1942enum ImGuiPopupFlags_
1943{
1944 ImGuiPopupFlags_None = 0,
1945 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonLeft = 0, // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Left Mouse release. Guaranteed to always
1946 // be == 0 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Left)
1947 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight = 1, // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Right Mouse release. Guaranteed to always
1948 // be == 1 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Right)
1949 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMiddle = 2, // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Middle Mouse release. Guaranteed to
1950 // always be == 2 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Middle)
1951 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_ = 0x1F,
1952 ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonDefault_ = 1,
1953 ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopen = 1 << 5, // For OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(): don't reopen same popup if already
1954 // open (won't reposition, won't reinitialize navigation)
1955 // ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopenAlwaysNavInit = 1 << 6, // For OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(): focus and initialize
1956 // navigation even when not reopening.
1957 ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup = 1 << 7, // For OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(): don't open if there's
1958 // already a popup at the same level of the popup stack
1959 ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems =
1960 1 << 8, // For BeginPopupContextWindow(): don't return true when hovering items, only when hovering empty space
1961 ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId = 1 << 10, // For IsPopupOpen(): ignore the ImGuiID parameter and test for any popup.
1962 ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel =
1963 1 << 11, // For IsPopupOpen(): search/test at any level of the popup stack (default test in the current level)
1964 ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopup = ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId | ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel,
1965};
1966
1967// Flags for ImGui::Selectable()
1968enum ImGuiSelectableFlags_
1969{
1970 ImGuiSelectableFlags_None = 0,
1971 ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoAutoClosePopups =
1972 1 << 0, // Clicking this doesn't close parent popup window (overrides ImGuiItemFlags_AutoClosePopups)
1973 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns =
1974 1 << 1, // Frame will span all columns of its container table (text will still fit in current column)
1975 ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick = 1 << 2, // Generate press events on double clicks too
1976 ImGuiSelectableFlags_Disabled = 1 << 3, // Cannot be selected, display grayed out text
1977 ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap = 1 << 4, // (WIP) Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one
1978 ImGuiSelectableFlags_Highlight = 1 << 5, // Make the item be displayed as if it is hovered
1979
1980#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1981 ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups = ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoAutoClosePopups, // Renamed in 1.91.0
1982 ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowItemOverlap = ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap, // Renamed in 1.89.7
1983#endif
1984};
1985
1986// Flags for ImGui::BeginCombo()
1987enum ImGuiComboFlags_
1988{
1989 ImGuiComboFlags_None = 0,
1990 ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft = 1 << 0, // Align the popup toward the left by default
1991 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall =
1992 1 << 1, // Max ~4 items visible. Tip: If you want your combo popup to be a specific size you can use
1993 // SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() prior to calling BeginCombo()
1994 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular = 1 << 2, // Max ~8 items visible (default)
1995 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge = 1 << 3, // Max ~20 items visible
1996 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest = 1 << 4, // As many fitting items as possible
1997 ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton = 1 << 5, // Display on the preview box without the square arrow button
1998 ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview = 1 << 6, // Display only a square arrow button
1999 ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview = 1 << 7, // Width dynamically calculated from preview contents
2000 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_ = ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular |
2001 ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest,
2002};
2003
2004// Flags for ImGui::BeginTabBar()
2005enum ImGuiTabBarFlags_
2006{
2007 ImGuiTabBarFlags_None = 0,
2008 ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable =
2009 1 << 0, // Allow manually dragging tabs to re-order them + New tabs are appended at the end of list
2010 ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs = 1 << 1, // Automatically select new tabs when they appear
2011 ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton = 1 << 2, // Disable buttons to open the tab list popup
2012 ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton =
2013 1 << 3, // Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != NULL) with middle mouse button.
2014 // You may handle this behavior manually on user's side with if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2))
2015 // *p_open = false.
2016 ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButtons =
2017 1 << 4, // Disable scrolling buttons (apply when fitting policy is ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll)
2018 ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 5, // Disable tooltips when hovering a tab
2019 ImGuiTabBarFlags_DrawSelectedOverline = 1 << 6, // Draw selected overline markers over selected tab
2020 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown = 1 << 7, // Resize tabs when they don't fit
2021 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll = 1 << 8, // Add scroll buttons when tabs don't fit
2022 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ =
2023 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown | ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll,
2024 ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_ = ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown,
2025};
2026
2027// Flags for ImGui::BeginTabItem()
2028enum ImGuiTabItemFlags_
2029{
2030 ImGuiTabItemFlags_None = 0,
2031 ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument =
2032 1 << 0, // Display a dot next to the title + set ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoAssumedClosure.
2033 ImGuiTabItemFlags_SetSelected =
2034 1 << 1, // Trigger flag to programmatically make the tab selected when calling BeginTabItem()
2035 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton =
2036 1 << 2, // Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != NULL) with middle mouse button.
2037 // You may handle this behavior manually on user's side with if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2))
2038 // *p_open = false.
2039 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId = 1 << 3, // Don't call PushID()/PopID() on BeginTabItem()/EndTabItem()
2040 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 4, // Disable tooltip for the given tab
2041 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder = 1 << 5, // Disable reordering this tab or having another tab cross over this tab
2042 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading =
2043 1 << 6, // Enforce the tab position to the left of the tab bar (after the tab list popup button)
2044 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing =
2045 1 << 7, // Enforce the tab position to the right of the tab bar (before the scrolling buttons)
2046 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoAssumedClosure =
2047 1 << 8, // Tab is selected when trying to close + closure is not immediately assumed (will wait for user to stop
2048 // submitting the tab). Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the
2049 // tab may reappear at end of tab bar.
2050};
2051
2052// Flags for ImGui::IsWindowFocused()
2053enum ImGuiFocusedFlags_
2054{
2055 ImGuiFocusedFlags_None = 0,
2056 ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows = 1 << 0, // Return true if any children of the window is focused
2057 ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow = 1 << 1, // Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
2058 ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow =
2059 1 << 2, // Return true if any window is focused. Important: If you are trying to tell how to dispatch your
2060 // low-level inputs, do NOT use this. Use 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ!
2061 ImGuiFocusedFlags_NoPopupHierarchy = 1 << 3, // Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as
2062 // parent of popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
2063 ImGuiFocusedFlags_DockHierarchy = 1 << 4, // Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked
2064 // window) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
2065 ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootAndChildWindows = ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows,
2066};
2067
2068// Flags for ImGui::IsItemHovered(), ImGui::IsWindowHovered()
2069// Note: if you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to Dear ImGui or to your app, you should use
2070// 'io.WantCaptureMouse' instead! Please read the FAQ! Note: windows with the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs flag are ignored
2071// by IsWindowHovered() calls.
2072enum ImGuiHoveredFlags_
2073{
2074 ImGuiHoveredFlags_None = 0, // Return true if directly over the item/window, not obstructed by another window, not
2075 // obstructed by an active popup or modal blocking inputs under them.
2076 ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows =
2077 1 << 0, // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any children of the window is hovered
2078 ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow =
2079 1 << 1, // IsWindowHovered() only: Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy)
2080 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow = 1 << 2, // IsWindowHovered() only: Return true if any window is hovered
2081 ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy =
2082 1 << 3, // IsWindowHovered() only: Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as parent of
2083 // popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
2084 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DockHierarchy =
2085 1 << 4, // IsWindowHovered() only: Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked window)
2086 // (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow)
2087 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup =
2088 1 << 5, // Return true even if a popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window
2089 // ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByModal = 1 << 6, // Return true even if a modal popup window is normally
2090 // blocking access to this item/window. FIXME-TODO: Unavailable yet.
2091 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem = 1 << 7, // Return true even if an active item is blocking access to
2092 // this item/window. Useful for Drag and Drop patterns.
2093 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByItem =
2094 1 << 8, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item uses AllowOverlap mode and is overlapped by
2095 // another hoverable item.
2096 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByWindow =
2097 1 << 9, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the position is obstructed or overlapped by another window.
2098 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled = 1 << 10, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true even if the item is disabled
2099 ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoNavOverride =
2100 1
2101 << 11, // IsItemHovered() only: Disable using keyboard/gamepad navigation state when active, always query mouse
2102 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped =
2103 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByItem | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlappedByWindow,
2104 ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly = ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup |
2105 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped,
2106 ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootAndChildWindows = ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows,
2107
2108 // Tooltips mode
2109 // - typically used in IsItemHovered() + SetTooltip() sequence.
2110 // - this is a shortcut to pull flags from 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse' or 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav'
2111 // where you can reconfigure desired behavior.
2112 // e.g. 'TooltipHoveredFlagsForMouse' defaults to 'ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort'.
2113 // - for frequently actioned or hovered items providing a tooltip, you want may to use ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip
2114 // (stationary + delay) so the tooltip doesn't show too often.
2115 // - for items which main purpose is to be hovered, or items with low affordance, or in less consistent apps, prefer
2116 // no delay or shorter delay.
2117 ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip =
2118 1 << 12, // Shortcut for standard flags when using IsItemHovered() + SetTooltip() sequence.
2119
2120 // (Advanced) Mouse Hovering delays.
2121 // - generally you can use ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip to use application-standardized flags.
2122 // - use those if you need specific overrides.
2123 ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary = 1 << 13, // Require mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (~0.15 sec)
2124 // _at least one time_. After this, can move on same item/window. Using the
2125 // stationary test tends to reduces the need for a long delay.
2126 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone = 1 << 14, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true immediately (default). As this is the
2127 // default you generally ignore this.
2128 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort =
2129 1 << 15, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true after style.HoverDelayShort elapsed (~0.15 sec) (shared between
2130 // items) + requires mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (once per item).
2131 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal =
2132 1 << 16, // IsItemHovered() only: Return true after style.HoverDelayNormal elapsed (~0.40 sec) (shared between
2133 // items) + requires mouse to be stationary for style.HoverStationaryDelay (once per item).
2134 ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay =
2135 1 << 17, // IsItemHovered() only: Disable shared delay system where moving from one item to the next keeps the
2136 // previous timer for a short time (standard for tooltips with long delays)
2137};
2138
2139// Flags for ImGui::DockSpace(), shared/inherited by child nodes.
2140// (Some flags can be applied to individual nodes directly)
2141// FIXME-DOCK: Also see ImGuiDockNodeFlagsPrivate_ which may involve using the WIP and internal DockBuilder api.
2142enum ImGuiDockNodeFlags_
2143{
2144 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None = 0,
2145 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly = 1 << 0, // // Don't display the dockspace node but keep it alive. Windows
2146 // docked into this dockspace node won't be undocked.
2147 // ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCentralNode = 1 << 1, // // Disable Central Node (the node which can
2148 // stay empty)
2149 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode =
2150 1 << 2, // // Disable docking over the Central Node, which will be always kept empty.
2151 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode =
2152 1
2153 << 3, // // Enable passthru dockspace: 1) DockSpace() will render a ImGuiCol_WindowBg background covering
2154 // everything excepted the Central Node when empty. Meaning the host window should probably use
2155 // SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0f) prior to Begin() when using this. 2) When Central Node is empty: let
2156 // inputs pass-through + won't display a DockingEmptyBg background. See demo for details.
2157 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit = 1 << 4, // // Disable other windows/nodes from splitting this node.
2158 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize = 1 << 5, // Saved // Disable resizing node using the splitter/separators. Useful with
2159 // programmatically setup dockspaces.
2160 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar =
2161 1 << 6, // // Tab bar will automatically hide when there is a single window in the dock node.
2162 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoUndocking = 1 << 7, // // Disable undocking this node.
2163
2164#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2165 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoSplit = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit, // Renamed in 1.90
2166 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingInCentralNode = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode, // Renamed in 1.90
2167#endif
2168};
2169
2170// Flags for ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(), ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload()
2171enum ImGuiDragDropFlags_
2172{
2173 ImGuiDragDropFlags_None = 0,
2174 // BeginDragDropSource() flags
2175 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip =
2176 1 << 0, // Disable preview tooltip. By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you
2177 // can display a preview or description of the source contents. This flag disables this behavior.
2178 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover =
2179 1 << 1, // By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered() will return false, to avoid
2180 // subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disables this behavior so you can still call
2181 // IsItemHovered() on the source item.
2182 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers =
2183 1 << 2, // Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by holding over them while
2184 // dragging a source item.
2185 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID =
2186 1 << 3, // Allow items such as Text(), Image() that have no unique identifier to be used as drag source, by
2187 // manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their window-relative position. This is extremely
2188 // unusual within the dear imgui ecosystem and so we made it explicit.
2189 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern =
2190 1 << 4, // External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current item/window info. Will
2191 // always return true. Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.
2192 ImGuiDragDropFlags_PayloadAutoExpire = 1 << 5, // Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be
2193 // submitted (otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged)
2194 ImGuiDragDropFlags_PayloadNoCrossContext =
2195 1 << 6, // Hint to specify that the payload may not be copied outside current dear imgui context.
2196 ImGuiDragDropFlags_PayloadNoCrossProcess =
2197 1 << 7, // Hint to specify that the payload may not be copied outside current process.
2198 // AcceptDragDropPayload() flags
2199 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery =
2200 1 << 10, // AcceptDragDropPayload() will returns true even before the mouse button is released. You can then
2201 // call IsDelivery() to test if the payload needs to be delivered.
2202 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect =
2203 1 << 11, // Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.
2204 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip =
2205 1 << 12, // Request hiding the BeginDragDropSource tooltip from the BeginDragDropTarget site.
2206 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly =
2207 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery |
2208 ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect, // For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.
2209
2210#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2211 ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload = ImGuiDragDropFlags_PayloadAutoExpire, // Renamed in 1.90.9
2212#endif
2213};
2214
2215// Standard Drag and Drop payload types. You can define you own payload types using short strings. Types starting with
2216// '_' are defined by Dear ImGui.
2217#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F \
2218 "_COL3F" // float[3]: Standard type for colors, without alpha. User code may use this type.
2219#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F "_COL4F" // float[4]: Standard type for colors. User code may use this type.
2220
2221// A primary data type
2222enum ImGuiDataType_
2223{
2224 ImGuiDataType_S8, // signed char / char (with sensible compilers)
2225 ImGuiDataType_U8, // unsigned char
2226 ImGuiDataType_S16, // short
2227 ImGuiDataType_U16, // unsigned short
2228 ImGuiDataType_S32, // int
2229 ImGuiDataType_U32, // unsigned int
2230 ImGuiDataType_S64, // long long / __int64
2231 ImGuiDataType_U64, // unsigned long long / unsigned __int64
2232 ImGuiDataType_Float, // float
2233 ImGuiDataType_Double, // double
2234 ImGuiDataType_Bool, // bool (provided for user convenience, not supported by scalar widgets)
2235 ImGuiDataType_String, // char* (provided for user convenience, not supported by scalar widgets)
2236 ImGuiDataType_COUNT
2237};
2238
2239// A cardinal direction
2240enum ImGuiDir : int
2241{
2242 ImGuiDir_None = -1,
2243 ImGuiDir_Left = 0,
2244 ImGuiDir_Right = 1,
2245 ImGuiDir_Up = 2,
2246 ImGuiDir_Down = 3,
2247 ImGuiDir_COUNT
2248};
2249
2250// A sorting direction
2251enum ImGuiSortDirection : ImU8
2252{
2253 ImGuiSortDirection_None = 0,
2254 ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending = 1, // Ascending = 0->9, A->Z etc.
2255 ImGuiSortDirection_Descending = 2 // Descending = 9->0, Z->A etc.
2256};
2257
2258// A key identifier (ImGuiKey_XXX or ImGuiMod_XXX value): can represent Keyboard, Mouse and Gamepad values.
2259// All our named keys are >= 512. Keys value 0 to 511 are left unused and were legacy native/opaque key values (< 1.87).
2260// Support for legacy keys was completely removed in 1.91.5.
2261// Read details about the 1.87+ transition : https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4921
2262// Note that "Keys" related to physical keys and are not the same concept as input "Characters", the later are submitted
2263// via io.AddInputCharacter(). The keyboard key enum values are named after the keys on a standard US keyboard, and on
2264// other keyboard types the keys reported may not match the keycaps.
2265enum ImGuiKey : int
2266{
2267 // Keyboard
2268 ImGuiKey_None = 0,
2269 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN = 512, // First valid key value (other than 0)
2270
2271 ImGuiKey_Tab = 512, // == ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN
2272 ImGuiKey_LeftArrow,
2273 ImGuiKey_RightArrow,
2274 ImGuiKey_UpArrow,
2275 ImGuiKey_DownArrow,
2276 ImGuiKey_PageUp,
2277 ImGuiKey_PageDown,
2278 ImGuiKey_Home,
2279 ImGuiKey_End,
2280 ImGuiKey_Insert,
2281 ImGuiKey_Delete,
2282 ImGuiKey_Backspace,
2283 ImGuiKey_Space,
2284 ImGuiKey_Enter,
2285 ImGuiKey_Escape,
2286 ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl,
2287 ImGuiKey_LeftShift,
2288 ImGuiKey_LeftAlt,
2289 ImGuiKey_LeftSuper,
2290 ImGuiKey_RightCtrl,
2291 ImGuiKey_RightShift,
2292 ImGuiKey_RightAlt,
2293 ImGuiKey_RightSuper,
2294 ImGuiKey_Menu,
2295 ImGuiKey_0,
2296 ImGuiKey_1,
2297 ImGuiKey_2,
2298 ImGuiKey_3,
2299 ImGuiKey_4,
2300 ImGuiKey_5,
2301 ImGuiKey_6,
2302 ImGuiKey_7,
2303 ImGuiKey_8,
2304 ImGuiKey_9,
2305 ImGuiKey_A,
2306 ImGuiKey_B,
2307 ImGuiKey_C,
2308 ImGuiKey_D,
2309 ImGuiKey_E,
2310 ImGuiKey_F,
2311 ImGuiKey_G,
2312 ImGuiKey_H,
2313 ImGuiKey_I,
2314 ImGuiKey_J,
2315 ImGuiKey_K,
2316 ImGuiKey_L,
2317 ImGuiKey_M,
2318 ImGuiKey_N,
2319 ImGuiKey_O,
2320 ImGuiKey_P,
2321 ImGuiKey_Q,
2322 ImGuiKey_R,
2323 ImGuiKey_S,
2324 ImGuiKey_T,
2325 ImGuiKey_U,
2326 ImGuiKey_V,
2327 ImGuiKey_W,
2328 ImGuiKey_X,
2329 ImGuiKey_Y,
2330 ImGuiKey_Z,
2331 ImGuiKey_F1,
2332 ImGuiKey_F2,
2333 ImGuiKey_F3,
2334 ImGuiKey_F4,
2335 ImGuiKey_F5,
2336 ImGuiKey_F6,
2337 ImGuiKey_F7,
2338 ImGuiKey_F8,
2339 ImGuiKey_F9,
2340 ImGuiKey_F10,
2341 ImGuiKey_F11,
2342 ImGuiKey_F12,
2343 ImGuiKey_F13,
2344 ImGuiKey_F14,
2345 ImGuiKey_F15,
2346 ImGuiKey_F16,
2347 ImGuiKey_F17,
2348 ImGuiKey_F18,
2349 ImGuiKey_F19,
2350 ImGuiKey_F20,
2351 ImGuiKey_F21,
2352 ImGuiKey_F22,
2353 ImGuiKey_F23,
2354 ImGuiKey_F24,
2355 ImGuiKey_Apostrophe, // '
2356 ImGuiKey_Comma, // ,
2357 ImGuiKey_Minus, // -
2358 ImGuiKey_Period, // .
2359 ImGuiKey_Slash, // /
2360 ImGuiKey_Semicolon, // ;
2361 ImGuiKey_Equal, // =
2362 ImGuiKey_LeftBracket, // [
2363 ImGuiKey_Backslash, // \ (this text inhibit multiline comment caused by backslash)
2364 ImGuiKey_RightBracket, // ]
2365 ImGuiKey_GraveAccent, // `
2366 ImGuiKey_CapsLock,
2367 ImGuiKey_ScrollLock,
2368 ImGuiKey_NumLock,
2369 ImGuiKey_PrintScreen,
2370 ImGuiKey_Pause,
2371 ImGuiKey_Keypad0,
2372 ImGuiKey_Keypad1,
2373 ImGuiKey_Keypad2,
2374 ImGuiKey_Keypad3,
2375 ImGuiKey_Keypad4,
2376 ImGuiKey_Keypad5,
2377 ImGuiKey_Keypad6,
2378 ImGuiKey_Keypad7,
2379 ImGuiKey_Keypad8,
2380 ImGuiKey_Keypad9,
2381 ImGuiKey_KeypadDecimal,
2382 ImGuiKey_KeypadDivide,
2383 ImGuiKey_KeypadMultiply,
2384 ImGuiKey_KeypadSubtract,
2385 ImGuiKey_KeypadAdd,
2386 ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter,
2387 ImGuiKey_KeypadEqual,
2388 ImGuiKey_AppBack, // Available on some keyboard/mouses. Often referred as "Browser Back"
2389 ImGuiKey_AppForward,
2390 ImGuiKey_Oem102, // Non-US backslash.
2391
2392 // Gamepad (some of those are analog values, 0.0f to 1.0f) // NAVIGATION ACTION
2393 // (download controller mapping PNG/PSD at http://dearimgui.com/controls_sheets)
