2394 ImGuiKey_GamepadStart, // Menu (Xbox) + (Switch) Start/Options (PS)
2395 ImGuiKey_GamepadBack, // View (Xbox) - (Switch) Share (PS)
2396 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft, // X (Xbox) Y (Switch) Square (PS) // Tap: Toggle Menu. Hold: Windowing
2397 // mode (Focus/Move/Resize windows)
2398 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight, // B (Xbox) A (Switch) Circle (PS) // Cancel / Close / Exit
2399 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp, // Y (Xbox) X (Switch) Triangle (PS) // Text Input / On-screen Keyboard
2400 ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown, // A (Xbox) B (Switch) Cross (PS) // Activate / Open / Toggle / Tweak
2401 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadLeft, // D-pad Left // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in
2402 // Windowing mode)
2403 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadRight, // D-pad Right // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in
2404 // Windowing mode)
2405 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadUp, // D-pad Up // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in
2406 // Windowing mode)
2407 ImGuiKey_GamepadDpadDown, // D-pad Down // Move / Tweak / Resize Window (in
2408 // Windowing mode)
2409 ImGuiKey_GamepadL1, // L Bumper (Xbox) L (Switch) L1 (PS) // Tweak Slower / Focus Previous (in
2410 // Windowing mode)
2411 ImGuiKey_GamepadR1, // R Bumper (Xbox) R (Switch) R1 (PS) // Tweak Faster / Focus Next (in Windowing
2412 // mode)
2413 ImGuiKey_GamepadL2, // L Trig. (Xbox) ZL (Switch) L2 (PS) [Analog]
2414 ImGuiKey_GamepadR2, // R Trig. (Xbox) ZR (Switch) R2 (PS) [Analog]
2415 ImGuiKey_GamepadL3, // L Stick (Xbox) L3 (Switch) L3 (PS)
2416 ImGuiKey_GamepadR3, // R Stick (Xbox) R3 (Switch) R3 (PS)
2417 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickLeft, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
2418 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickRight, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
2419 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickUp, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
2420 ImGuiKey_GamepadLStickDown, // [Analog] // Move Window (in Windowing mode)
2421 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickLeft, // [Analog]
2422 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickRight, // [Analog]
2423 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickUp, // [Analog]
2424 ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickDown, // [Analog]
2425
2426 // Aliases: Mouse Buttons (auto-submitted from AddMouseButtonEvent() calls)
2427 // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.MouseDown[], io.MouseWheel, in a format allowing them to be
2428 // accessed via standard key API.
2429 ImGuiKey_MouseLeft,
2430 ImGuiKey_MouseRight,
2431 ImGuiKey_MouseMiddle,
2432 ImGuiKey_MouseX1,
2433 ImGuiKey_MouseX2,
2434 ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX,
2435 ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY,
2436
2437 // [Internal] Reserved for mod storage
2438 ImGuiKey_ReservedForModCtrl,
2439 ImGuiKey_ReservedForModShift,
2440 ImGuiKey_ReservedForModAlt,
2441 ImGuiKey_ReservedForModSuper,
2442 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END,
2443
2444 // Keyboard Modifiers (explicitly submitted by backend via AddKeyEvent() calls)
2445 // - This is mirroring the data also written to io.KeyCtrl, io.KeyShift, io.KeyAlt, io.KeySuper, in a format
2446 // allowing
2447 // them to be accessed via standard key API, allowing calls such as IsKeyPressed(), IsKeyReleased(), querying
2448 // duration etc.
2449 // - Code polling every key (e.g. an interface to detect a key press for input mapping) might want to ignore those
2450 // and prefer using the real keys (e.g. ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl, ImGuiKey_RightCtrl instead of ImGuiMod_Ctrl).
2451 // - In theory the value of keyboard modifiers should be roughly equivalent to a logical or of the equivalent
2452 // left/right keys.
2453 // In practice: it's complicated; mods are often provided from different sources. Keyboard layout, IME, sticky
2454 // keys and backends tend to interfere and break that equivalence. The safer decision is to relay that ambiguity
2455 // down to the end-user...
2456 // - On macOS, we swap Cmd(Super) and Ctrl keys at the time of the io.AddKeyEvent() call.
2457 ImGuiMod_None = 0,
2458 ImGuiMod_Ctrl = 1 << 12, // Ctrl (non-macOS), Cmd (macOS)
2459 ImGuiMod_Shift = 1 << 13, // Shift
2460 ImGuiMod_Alt = 1 << 14, // Option/Menu
2461 ImGuiMod_Super = 1 << 15, // Windows/Super (non-macOS), Ctrl (macOS)
2462 ImGuiMod_Mask_ = 0xF000, // 4-bits
2463
2464 // [Internal] If you need to iterate all keys (for e.g. an input mapper) you may use
2465 // ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN..ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END.
2466 ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN,
2467 // ImGuiKey_KeysData_SIZE = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT, // Size of KeysData[]: only hold named keys
2468 // ImGuiKey_KeysData_OFFSET = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN, // Accesses to io.KeysData[] must use (key -
2469 // ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN) index.
2470
2471#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2472 ImGuiKey_COUNT = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END, // Obsoleted in 1.91.5 because it was extremely misleading (since named keys
2473 // don't start at 0 anymore)
2474 ImGuiMod_Shortcut = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, // Removed in 1.90.7, you can now simply use ImGuiMod_Ctrl
2475 ImGuiKey_ModCtrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl,
2476 ImGuiKey_ModShift = ImGuiMod_Shift,
2477 ImGuiKey_ModAlt = ImGuiMod_Alt,
2478 ImGuiKey_ModSuper = ImGuiMod_Super, // Renamed in 1.89
2479 // ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter = ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, // Renamed in 1.87
2480#endif
2481};
2482
2483// Flags for Shortcut(), SetNextItemShortcut(),
2484// (and for upcoming extended versions of IsKeyPressed(), IsMouseClicked(), Shortcut(), SetKeyOwner(), SetItemKeyOwner()
2485// that are still in imgui_internal.h) Don't mistake with ImGuiInputTextFlags! (which is for ImGui::InputText()
2486// function)
2487enum ImGuiInputFlags_
2488{
2489 ImGuiInputFlags_None = 0,
2490 ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat = 1 << 0, // Enable repeat. Return true on successive repeats. Default for legacy
2491 // IsKeyPressed(). NOT Default for legacy IsMouseClicked(). MUST BE == 1.
2492
2493 // Flags for Shortcut(), SetNextItemShortcut()
2494 // - Routing policies: RouteGlobal+OverActive >> RouteActive or RouteFocused (if owner is active item) >>
2495 // RouteGlobal+OverFocused >> RouteFocused (if in focused window stack) >> RouteGlobal.
2496 // - Default policy is RouteFocused. Can select only 1 policy among all available.
2497 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive = 1 << 10, // Route to active item only.
2498 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused = 1 << 11, // Route to windows in the focus stack (DEFAULT). Deep-most focused window
2499 // takes inputs. Active item takes inputs over deep-most focused window.
2500 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal =
2501 1 << 12, // Global route (unless a focused window or active item registered the route).
2502 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways = 1 << 13, // Do not register route, poll keys directly.
2503 // - Routing options
2504 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused =
2505 1 << 14, // Option: global route: higher priority than focused route (unless active item in focused route).
2506 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive =
2507 1
2508 << 15, // Option: global route: higher priority than active item. Unlikely you need to use that: will interfere
2509 // with every active items, e.g. CTRL+A registered by InputText will be overridden by this. May not be
2510 // fully honored as user/internal code is likely to always assume they can access keys when active.
2511 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused =
2512 1 << 16, // Option: global route: will not be applied if underlying background/void is focused (== no Dear ImGui
2513 // windows are focused). Useful for overlay applications.
2514 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFromRootWindow =
2515 1 << 17, // Option: route evaluated from the point of view of root window rather than current window.
2516
2517 // Flags for SetNextItemShortcut()
2518 ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip =
2519 1 << 18, // Automatically display a tooltip when hovering item [BETA] Unsure of right api (opt-in/opt-out)
2520};
2521
2522// Configuration flags stored in io.ConfigFlags. Set by user/application.
2523enum ImGuiConfigFlags_
2524{
2525 ImGuiConfigFlags_None = 0,
2526 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard = 1 << 0, // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. Enable full Tabbing +
2527 // directional arrows + space/enter to activate.
2528 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad =
2529 1 << 1, // Master gamepad navigation enable flag. Backend also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.
2530 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse = 1 << 4, // Instruct dear imgui to disable mouse inputs and interactions.
2531 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange =
2532 1 << 5, // Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the backend cursor changes
2533 // are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may
2534 // want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead.
2535 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoKeyboard = 1 << 6, // Instruct dear imgui to disable keyboard inputs and interactions. This is
2536 // done by ignoring keyboard events and clearing existing states.
2537
2538 // [BETA] Docking
2539 ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable = 1 << 7, // Docking enable flags.
2540
2541 // [BETA] Viewports
2542 // When using viewports it is recommended that your default value for ImGuiCol_WindowBg is opaque (Alpha=1.0) so
2543 // transition to a viewport won't be noticeable.
2544 ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable =
2545 1 << 10, // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports +
2546 // ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective backends)
2547 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports =
2548 1 << 14, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport
2549 // changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main
2550 // window itself is up to your application.
2551 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts =
2552 1 << 15, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very
2553 // low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or
2554 // fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress.
2555
2556 // User storage (to allow your backend/engine to communicate to code that may be shared between multiple projects.
2557 // Those flags are NOT used by core Dear ImGui)
2558 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsSRGB = 1 << 20, // Application is SRGB-aware.
2559 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen = 1 << 21, // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse.
2560
2561#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2562 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // [moved/renamed in 1.91.4] -> use bool io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos
2563 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard = 1 << 3, // [moved/renamed in 1.91.4] -> use bool io.ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard
2564#endif
2565};
2566
2567// Backend capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. Set by imgui_impl_xxx or custom backend.
2568enum ImGuiBackendFlags_
2569{
2570 ImGuiBackendFlags_None = 0,
2571 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad = 1 << 0, // Backend Platform supports gamepad and currently has one connected.
2572 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors =
2573 1 << 1, // Backend Platform supports honoring GetMouseCursor() value to change the OS cursor shape.
2574 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos =
2575 1 << 2, // Backend Platform supports io.WantSetMousePos requests to reposition the OS mouse position (only used
2576 // if io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos is set).
2577 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset =
2578 1 << 3, // Backend Renderer supports ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices)
2579 // while still using 16-bit indices.
2580
2581 // [BETA] Viewports
2582 ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports = 1 << 10, // Backend Platform supports multiple viewports.
2583 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport =
2584 1 << 11, // Backend Platform supports calling io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport under the mouse. IF
2585 // POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+
2586 // backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed
2587 // heuristic to find the viewport under.
2588 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports = 1 << 12, // Backend Renderer supports multiple viewports.
2589};
2590

2592enum ImGuiCol_
2593{
2594 ImGuiCol_Text,
2595 ImGuiCol_TextDisabled,
2596 ImGuiCol_WindowBg, // Background of normal windows
2597 ImGuiCol_ChildBg, // Background of child windows
2598 ImGuiCol_PopupBg, // Background of popups, menus, tooltips windows
2599 ImGuiCol_Border,
2600 ImGuiCol_BorderShadow,
2601 ImGuiCol_FrameBg, // Background of checkbox, radio button, plot, slider, text input
2602 ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered,
2603 ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive,
2604 ImGuiCol_TitleBg, // Title bar
2605 ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive, // Title bar when focused
2606 ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed, // Title bar when collapsed
2607 ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg,
2608 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarBg,
2609 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrab,
2610 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabHovered,
2611 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabActive,
2612 ImGuiCol_CheckMark, // Checkbox tick and RadioButton circle
2613 ImGuiCol_SliderGrab,
2614 ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive,
2615 ImGuiCol_Button,
2616 ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered,
2617 ImGuiCol_ButtonActive,
2618 ImGuiCol_Header, // Header* colors are used for CollapsingHeader, TreeNode, Selectable, MenuItem
2619 ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered,
2620 ImGuiCol_HeaderActive,
2621 ImGuiCol_Separator,
2622 ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered,
2623 ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive,
2624 ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip, // Resize grip in lower-right and lower-left corners of windows.
2625 ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered,
2626 ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive,
2627 ImGuiCol_InputTextCursor, // InputText cursor/caret
2628 ImGuiCol_TabHovered, // Tab background, when hovered
2629 ImGuiCol_Tab, // Tab background, when tab-bar is focused & tab is unselected
2630 ImGuiCol_TabSelected, // Tab background, when tab-bar is focused & tab is selected
2631 ImGuiCol_TabSelectedOverline, // Tab horizontal overline, when tab-bar is focused & tab is selected
2632 ImGuiCol_TabDimmed, // Tab background, when tab-bar is unfocused & tab is unselected
2633 ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelected, // Tab background, when tab-bar is unfocused & tab is selected
2634 ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelectedOverline, //..horizontal overline, when tab-bar is unfocused & tab is selected
2635 ImGuiCol_DockingPreview, // Preview overlay color when about to docking something
2636 ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg, // Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it)
2637 ImGuiCol_PlotLines,
2638 ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered,
2639 ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram,
2640 ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered,
2641 ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg, // Table header background
2642 ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong, // Table outer and header borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
2643 ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight, // Table inner borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
2644 ImGuiCol_TableRowBg, // Table row background (even rows)
2645 ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt, // Table row background (odd rows)
2646 ImGuiCol_TextLink, // Hyperlink color
2647 ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg,
2648 ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget, // Rectangle highlighting a drop target
2649 ImGuiCol_NavCursor, // Color of keyboard/gamepad navigation cursor/rectangle, when visible
2650 ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, // Highlight window when using CTRL+TAB
2651 ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active
2652 ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active
2653 ImGuiCol_COUNT,
2654
2655#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2656 ImGuiCol_TabActive = ImGuiCol_TabSelected, // [renamed in 1.90.9]
2657 ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused = ImGuiCol_TabDimmed, // [renamed in 1.90.9]
2658 ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive = ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelected, // [renamed in 1.90.9]
2659 ImGuiCol_NavHighlight = ImGuiCol_NavCursor, // [renamed in 1.91.4]
2660#endif
2661};
2662
2663// Enumeration for PushStyleVar() / PopStyleVar() to temporarily modify the ImGuiStyle structure.
2664// - The enum only refers to fields of ImGuiStyle which makes sense to be pushed/popped inside UI code.
2665// During initialization or between frames, feel free to just poke into ImGuiStyle directly.
2666// - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _second column_ below to find the actual
2667// members and their description.
2668// - In Visual Studio: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols inside comments, whereas CTRL+F12
2669// ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
2670// - In Visual Studio w/ Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols inside
2671// comments.
2672// - In VS Code, CLion, etc.: CTRL+click can follow symbols inside comments.
2673// - When changing this enum, you need to update the associated internal table GStyleVarInfo[] accordingly. This is
2674// where we link enum values to members offset/type.
2675enum ImGuiStyleVar_
2676{
2677 // Enum name -------------------------- // Member in ImGuiStyle structure (see ImGuiStyle for descriptions)
2678 ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, // float Alpha
2679 ImGuiStyleVar_DisabledAlpha, // float DisabledAlpha
2680 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, // ImVec2 WindowPadding
2681 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, // float WindowRounding
2682 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize, // float WindowBorderSize
2683 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, // ImVec2 WindowMinSize
2684 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign, // ImVec2 WindowTitleAlign
2685 ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, // float ChildRounding
2686 ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, // float ChildBorderSize
2687 ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding, // float PopupRounding
2688 ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize, // float PopupBorderSize
2689 ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, // ImVec2 FramePadding
2690 ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, // float FrameRounding
2691 ImGuiStyleVar_FrameBorderSize, // float FrameBorderSize
2692 ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, // ImVec2 ItemSpacing
2693 ImGuiStyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing, // ImVec2 ItemInnerSpacing
2694 ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, // float IndentSpacing
2695 ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, // ImVec2 CellPadding
2696 ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarSize, // float ScrollbarSize
2697 ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarRounding, // float ScrollbarRounding
2698 ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize, // float GrabMinSize
2699 ImGuiStyleVar_GrabRounding, // float GrabRounding
2700 ImGuiStyleVar_ImageBorderSize, // float ImageBorderSize
2701 ImGuiStyleVar_TabRounding, // float TabRounding
2702 ImGuiStyleVar_TabBorderSize, // float TabBorderSize
2703 ImGuiStyleVar_TabBarBorderSize, // float TabBarBorderSize
2704 ImGuiStyleVar_TabBarOverlineSize, // float TabBarOverlineSize
2705 ImGuiStyleVar_TableAngledHeadersAngle, // float TableAngledHeadersAngle
2706 ImGuiStyleVar_TableAngledHeadersTextAlign, // ImVec2 TableAngledHeadersTextAlign
2707 ImGuiStyleVar_ButtonTextAlign, // ImVec2 ButtonTextAlign
2708 ImGuiStyleVar_SelectableTextAlign, // ImVec2 SelectableTextAlign
2709 ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextBorderSize, // float SeparatorTextBorderSize
2710 ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextAlign, // ImVec2 SeparatorTextAlign
2711 ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextPadding, // ImVec2 SeparatorTextPadding
2712 ImGuiStyleVar_DockingSeparatorSize, // float DockingSeparatorSize
2713 ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT
2714};
2715
2716// Flags for InvisibleButton() [extended in imgui_internal.h]
2717enum ImGuiButtonFlags_
2718{
2719 ImGuiButtonFlags_None = 0,
2720 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft = 1 << 0, // React on left mouse button (default)
2721 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight = 1 << 1, // React on right mouse button
2722 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle = 1 << 2, // React on center mouse button
2723 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMask_ = ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight |
2724 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle, // [Internal]
2725 ImGuiButtonFlags_EnableNav =
2726 1 << 3, // InvisibleButton(): do not disable navigation/tabbing. Otherwise disabled by default.
2727};
2728
2729// Flags for ColorEdit3() / ColorEdit4() / ColorPicker3() / ColorPicker4() / ColorButton()
2730enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_
2731{
2732 ImGuiColorEditFlags_None = 0,
2733 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha = 1 << 1, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component
2734 // (will only read 3 components from the input pointer).
2735 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker = 1 << 2, // // ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on color square.
2736 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions =
2737 1 << 3, // // ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.
2738 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview = 1 << 4, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable color square preview
2739 // next to the inputs. (e.g. to show only the inputs)
2740 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs = 1 << 5, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text
2741 // widgets (e.g. to show only the small preview color square).
2742 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip =
2743 1 << 6, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.
2744 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel =
2745 1 << 7, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still
2746 // forwarded to the tooltip and picker).
2747 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview = 1
2748 << 8, // // ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side
2749 // of the picker, use small color square preview instead.
2750 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop =
2751 1 << 9, // // ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.
2752 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder =
2753 1 << 10, // // ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)
2754
2755 // Alpha preview
2756 // - Prior to 1.91.8 (2025/01/21): alpha was made opaque in the preview by default using old name
2757 // ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview.
2758 // - We now display the preview as transparent by default. You can use ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque to use old
2759 // behavior.
2760 // - The new flags may be combined better and allow finer controls.
2761 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque =
2762 1 << 11, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable alpha in the preview,. Contrary to
2763 // _NoAlpha it may still be edited when calling ColorEdit4()/ColorPicker4(). For
2764 // ColorButton() this does the same as _NoAlpha.
2765 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg = 1 << 12, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable rendering a
2766 // checkerboard background behind transparent color.
2767 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf =
2768 1 << 13, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half transparent preview.
2769
2770 // User Options (right-click on widget to change some of them).
2771 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar =
2772 1 << 16, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.
2773 ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR =
2774 1 << 19, // // (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you
2775 // probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).
2776 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB = 1 << 20, // [Display] // ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex.
2777 // ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.
2778 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV = 1 << 21, // [Display] // "
2779 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex = 1 << 22, // [Display] // "
2780 ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 =
2781 1 << 23, // [DataType] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.
2782 ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float =
2783 1 << 24, // [DataType] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats
2784 // instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.
2785 ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar = 1 << 25, // [Picker] // ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.
2786 ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel = 1 << 26, // [Picker] // ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.
2787 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB =
2788 1 << 27, // [Input] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.
2789 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV =
2790 1 << 28, // [Input] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.
2791
2792 // Defaults Options. You can set application defaults using SetColorEditOptions(). The intent is that you probably
2793 // don't want to override them in most of your calls. Let the user choose via the option menu and/or call
2794 // SetColorEditOptions() once during startup.
2795 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB |
2796 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
2797
2798 // [Internal] Masks
2799 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque |
2800 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf,
2801 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ =
2802 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex,
2803 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float,
2804 ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
2805 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV,
2806
2807 // Obsolete names
2808#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2809 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview = 0, // [Removed in 1.91.8] This is the default now. Will display a checkerboard
2810 // unless ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg is set.
2811#endif
2812 // ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HSV =
2813 // ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HEX = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex // [renamed in 1.69]
2814};
2815
2816// Flags for DragFloat(), DragInt(), SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc.
2817// We use the same sets of flags for DragXXX() and SliderXXX() functions as the features are the same and it makes it
2818// easier to swap them. (Those are per-item flags. There is shared behavior flag too: ImGuiIO:
2819// io.ConfigDragClickToInputText)
2820enum ImGuiSliderFlags_
2821{
2822 ImGuiSliderFlags_None = 0,
2823 ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic =
2824 1 << 5, // Make the widget logarithmic (linear otherwise). Consider using ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat with
2825 // this if using a format-string with small amount of digits.
2826 ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat = 1 << 6, // Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the display
2827 // format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits).
2828 ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput =
2829 1 << 7, // Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget.
2830 ImGuiSliderFlags_WrapAround = 1 << 8, // Enable wrapping around from max to min and from min to max. Only supported
2831 // by DragXXX() functions for now.
2832 ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput = 1 << 9, // Clamp value to min/max bounds when input manually with CTRL+Click. By
2833 // default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.
2834 ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampZeroRange =
2835 1 << 10, // Clamp even if min==max==0.0f. Otherwise due to legacy reason DragXXX functions don't clamp with
2836 // those values. When your clamping limits are dynamic you almost always want to use it.
2837 ImGuiSliderFlags_NoSpeedTweaks = 1 << 11, // Disable keyboard modifiers altering tweak speed. Useful if you want to
2838 // alter tweak speed yourself based on your own logic.
2839 ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp = ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput | ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampZeroRange,
2840 ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_ =
2841 0x7000000F, // [Internal] We treat using those bits as being potentially a 'float power' argument from the
2842 // previous API that has got miscast to this enum, and will trigger an assert if needed.
2843};
2844
2845// Identify a mouse button.
2846// Those values are guaranteed to be stable and we frequently use 0/1 directly. Named enums provided for convenience.
2847enum ImGuiMouseButton_
2848{
2849 ImGuiMouseButton_Left = 0,
2850 ImGuiMouseButton_Right = 1,
2851 ImGuiMouseButton_Middle = 2,
2852 ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT = 5
2853};
2854
2855// Enumeration for GetMouseCursor()
2856// User code may request backend to display given cursor by calling SetMouseCursor(), which is why we have some cursors
2857// that are marked unused here
2858enum ImGuiMouseCursor_
2859{
2860 ImGuiMouseCursor_None = -1,
2861 ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow = 0,
2862 ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput, // When hovering over InputText, etc.
2863 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeAll, // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions)
2864 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS, // When hovering over a horizontal border
2865 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW, // When hovering over a vertical border or a column
2866 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW, // When hovering over the bottom-left corner of a window
2867 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE, // When hovering over the bottom-right corner of a window
2868 ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand, // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions. Use for e.g. hyperlinks)
2869 ImGuiMouseCursor_Wait, // When waiting for something to process/load.
2870 ImGuiMouseCursor_Progress, // When waiting for something to process/load, but application is still interactive.
2871 ImGuiMouseCursor_NotAllowed, // When hovering something with disallowed interaction. Usually a crossed circle.
2872 ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT
2873};
2874
2875// Enumeration for AddMouseSourceEvent() actual source of Mouse Input data.
2876// Historically we use "Mouse" terminology everywhere to indicate pointer data, e.g. MousePos, IsMousePressed(),
2877// io.AddMousePosEvent() But that "Mouse" data can come from different source which occasionally may be useful for
2878// application to know about. You can submit a change of pointer type using io.AddMouseSourceEvent().
2879enum ImGuiMouseSource : int
2880{
2881 ImGuiMouseSource_Mouse = 0, // Input is coming from an actual mouse.
2882 ImGuiMouseSource_TouchScreen, // Input is coming from a touch screen (no hovering prior to initial press, less
2883 // precise initial press aiming, dual-axis wheeling possible).
2884 ImGuiMouseSource_Pen, // Input is coming from a pressure/magnetic pen (often used in conjunction with high-sampling
2885 // rates).
2886 ImGuiMouseSource_COUNT
2887};
2888
2889// Enumeration for ImGui::SetNextWindow***(), SetWindow***(), SetNextItem***() functions
2890// Represent a condition.
2891// Important: Treat as a regular enum! Do NOT combine multiple values using binary operators! All the functions above
2892// treat 0 as a shortcut to ImGuiCond_Always.
2893enum ImGuiCond_
2894{
2895 ImGuiCond_None = 0, // No condition (always set the variable), same as _Always
2896 ImGuiCond_Always = 1 << 0, // No condition (always set the variable), same as _None
2897 ImGuiCond_Once = 1 << 1, // Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)
2898 ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver =
2899 1 << 2, // Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data (no entry in .ini file)
2900 ImGuiCond_Appearing =
2901 1 << 3, // Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being hidden/inactive (or the first time)
2902};
2903
2904//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2905// [SECTION] Tables API flags and structures (ImGuiTableFlags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags, ImGuiTableRowFlags,
2906// ImGuiTableBgTarget, ImGuiTableSortSpecs, ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs)
2907//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2908
2909// Flags for ImGui::BeginTable()
2910// - Important! Sizing policies have complex and subtle side effects, much more so than you would expect.
2911// Read comments/demos carefully + experiment with live demos to get acquainted with them.
2912// - The DEFAULT sizing policies are:
2913// - Default to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit if ScrollX is on, or if host window has
2914// ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize.
2915// - Default to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame if ScrollX is off.
2916// - When ScrollX is off:
2917// - Table defaults to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame -> all Columns defaults to
2918// ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch with same weight.
2919// - Columns sizing policy allowed: Stretch (default), Fixed/Auto.
2920// - Fixed Columns (if any) will generally obtain their requested width (unless the table cannot fit them all).
2921// - Stretch Columns will share the remaining width according to their respective weight.
2922// - Mixed Fixed/Stretch columns is possible but has various side-effects on resizing behaviors.
2923// The typical use of mixing sizing policies is: any number of LEADING Fixed columns, followed by one or two
2924// TRAILING Stretch columns. (this is because the visible order of columns have subtle but necessary effects on how
2925// they react to manual resizing).
2926// - When ScrollX is on:
2927// - Table defaults to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit -> all Columns defaults to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed
2928// - Columns sizing policy allowed: Fixed/Auto mostly.
2929// - Fixed Columns can be enlarged as needed. Table will show a horizontal scrollbar if needed.
2930// - When using auto-resizing (non-resizable) fixed columns, querying the content width to use item right-alignment
2931// e.g. SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN) doesn't make sense, would create a feedback loop.
2932// - Using Stretch columns OFTEN DOES NOT MAKE SENSE if ScrollX is on, UNLESS you have specified a value for
2933// 'inner_width' in BeginTable().
2934// If you specify a value for 'inner_width' then effectively the scrolling space is known and Stretch or mixed
2935// Fixed/Stretch columns become meaningful again.
2936// - Read on documentation at the top of imgui_tables.cpp for details.
2937enum ImGuiTableFlags_
2938{
2939 // Features
2940 ImGuiTableFlags_None = 0,
2941 ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable = 1 << 0, // Enable resizing columns.
2942 ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable = 1 << 1, // Enable reordering columns in header row (need calling TableSetupColumn() +
2943 // TableHeadersRow() to display headers)
2944 ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable = 1 << 2, // Enable hiding/disabling columns in context menu.
2945 ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable = 1 << 3, // Enable sorting. Call TableGetSortSpecs() to obtain sort specs. Also see
2946 // ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti and ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate.
2947 ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings =
2948 1 << 4, // Disable persisting columns order, width and sort settings in the .ini file.
2949 ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody = 1 << 5, // Right-click on columns body/contents will display table context menu.
2950 // By default it is available in TableHeadersRow().
2951 // Decorations
2952 ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg =
2953 1 << 6, // Set each RowBg color with ImGuiCol_TableRowBg or ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt (equivalent of calling
2954 // TableSetBgColor with ImGuiTableBgFlags_RowBg0 on each row manually)
2955 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH = 1 << 7, // Draw horizontal borders between rows.
2956 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH = 1 << 8, // Draw horizontal borders at the top and bottom.
2957 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV = 1 << 9, // Draw vertical borders between columns.
2958 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV = 1 << 10, // Draw vertical borders on the left and right sides.
2959 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH =
2960 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH, // Draw horizontal borders.
2961 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV, // Draw vertical borders.
2962 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH, // Draw inner borders.
2963 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH, // Draw outer borders.
2964 ImGuiTableFlags_Borders = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter, // Draw all borders.
2965 ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody = 1 << 11, // [ALPHA] Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always
2966 // appear in Headers). -> May move to style
2967 ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize =
2968 1 << 12, // [ALPHA] Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always
2969 // appear in Headers). -> May move to style
2970 // Sizing Policy (read above for defaults)
2971 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit =
2972 1
2973 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable), matching contents width.
2974 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame =
2975 2 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable), matching the maximum
2976 // contents width of all columns. Implicitly enable ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible.
2977 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp =
2978 3 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights proportional to each columns contents widths.
2979 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame = 4 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights all equal,
2980 // unless overridden by TableSetupColumn().
2981 // Sizing Extra Options
2982 ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX =
2983 1 << 16, // Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value. Only available when
2984 // ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.
2985 ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY =
2986 1 << 17, // Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit). Only
2987 // available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.
2988 ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible = 1
2989 << 18, // Disable keeping column always minimally visible when ScrollX is off
2990 // and table gets too small. Not recommended if columns are resizable.
2991 ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths =
2992 1 << 19, // Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with
2993 // 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns,
2994 // resizing will appear to be less smooth.
2995 // Clipping
2996 ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip =
2997 1 << 20, // Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns (reduce draw command count, items will be
2998 // able to overflow into other columns). Generally incompatible with TableSetupScrollFreeze().
2999 // Padding
3000 ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX =
3001 1 << 21, // Default if BordersOuterV is on. Enable outermost padding. Generally desirable if you have headers.
3002 ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX = 1 << 22, // Default if BordersOuterV is off. Disable outermost padding.
3003 ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX = 1 << 23, // Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if
3004 // BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off).
3005 // Scrolling
3006 ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX =
3007 1 << 24, // Enable horizontal scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable() to specify the container
3008 // size. Changes default sizing policy. Because this creates a child window, ScrollY is currently
3009 // generally recommended when using ScrollX.
3010 ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY = 1 << 25, // Enable vertical scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable() to
3011 // specify the container size.
3012 // Sorting
3013 ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti = 1 << 26, // Hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column.
3014 // TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).
3015 ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate = 1 << 27, // Allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return
3016 // specs where (SpecsCount == 0).
3017 // Miscellaneous
3018 ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn =
3019 1 << 28, // Highlight column headers when hovered (may evolve into a fuller highlight)
3020
3021 // [Internal] Combinations and masks
3022 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_ = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame |
3023 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame,
3024};
3025
3026// Flags for ImGui::TableSetupColumn()
3027enum ImGuiTableColumnFlags_
3028{
3029 // Input configuration flags
3030 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None = 0,
3031 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_Disabled =
3032 1 << 0, // Overriding/master disable flag: hide column, won't show in context menu (unlike calling
3033 // TableSetColumnEnabled() which manipulates the user accessible state)
3034 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide = 1 << 1, // Default as a hidden/disabled column.
3035 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort = 1 << 2, // Default as a sorting column.
3036 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch =
3037 1 << 3, // Column will stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling disabled (default if table sizing policy is
3038 // _SizingStretchSame or _SizingStretchProp).
3039 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed =
3040 1 << 4, // Column will not stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling enabled (default if table sizing policy
3041 // is _SizingFixedFit and table is resizable).
3042 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoResize = 1 << 5, // Disable manual resizing.
3043 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoReorder = 1 << 6, // Disable manual reordering this column, this will also prevent other
3044 // columns from crossing over this column.
3045 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide = 1 << 7, // Disable ability to hide/disable this column.
3046 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoClip =
3047 1 << 8, // Disable clipping for this column (all NoClip columns will render in a same draw command).
3048 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort =
3049 1 << 9, // Disable ability to sort on this field (even if ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable is set on the table).
3050 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending = 1 << 10, // Disable ability to sort in the ascending direction.
3051 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending = 1 << 11, // Disable ability to sort in the descending direction.
3052 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel =
3053 1 << 12, // TableHeadersRow() will submit an empty label for this column. Convenient for some small columns.
3054 // Name will still appear in context menu or in angled headers. You may append into this cell by
3055 // calling TableSetColumnIndex() right after the TableHeadersRow() call.
3056 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth = 1 << 13, // Disable header text width contribution to automatic column width.
3057 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending =
3058 1 << 14, // Make the initial sort direction Ascending when first sorting on this column (default).
3059 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending =
3060 1 << 15, // Make the initial sort direction Descending when first sorting on this column.
3061 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable = 1 << 16, // Use current Indent value when entering cell (default for column 0).
3062 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable = 1
3063 << 17, // Ignore current Indent value when entering cell (default for columns
3064 // > 0). Indentation changes _within_ the cell will still be honored.
3065 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader =
3066 1 << 18, // TableHeadersRow() will submit an angled header row for this column. Note this will add an extra row.
3067
3068 // Output status flags, read-only via TableGetColumnFlags()
3069 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled = 1 << 24, // Status: is enabled == not hidden by user/api (referred to as "Hide" in
3070 // _DefaultHide and _NoHide) flags.
3071 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible = 1 << 25, // Status: is visible == is enabled AND not clipped by scrolling.
3072 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted = 1 << 26, // Status: is currently part of the sort specs
3073 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered = 1 << 27, // Status: is hovered by mouse
3074
3075 // [Internal] Combinations and masks
3076 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed,
3077 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable,
3078 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_StatusMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible |
3079 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered,
3080 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoDirectResize_ = 1 << 30, // [Internal] Disable user resizing this column directly (it may
3081 // however we resized indirectly from its left edge)
3082};
3083
3084// Flags for ImGui::TableNextRow()
3085enum ImGuiTableRowFlags_
3086{
3087 ImGuiTableRowFlags_None = 0,
3088 ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers = 1 << 0, // Identify header row (set default background color + width of its contents
3089 // accounted differently for auto column width)
3090};
3091
3092// Enum for ImGui::TableSetBgColor()
3093// Background colors are rendering in 3 layers:
3094// - Layer 0: draw with RowBg0 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg0 if set.
3095// - Layer 1: draw with RowBg1 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg1 if set.
3096// - Layer 2: draw with CellBg color if set.
3097// The purpose of the two row/columns layers is to let you decide if a background color change should override or blend
3098// with the existing color. When using ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg on the table, each row has the RowBg0 color automatically
3099// set for odd/even rows. If you set the color of RowBg0 target, your color will override the existing RowBg0 color. If
3100// you set the color of RowBg1 or ColumnBg1 target, your color will blend over the RowBg0 color.
3101enum ImGuiTableBgTarget_
3102{
3103 ImGuiTableBgTarget_None = 0,
3104 ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg0 = 1, // Set row background color 0 (generally used for background, automatically set when
3105 // ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is used)
3106 ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg1 = 2, // Set row background color 1 (generally used for selection marking)
3107 ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg = 3, // Set cell background color (top-most color)
3108};
3109
3110// Sorting specifications for a table (often handling sort specs for a single column, occasionally more)
3111// Obtained by calling TableGetSortSpecs().
3112// When 'SpecsDirty == true' you can sort your data. It will be true with sorting specs have changed since last call, or
3113// the first time. Make sure to set 'SpecsDirty = false' after sorting, else you may wastefully sort your data every
3114// frame!
3115struct ImGuiTableSortSpecs
3116{
3117 const ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs *Specs; // Pointer to sort spec array.
3118 int SpecsCount; // Sort spec count. Most often 1. May be > 1 when ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti is enabled. May be == 0
3119 // when ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate is enabled.
3120 bool
3121 SpecsDirty; // Set to true when specs have changed since last time! Use this to sort again, then clear the flag.
3122
3123 ImGuiTableSortSpecs()
3124 {
3125 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3126 }
3127};
3128
3129// Sorting specification for one column of a table (sizeof == 12 bytes)
3130struct ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs
3131{
3132 ImGuiID ColumnUserID; // User id of the column (if specified by a TableSetupColumn() call)
3133 ImS16 ColumnIndex; // Index of the column
3134 ImS16 SortOrder; // Index within parent ImGuiTableSortSpecs (always stored in order starting from 0, tables sorted
3135 // on a single criteria will always have a 0 here)
3136 ImGuiSortDirection SortDirection; // ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending or ImGuiSortDirection_Descending
3137
3138 ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs()
3139 {
3140 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3141 }
3142};
3143
3144//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3145// [SECTION] Helpers: Debug log, memory allocations macros, ImVector<>
3146//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3147
3148//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3149// Debug Logging into ShowDebugLogWindow(), tty and more.
3150//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3151
3152#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
3153#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(...) ImGui::DebugLog(__VA_ARGS__)
3154#else
3155#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(...) ((void)0)
3156#endif
3157
3158//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3159// IM_MALLOC(), IM_FREE(), IM_NEW(), IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(), IM_DELETE()
3160// We call C++ constructor on own allocated memory via the placement "new(ptr) Type()" syntax.
3161// Defining a custom placement new() with a custom parameter allows us to bypass including <new> which on some platforms
3162// complains when user has disabled exceptions.
3163//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3164
3165struct ImNewWrapper
3166{
3167};
3168inline void *operator new(size_t, ImNewWrapper, void *ptr)
3169{
3170 return ptr;
3171}
3172inline void operator delete(void *, ImNewWrapper, void *)
3173{
3174} // This is only required so we can use the symmetrical new()
3175#define IM_ALLOC(_SIZE) ImGui::MemAlloc(_SIZE)
3176#define IM_FREE(_PTR) ImGui::MemFree(_PTR)
3177#define IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(_PTR) new (ImNewWrapper(), _PTR)
3178#define IM_NEW(_TYPE) new (ImNewWrapper(), ImGui::MemAlloc(sizeof(_TYPE))) _TYPE
3179template <typename T>
3180void IM_DELETE(T *p)
3181{
3182 if (p)
3183 {
3184 p->~T();
3185 ImGui::MemFree(p);
3186 }
3187}
3188
3189//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3190// ImVector<>
3191// Lightweight std::vector<>-like class to avoid dragging dependencies (also, some implementations of STL with debug
3192// enabled are absurdly slow, we bypass it so our code runs fast in debug).
3193//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3194// - You generally do NOT need to care or use this ever. But we need to make it available in imgui.h because some of our
3195// public structures are relying on it.
3196// - We use std-like naming convention here, which is a little unusual for this codebase.
3197// - Important: clear() frees memory, resize(0) keep the allocated buffer. We use resize(0) a lot to intentionally
3198// recycle allocated buffers across frames and amortize our costs.
3199// - Important: our implementation does NOT call C++ constructors/destructors, we treat everything as raw data! This is
3200// intentional but be extra mindful of that,
3201// Do NOT use this class as a std::vector replacement in your own code! Many of the structures used by dear imgui can
3202// be safely initialized by a zero-memset.
3203//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3204
3205IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
3206template <typename T>
3207struct ImVector
3208{
3209 int Size;
3210 int Capacity;
3211 T *Data;
3212
3213 // Provide standard typedefs but we don't use them ourselves.
3214 typedef T value_type;
3215 typedef value_type *iterator;
3216 typedef const value_type *const_iterator;
3217
3218 // Constructors, destructor
3219 inline ImVector()
3220 {
3221 Size = Capacity = 0;
3222 Data = NULL;
3223 }
3224 inline ImVector(const ImVector<T> &src)
3225 {
3226 Size = Capacity = 0;
3227 Data = NULL;
3228 operator=(src);
3229 }
3230 inline ImVector<T> &operator=(const ImVector<T> &src)
3231 {
3232 clear();
3233 resize(src.Size);
3234 if (src.Data)
3235 memcpy(Data, src.Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T));
3236 return *this;
3237 }
3238 inline ~ImVector()
3239 {
3240 if (Data)
3241 IM_FREE(Data);
3242 } // Important: does not destruct anything
3243
3244 inline void clear()
3245 {
3246 if (Data)
3247 {
3248 Size = Capacity = 0;
3249 IM_FREE(Data);
3250 Data = NULL;
3251 }
3252 } // Important: does not destruct anything
3253 inline void clear_delete()
3254 {
3255 for (int n = 0; n < Size; n++)
3256 IM_DELETE(Data[n]);
3257 clear();
3258 } // Important: never called automatically! always explicit.
3259 inline void clear_destruct()
3260 {
3261 for (int n = 0; n < Size; n++)
3262 Data[n].~T();
3263 clear();
3264 } // Important: never called automatically! always explicit.
3265
3266 inline bool empty() const
3267 {
3268 return Size == 0;
3269 }
3270 inline int size() const
3271 {
3272 return Size;
3273 }
3274 inline int size_in_bytes() const
3275 {
3276 return Size * (int)sizeof(T);
3277 }
3278 inline int max_size() const
3279 {
3280 return 0x7FFFFFFF / (int)sizeof(T);
3281 }
3282 inline int capacity() const
3283 {
3284 return Capacity;
3285 }
3286 inline T &operator[](int i)
3287 {
3288 IM_ASSERT(i >= 0 && i < Size);
3289 return Data[i];
3290 }
3291 inline const T &operator[](int i) const
3292 {
3293 IM_ASSERT(i >= 0 && i < Size);
3294 return Data[i];
3295 }
3296
3297 inline T *begin()
3298 {
3299 return Data;
3300 }
3301 inline const T *begin() const
3302 {
3303 return Data;
3304 }
3305 inline T *end()
3306 {
3307 return Data + Size;
3308 }
3309 inline const T *end() const
3310 {
3311 return Data + Size;
3312 }
3313 inline T &front()
3314 {
3315 IM_ASSERT(Size > 0);
3316 return Data[0];
3317 }
3318 inline const T &front() const
3319 {
3320 IM_ASSERT(Size > 0);
3321 return Data[0];
3322 }
3323 inline T &back()
3324 {
3325 IM_ASSERT(Size > 0);
3326 return Data[Size - 1];
3327 }
3328 inline const T &back() const
3329 {
3330 IM_ASSERT(Size > 0);
3331 return Data[Size - 1];
3332 }
3333 inline void swap(ImVector<T> &rhs)
3334 {
3335 int rhs_size = rhs.Size;
3336 rhs.Size = Size;
3337 Size = rhs_size;
3338 int rhs_cap = rhs.Capacity;
3339 rhs.Capacity = Capacity;
3340 Capacity = rhs_cap;
3341 T *rhs_data = rhs.Data;
3342 rhs.Data = Data;
3343 Data = rhs_data;
3344 }
3345
3346 inline int _grow_capacity(int sz) const
3347 {
3348 int new_capacity = Capacity ? (Capacity + Capacity / 2) : 8;
3349 return new_capacity > sz ? new_capacity : sz;
3350 }
3351 inline void resize(int new_size)
3352 {
3353 if (new_size > Capacity)
3354 reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size));
3355 Size = new_size;
3356 }
3357 inline void resize(int new_size, const T &v)
3358 {
3359 if (new_size > Capacity)
3360 reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size));
3361 if (new_size > Size)
3362 for (int n = Size; n < new_size; n++)
3363 memcpy(&Data[n], &v, sizeof(v));
3364 Size = new_size;
3365 }
3366 inline void shrink(int new_size)
3367 {
3368 IM_ASSERT(new_size <= Size);
3369 Size = new_size;
3370 } // Resize a vector to a smaller size, guaranteed not to cause a reallocation
3371 inline void reserve(int new_capacity)
3372 {
3373 if (new_capacity <= Capacity)
3374 return;
3375 T *new_data = (T *)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T));
3376 if (Data)
3377 {
3378 memcpy(new_data, Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T));
3379 IM_FREE(Data);
3380 }
3381 Data = new_data;
3382 Capacity = new_capacity;
3383 }
3384 inline void reserve_discard(int new_capacity)
3385 {
3386 if (new_capacity <= Capacity)
3387 return;
3388 if (Data)
3389 IM_FREE(Data);
3390 Data = (T *)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T));
3391 Capacity = new_capacity;
3392 }
3393
3394 // NB: It is illegal to call push_back/push_front/insert with a reference pointing inside the ImVector data itself!
3395 // e.g. v.push_back(v[10]) is forbidden.
3396 inline void push_back(const T &v)
3397 {
3398 if (Size == Capacity)
3399 reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1));
3400 memcpy(&Data[Size], &v, sizeof(v));
3401 Size++;
3402 }
3403 inline void pop_back()
3404 {
3405 IM_ASSERT(Size > 0);
3406 Size--;
3407 }
3408 inline void push_front(const T &v)
3409 {
3410 if (Size == 0)
3411 push_back(v);
3412 else
3413 insert(Data, v);
3414 }
3415 inline T *erase(const T *it)
3416 {
3417 IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size);
3418 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
3419 memmove(Data + off, Data + off + 1, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - 1) * sizeof(T));
3420 Size--;
3421 return Data + off;
3422 }
3423 inline T *erase(const T *it, const T *it_last)
3424 {
3425 IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size && it_last >= it && it_last <= Data + Size);
3426 const ptrdiff_t count = it_last - it;
3427 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
3428 memmove(Data + off, Data + off + count, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - (size_t)count) * sizeof(T));
3429 Size -= (int)count;
3430 return Data + off;
3431 }
3432 inline T *erase_unsorted(const T *it)
3433 {
3434 IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size);
3435 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
3436 if (it < Data + Size - 1)
3437 memcpy(Data + off, Data + Size - 1, sizeof(T));
3438 Size--;
3439 return Data + off;
3440 }
3441 inline T *insert(const T *it, const T &v)
3442 {
3443 IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it <= Data + Size);
3444 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
3445 if (Size == Capacity)
3446 reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1));
3447 if (off < (int)Size)
3448 memmove(Data + off + 1, Data + off, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off) * sizeof(T));
3449 memcpy(&Data[off], &v, sizeof(v));
3450 Size++;
3451 return Data + off;
3452 }
3453 inline bool contains(const T &v) const
3454 {
3455 const T *data = Data;
3456 const T *data_end = Data + Size;
3457 while (data < data_end)
3458 if (*data++ == v)
3459 return true;
3460 return false;
3461 }
3462 inline T *find(const T &v)
3463 {
3464 T *data = Data;
3465 const T *data_end = Data + Size;
3466 while (data < data_end)
3467 if (*data == v)
3468 break;
3469 else
3470 ++data;
3471 return data;
3472 }
3473 inline const T *find(const T &v) const
3474 {
3475 const T *data = Data;
3476 const T *data_end = Data + Size;
3477 while (data < data_end)
3478 if (*data == v)
3479 break;
3480 else
3481 ++data;
3482 return data;
3483 }
3484 inline int find_index(const T &v) const
3485 {
3486 const T *data_end = Data + Size;
3487 const T *it = find(v);
3488 if (it == data_end)
3489 return -1;
3490 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
3491 return (int)off;
3492 }
3493 inline bool find_erase(const T &v)
3494 {
3495 const T *it = find(v);
3496 if (it < Data + Size)
3497 {
3498 erase(it);
3499 return true;
3500 }
3501 return false;
3502 }
3503 inline bool find_erase_unsorted(const T &v)
3504 {
3505 const T *it = find(v);
3506 if (it < Data + Size)
3507 {
3508 erase_unsorted(it);
3509 return true;
3510 }
3511 return false;
3512 }
3513 inline int index_from_ptr(const T *it) const
3514 {
3515 IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size);
3516 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
3517 return (int)off;
3518 }
3519};
3520IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
3521
3522//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3523// [SECTION] ImGuiStyle
3524//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3525// You may modify the ImGui::GetStyle() main instance during initialization and before NewFrame().
3526// During the frame, use ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_XXXX)/PopStyleVar() to alter the main style values,
3527// and ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_XXX)/PopStyleColor() for colors.
3528//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3529
3530struct ImGuiStyle
3531{
3532 float Alpha; // Global alpha applies to everything in Dear ImGui.
3533 float
3534 DisabledAlpha; // Additional alpha multiplier applied by BeginDisabled(). Multiply over current value of Alpha.
3535 ImVec2 WindowPadding; // Padding within a window.
3536 float WindowRounding; // Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows. Large values
3537 // tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
3538 float WindowBorderSize; // Thickness of border around windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not
3539 // well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
3540 float WindowBorderHoverPadding; // Hit-testing extent outside/inside resizing border. Also extend determination of
3541 // hovered window. Generally meaningfully larger than WindowBorderSize to make it
3542 // easy to reach borders.
3543 ImVec2 WindowMinSize; // Minimum window size. This is a global setting. If you want to constrain individual windows,
3544 // use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints().
3545 ImVec2
3546 WindowTitleAlign; // Alignment for title bar text. Defaults to (0.0f,0.5f) for left-aligned,vertically centered.
3547 ImGuiDir WindowMenuButtonPosition; // Side of the collapsing/docking button in the title bar (None/Left/Right).
3548 // Defaults to ImGuiDir_Left.
3549 float ChildRounding; // Radius of child window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows.
3550 float ChildBorderSize; // Thickness of border around child windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are
3551 // not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
3552 float PopupRounding; // Radius of popup window corners rounding. (Note that tooltip windows use WindowRounding)
3553 float PopupBorderSize; // Thickness of border around popup/tooltip windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other
3554 // values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
3555 ImVec2 FramePadding; // Padding within a framed rectangle (used by most widgets).
3556 float FrameRounding; // Radius of frame corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular frame (used by most
3557 // widgets).
3558 float FrameBorderSize; // Thickness of border around frames. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not
3559 // well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
3560 ImVec2 ItemSpacing; // Horizontal and vertical spacing between widgets/lines.
3561 ImVec2 ItemInnerSpacing; // Horizontal and vertical spacing between within elements of a composed widget (e.g. a
3562 // slider and its label).
3563 ImVec2 CellPadding; // Padding within a table cell. Cellpadding.x is locked for entire table. CellPadding.y may be
3564 // altered between different rows.
3565 ImVec2 TouchExtraPadding; // Expand reactive bounding box for touch-based system where touch position is not
3566 // accurate enough. Unfortunately we don't sort widgets so priority on overlap will always
3567 // be given to the first widget. So don't grow this too much!
3568 float IndentSpacing; // Horizontal indentation when e.g. entering a tree node. Generally == (FontSize +
3569 // FramePadding.x*2).
3570 float ColumnsMinSpacing; // Minimum horizontal spacing between two columns. Preferably > (FramePadding.x + 1).
3571 float ScrollbarSize; // Width of the vertical scrollbar, Height of the horizontal scrollbar.
3572 float ScrollbarRounding; // Radius of grab corners for scrollbar.
3573 float GrabMinSize; // Minimum width/height of a grab box for slider/scrollbar.
3574 float GrabRounding; // Radius of grabs corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular slider grabs.
3575 float LogSliderDeadzone; // The size in pixels of the dead-zone around zero on logarithmic sliders that cross zero.
3576 float ImageBorderSize; // Thickness of border around Image() calls.
3577 float TabRounding; // Radius of upper corners of a tab. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular tabs.
3578 float TabBorderSize; // Thickness of border around tabs.
3579 float TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected; // -1: always visible. 0.0f: visible when hovered. >0.0f: visible when hovered
3580 // if minimum width.
3581 float
3582 TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected; // -1: always visible. 0.0f: visible when hovered. >0.0f: visible when hovered
3583 // if minimum width. FLT_MAX: never show close button when unselected.
3584 float TabBarBorderSize; // Thickness of tab-bar separator, which takes on the tab active color to denote focus.
3585 float TabBarOverlineSize; // Thickness of tab-bar overline, which highlights the selected tab-bar.
3586 float TableAngledHeadersAngle; // Angle of angled headers (supported values range from -50.0f degrees to +50.0f
3587 // degrees).
3588 ImVec2 TableAngledHeadersTextAlign; // Alignment of angled headers within the cell
3589 ImGuiDir ColorButtonPosition; // Side of the color button in the ColorEdit4 widget (left/right). Defaults to
3590 // ImGuiDir_Right.
3591 ImVec2 ButtonTextAlign; // Alignment of button text when button is larger than text. Defaults to (0.5f, 0.5f)
3592 // (centered).
3593 ImVec2 SelectableTextAlign; // Alignment of selectable text. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.0f) (top-left aligned). It's
3594 // generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay multiple items on a
3595 // same line.
3596 float SeparatorTextBorderSize; // Thickness of border in SeparatorText()
3597 ImVec2
3598 SeparatorTextAlign; // Alignment of text within the separator. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.5f) (left aligned, center).
3599 ImVec2 SeparatorTextPadding; // Horizontal offset of text from each edge of the separator + spacing on other axis.
3600 // Generally small values. .y is recommended to be == FramePadding.y.
3601 ImVec2 DisplayWindowPadding; // Apply to regular windows: amount which we enforce to keep visible when moving near
3602 // edges of your screen.
3603 ImVec2 DisplaySafeAreaPadding; // Apply to every windows, menus, popups, tooltips: amount where we avoid displaying
3604 // contents. Adjust if you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV where
3605 // scaling has not been configured).
3606 float DockingSeparatorSize; // Thickness of resizing border between docked windows
3607 float MouseCursorScale; // Scale software rendered mouse cursor (when io.MouseDrawCursor is enabled). We apply
3608 // per-monitor DPI scaling over this scale. May be removed later.
3609 bool AntiAliasedLines; // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders. Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at
3610 // the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
3611 bool AntiAliasedLinesUseTex; // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures where possible. Require backend to
3612 // render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering). Latched at the
3613 // beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
3614 bool AntiAliasedFill; // Enable anti-aliased edges around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles, etc.). Disable
3615 // if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to
3616 // ImDrawList).
3617 float CurveTessellationTol; // Tessellation tolerance when using PathBezierCurveTo() without a specific number of
3618 // segments. Decrease for highly tessellated curves (higher quality, more polygons),
3619 // increase to reduce quality.
3620 float CircleTessellationMaxError; // Maximum error (in pixels) allowed when using AddCircle()/AddCircleFilled() or
3621 // drawing rounded corner rectangles with no explicit segment count specified.
3622 // Decrease for higher quality but more geometry.
3623
3624 // Colors
3625 ImVec4 Colors[ImGuiCol_COUNT];
3626
3627 // Behaviors
3628 // (It is possible to modify those fields mid-frame if specific behavior need it, unlike e.g. configuration fields
3629 // in ImGuiIO)
3630 float HoverStationaryDelay; // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary). Time required to consider
3631 // mouse stationary.
3632 float HoverDelayShort; // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort). Usually used along with
3633 // HoverStationaryDelay.
3634 float HoverDelayNormal; // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal). "
3635 ImGuiHoveredFlags HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse; // Default flags when using IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip)
3636 // or BeginItemTooltip()/SetItemTooltip() while using mouse.
3637 ImGuiHoveredFlags HoverFlagsForTooltipNav; // Default flags when using IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip)
3638 // or BeginItemTooltip()/SetItemTooltip() while using keyboard/gamepad.
3639
3640 IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle();
3641 IMGUI_API void ScaleAllSizes(float scale_factor);
3642
3643 // Obsolete names
3644#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3645 // TabMinWidthForCloseButton = TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected // Renamed in 1.91.9.
3646#endif
3647};
3648
3649//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3650// [SECTION] ImGuiIO
3651//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3652// Communicate most settings and inputs/outputs to Dear ImGui using this structure.
3653// Access via ImGui::GetIO(). Read 'Programmer guide' section in .cpp file for general usage.
3654// It is generally expected that:
3655// - initialization: backends and user code writes to ImGuiIO.
3656// - main loop: backends writes to ImGuiIO, user code and imgui code reads from ImGuiIO.
3657//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3658// Also see ImGui::GetPlatformIO() and ImGuiPlatformIO struct for OS/platform related functions: clipboard, IME etc.
3659//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3660
3661// [Internal] Storage used by IsKeyDown(), IsKeyPressed() etc functions.
3662// If prior to 1.87 you used io.KeysDownDuration[] (which was marked as internal), you should use
3663// GetKeyData(key)->DownDuration and *NOT* io.KeysData[key]->DownDuration.
3664struct ImGuiKeyData
3665{
3666 bool Down; // True for if key is down
3667 float DownDuration; // Duration the key has been down (<0.0f: not pressed, 0.0f: just pressed, >0.0f: time held)
3668 float DownDurationPrev; // Last frame duration the key has been down
3669 float AnalogValue; // 0.0f..1.0f for gamepad values
3670};
3671
3672struct ImGuiIO
3673{
3674 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3675 // Configuration // Default value
3676 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3677
3678 ImGuiConfigFlags ConfigFlags; // = 0 // See ImGuiConfigFlags_ enum. Set by user/application.
3679 // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation options, etc.
3680 ImGuiBackendFlags BackendFlags; // = 0 // See ImGuiBackendFlags_ enum. Set by backend (imgui_impl_xxx
3681 // files or custom backend) to communicate features supported by the backend.
3682 ImVec2 DisplaySize; // <unset> // Main display size, in pixels (generally == GetMainViewport()->Size). May
3683 // change every frame.
3684 float DeltaTime; // = 1.0f/60.0f // Time elapsed since last frame, in seconds. May change every frame.
3685 float IniSavingRate; // = 5.0f // Minimum time between saving positions/sizes to .ini file, in seconds.
3686 const char *IniFilename; // = "imgui.ini" // Path to .ini file (important: default "imgui.ini" is relative to
3687 // current working dir!). Set NULL to disable automatic .ini loading/saving or if you want
3688 // to manually call LoadIniSettingsXXX() / SaveIniSettingsXXX() functions.
3689 const char *LogFilename; // = "imgui_log.txt"// Path to .log file (default parameter to ImGui::LogToFile when no
3690 // file is specified).
3691 void *UserData; // = NULL // Store your own data.
3692
3693 // Font system
3694 ImFontAtlas
3695 *Fonts; // <auto> // Font atlas: load, rasterize and pack one or more fonts into a single texture.
3696 float FontGlobalScale; // = 1.0f // Global scale all fonts
3697 bool FontAllowUserScaling; // = false // [OBSOLETE] Allow user scaling text of individual window with
3698 // CTRL+Wheel.
3699 ImFont *FontDefault; // = NULL // Font to use on NewFrame(). Use NULL to uses Fonts->Fonts[0].
3700 ImVec2 DisplayFramebufferScale; // = (1, 1) // For retina display or other situations where window
3701 // coordinates are different from framebuffer coordinates. This generally ends up in
3702 // ImDrawData::FramebufferScale.
3703
3704 // Keyboard/Gamepad Navigation options
3705 bool ConfigNavSwapGamepadButtons; // = false // Swap Activate<>Cancel (A<>B) buttons, matching typical
3706 // "Nintendo/Japanese style" gamepad layout.
3707 bool ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos; // = false // Directional/tabbing navigation teleports the mouse cursor. May
3708 // be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is difficult. Will
3709 // update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true.
3710 bool ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard; // = true // Sets io.WantCaptureKeyboard when io.NavActive is set.
3711 bool ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusItem; // = true // Pressing Escape can clear focused item + navigation
3712 // id/highlight. Set to false if you want to always keep highlight on.
3713 bool ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusWindow; // = false // Pressing Escape can clear focused window as well (super
3714 // set of io.ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusItem).
3715 bool ConfigNavCursorVisibleAuto; // = true // Using directional navigation key makes the cursor visible.
3716 // Mouse click hides the cursor.
3717 bool ConfigNavCursorVisibleAlways; // = false // Navigation cursor is always visible.
3718
3719 // Docking options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable is set)
3720 bool ConfigDockingNoSplit; // = false // Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is
3721 // limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.
3722 bool ConfigDockingWithShift; // = false // Enable docking with holding Shift key (reduce visual noise,
3723 // allows dropping in wider space)
3724 bool ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar; // = false // [BETA] [FIXME: This currently creates regression with
3725 // auto-sizing and general overhead] Make every single floating window display
3726 // within a docking node.
3727 bool ConfigDockingTransparentPayload; // = false // [BETA] Make window or viewport transparent when docking
3728 // and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering
3729 // of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with
3730 // ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.
3731
3732 // Viewport options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is set)
3733 bool ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge; // = false; // Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their
3734 // own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when
3735 // overlapping it. May also set ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge on individual
3736 // viewport.
3737 bool ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon; // = false // Disable default OS task bar icon flag for secondary
3738 // viewports. When a viewport doesn't want a task bar icon,
3739 // ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon will be set on it.
3740 bool ConfigViewportsNoDecoration; // = true // Disable default OS window decoration flag for secondary
3741 // viewports. When a viewport doesn't want window decorations,
3742 // ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration will be set on it. Enabling decoration can
3743 // create subsequent issues at OS levels (e.g. minimum window size).
3744 bool ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent; // = false // Disable default OS parenting to main viewport for
3745 // secondary viewports. By default, viewports are marked with ParentViewportId
3746 // = <main_viewport>, expecting the platform backend to setup a parent/child
3747 // relationship between the OS windows (some backend may ignore this). Set to
3748 // true if you want the default to be 0, then all viewports will be top-level
3749 // OS windows.
3750
3751 // Miscellaneous options
3752 // (you can visualize and interact with all options in 'Demo->Configuration')
3753 bool MouseDrawCursor; // = false // Request ImGui to draw a mouse cursor for you (if you are on a platform
3754 // without a mouse cursor). Cannot be easily renamed to 'io.ConfigXXX' because this is
3755 // frequently used by backend implementations.
3756 bool ConfigMacOSXBehaviors; // = defined(__APPLE__) // Swap Cmd<>Ctrl keys + OS X style text editing cursor movement
3757 // using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start
3758 // and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of
3759 // selecting whole text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl.
3760 bool ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue; // = true // Enable input queue trickling: some types of events
3761 // submitted during the same frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over
3762 // multiple frames, improving interactions with low framerates.
3763 bool ConfigInputTextCursorBlink; // = true // Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it
3764 // to be distracting).
3765 bool ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive; // = false // [BETA] Pressing Enter will keep item active and select
3766 // contents (single-line only).
3767 bool ConfigDragClickToInputText; // = false // [BETA] Enable turning DragXXX widgets into text input with a
3768 // simple mouse click-release (without moving). Not desirable on devices without a
3769 // keyboard.
3770 bool ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges; // = true // Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the
3771 // lower-left corner. This requires ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors for better
3772 // mouse cursor feedback. (This used to be a per-window
3773 // ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide flag)
3774 bool ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly; // = false // Enable allowing to move windows only when clicking on
3775 // their title bar. Does not apply to windows without a title bar.
3776 bool ConfigWindowsCopyContentsWithCtrlC; // = false // [EXPERIMENTAL] CTRL+C copy the contents of focused
3777 // window into the clipboard. Experimental because: (1) has known issues
3778 // with nested Begin/End pairs (2) text output quality varies (3) text
3779 // output is in submission order rather than spatial order.
3780 bool ConfigScrollbarScrollByPage; // = true // Enable scrolling page by page when clicking outside the
3781 // scrollbar grab. When disabled, always scroll to clicked location. When enabled,
3782 // Shift+Click scrolls to clicked location.
3783 float ConfigMemoryCompactTimer; // = 60.0f // Timer (in seconds) to free transient windows/tables memory
3784 // buffers when unused. Set to -1.0f to disable.
3785
3786 // Inputs Behaviors
3787 // (other variables, ones which are expected to be tweaked within UI code, are exposed in ImGuiStyle)
3788 float MouseDoubleClickTime; // = 0.30f // Time for a double-click, in seconds.
3789 float MouseDoubleClickMaxDist; // = 6.0f // Distance threshold to stay in to validate a double-click, in
3790 // pixels.
3791 float MouseDragThreshold; // = 6.0f // Distance threshold before considering we are dragging.
3792 float KeyRepeatDelay; // = 0.275f // When holding a key/button, time before it starts repeating, in seconds
3793 // (for buttons in Repeat mode, etc.).
3794 float KeyRepeatRate; // = 0.050f // When holding a key/button, rate at which it repeats, in seconds.
3795
3796 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3797 // Debug options
3798 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3799
3800 // Options to configure Error Handling and how we handle recoverable errors [EXPERIMENTAL]
3801 // - Error recovery is provided as a way to facilitate:
3802 // - Recovery after a programming error (native code or scripting language - the later tends to facilitate
3803 // iterating on code while running).
3804 // - Recovery after running an exception handler or any error processing which may skip code after an error has
3805 // been detected.
3806 // - Error recovery is not perfect nor guaranteed! It is a feature to ease development.
3807 // You not are not supposed to rely on it in the course of a normal application run.
3808 // - Functions that support error recovery are using IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR() instead of IM_ASSERT().
3809 // - By design, we do NOT allow error recovery to be 100% silent. One of the three options needs to be checked!
3810 // - Always ensure that on programmers seats you have at minimum Asserts or Tooltips enabled when making direct
3811 // imgui API calls!
3812 // Otherwise it would severely hinder your ability to catch and correct mistakes!
3813 // Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Error-Handling for details.
3814 // - Programmer seats: keep asserts (default), or disable asserts and keep error tooltips (new and nice!)
3815 // - Non-programmer seats: maybe disable asserts, but make sure errors are resurfaced (tooltips, visible log
3816 // entries, use callback etc.)
3817 // - Recovery after error/exception: record stack sizes with ErrorRecoveryStoreState(), disable assert, set log
3818 // callback (to e.g. trigger high-level breakpoint), recover with ErrorRecoveryTryToRecoverState(), restore
3819 // settings.
3820 bool ConfigErrorRecovery; // = true // Enable error recovery support. Some errors won't be detected and lead
3821 // to direct crashes if recovery is disabled.
3822 bool ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert; // = true // Enable asserts on recoverable error. By default call
3823 // IM_ASSERT() when returning from a failing IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR()
3824 bool ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableDebugLog; // = true // Enable debug log output on recoverable errors.
3825 bool ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableTooltip; // = true // Enable tooltip on recoverable errors. The tooltip include
