3826 // a way to enable asserts if they were disabled.
3827
3828 // Option to enable various debug tools showing buttons that will call the IM_DEBUG_BREAK() macro.
3829 // - The Item Picker tool will be available regardless of this being enabled, in order to maximize its
3830 // discoverability.
3831 // - Requires a debugger being attached, otherwise IM_DEBUG_BREAK() options will appear to crash your application.
3832 // e.g. io.ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent = ::IsDebuggerPresent() on Win32, or refer to ImOsIsDebuggerPresent()
3833 // imgui_test_engine/imgui_te_utils.cpp for a Unix compatible version).
3834 bool ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent; // = false // Enable various tools calling IM_DEBUG_BREAK().
3835
3836 // Tools to detect code submitting items with conflicting/duplicate IDs
3837 // - Code should use PushID()/PopID() in loops, or append "##xx" to same-label identifiers.
3838 // - Empty label e.g. Button("") == same ID as parent widget/node. Use Button("##xx") instead!
3839 // - See FAQ https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#q-about-the-id-stack-system
3840 bool ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflicts; // = true // Highlight and show an error message popup when multiple
3841 // items have conflicting identifiers.
3842 bool ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflictsShowItemPicker; //=true // Show "Item Picker" button in aforementioned popup.
3843
3844 // Tools to test correct Begin/End and BeginChild/EndChild behaviors.
3845 // - Presently Begin()/End() and BeginChild()/EndChild() needs to ALWAYS be called in tandem, regardless of return
3846 // value of BeginXXX()
3847 // - This is inconsistent with other BeginXXX functions and create confusion for many users.
3848 // - We expect to update the API eventually. In the meanwhile we provide tools to facilitate checking user-code
3849 // behavior.
3850 bool ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueOnce; // = false // First-time calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return
3851 // false. NEEDS TO BE SET AT APPLICATION BOOT TIME if you don't want to miss
3852 // windows.
3853 bool ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueLoop; // = false // Some calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.
3854 // Will cycle through window depths then repeat. Suggested use: add
3855 // "io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValue = io.KeyShift" in your main loop then
3856 // occasionally press SHIFT. Windows should be flickering while running.
3857
3858 // Option to deactivate io.AddFocusEvent(false) handling.
3859 // - May facilitate interactions with a debugger when focus loss leads to clearing inputs data.
3860 // - Backends may have other side-effects on focus loss, so this will reduce side-effects but not necessary remove
3861 // all of them.
3862 bool ConfigDebugIgnoreFocusLoss; // = false // Ignore io.AddFocusEvent(false), consequently not calling
3863 // io.ClearInputKeys()/io.ClearInputMouse() in input processing.
3864
3865 // Option to audit .ini data
3866 bool ConfigDebugIniSettings; // = false // Save .ini data with extra comments (particularly helpful for
3867 // Docking, but makes saving slower)
3868
3869 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3870 // Platform Identifiers
3871 // (the imgui_impl_xxxx backend files are setting those up for you)
3872 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3873
3874 // Nowadays those would be stored in ImGuiPlatformIO but we are leaving them here for legacy reasons.
3875 // Optional: Platform/Renderer backend name (informational only! will be displayed in About Window) + User data for
3876 // backend/wrappers to store their own stuff.
3877 const char *BackendPlatformName; // = NULL
3878 const char *BackendRendererName; // = NULL
3879 void *BackendPlatformUserData; // = NULL // User data for platform backend
3880 void *BackendRendererUserData; // = NULL // User data for renderer backend
3881 void *BackendLanguageUserData; // = NULL // User data for non C++ programming language backend
3882
3883 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3884 // Input - Call before calling NewFrame()
3885 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3886
3887 // Input Functions
3888 IMGUI_API void AddKeyEvent(
3889 ImGuiKey key, bool down); // Queue a new key down/up event. Key should be "translated" (as in, generally
3890 // ImGuiKey_A matches the key end-user would use to emit an 'A' character)
3891 IMGUI_API void AddKeyAnalogEvent(
3892 ImGuiKey key, bool down, float v); // Queue a new key down/up event for analog values (e.g. ImGuiKey_Gamepad_
3893 // values). Dead-zones should be handled by the backend.
3894 IMGUI_API void AddMousePosEvent(float x, float y); // Queue a mouse position update. Use -FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX to
3895 // signify no mouse (e.g. app not focused and not hovered)
3896 IMGUI_API void AddMouseButtonEvent(int button, bool down); // Queue a mouse button change
3897 IMGUI_API void AddMouseWheelEvent(float wheel_x,
3898 float wheel_y); // Queue a mouse wheel update. wheel_y<0: scroll down, wheel_y>0:
3899 // scroll up, wheel_x<0: scroll right, wheel_x>0: scroll left.
3900 IMGUI_API void AddMouseSourceEvent(ImGuiMouseSource source); // Queue a mouse source change (Mouse/TouchScreen/Pen)
3901 IMGUI_API void AddMouseViewportEvent(
3902 ImGuiID id); // Queue a mouse hovered viewport. Requires backend to set
3903 // ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport to call this (for multi-viewport support).
3904 IMGUI_API void AddFocusEvent(bool focused); // Queue a gain/loss of focus for the application (generally based on
3905 // OS/platform focus of your window)
3906 IMGUI_API void AddInputCharacter(unsigned int c); // Queue a new character input
3907 IMGUI_API void AddInputCharacterUTF16(
3908 ImWchar16 c); // Queue a new character input from a UTF-16 character, it can be a surrogate
3909 IMGUI_API void AddInputCharactersUTF8(const char *str); // Queue a new characters input from a UTF-8 string
3910
3911 IMGUI_API void SetKeyEventNativeData(
3912 ImGuiKey key, int native_keycode, int native_scancode,
3913 int native_legacy_index = -1); // [Optional] Specify index for legacy <1.87 IsKeyXXX() functions with native
3914 // indices + specify native keycode, scancode.
3915 IMGUI_API void SetAppAcceptingEvents(
3916 bool accepting_events); // Set master flag for accepting key/mouse/text events (default to true). Useful if you
3917 // have native dialog boxes that are interrupting your application loop/refresh, and you
3918 // want to disable events being queued while your app is frozen.
3919 IMGUI_API void ClearEventsQueue(); // Clear all incoming events.
3920 IMGUI_API void ClearInputKeys(); // Clear current keyboard/gamepad state + current frame text input buffer.
3921 // Equivalent to releasing all keys/buttons.
3922 IMGUI_API void ClearInputMouse(); // Clear current mouse state.
3923#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3924 IMGUI_API void ClearInputCharacters(); // [Obsoleted in 1.89.8] Clear the current frame text input buffer. Now
3925 // included within ClearInputKeys().
3926#endif
3927
3928 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3929 // Output - Updated by NewFrame() or EndFrame()/Render()
3930 // (when reading from the io.WantCaptureMouse, io.WantCaptureKeyboard flags to dispatch your inputs, it is
3931 // generally easier and more correct to use their state BEFORE calling NewFrame(). See FAQ for details!)
3932 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3933
3934 bool WantCaptureMouse; // Set when Dear ImGui will use mouse inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main
3935 // game/application (either way, always pass on mouse inputs to imgui). (e.g. unclicked mouse
3936 // is hovering over an imgui window, widget is active, mouse was clicked over an imgui
3937 // window, etc.).
3938 bool WantCaptureKeyboard; // Set when Dear ImGui will use keyboard inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your
3939 // main game/application (either way, always pass keyboard inputs to imgui). (e.g.
3940 // InputText active, or an imgui window is focused and navigation is enabled, etc.).
3941 bool WantTextInput; // Mobile/console: when set, you may display an on-screen keyboard. This is set by Dear ImGui
3942 // when it wants textual keyboard input to happen (e.g. when a InputText widget is active).
3943 bool WantSetMousePos; // MousePos has been altered, backend should reposition mouse on next frame. Rarely used! Set
3944 // only when io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos is enabled.
3945 bool WantSaveIniSettings; // When manual .ini load/save is active (io.IniFilename == NULL), this will be set to
3946 // notify your application that you can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory() and save yourself.
3947 // Important: clear io.WantSaveIniSettings yourself after saving!
3948 bool NavActive; // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation is currently allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events) = a window
3949 // is focused and it doesn't use the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs flag.
3950 bool NavVisible; // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation highlight is visible and allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX
3951 // events).
3952 float Framerate; // Estimate of application framerate (rolling average over 60 frames, based on io.DeltaTime), in
3953 // frame per second. Solely for convenience. Slow applications may not want to use a moving average
3954 // or may want to reset underlying buffers occasionally.
3955 int MetricsRenderVertices; // Vertices output during last call to Render()
3956 int MetricsRenderIndices; // Indices output during last call to Render() = number of triangles * 3
3957 int MetricsRenderWindows; // Number of visible windows
3958 int MetricsActiveWindows; // Number of active windows
3959 ImVec2 MouseDelta; // Mouse delta. Note that this is zero if either current or previous position are invalid
3960 // (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX), so a disappearing/reappearing mouse won't have a huge delta.
3961
3962 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3963 // [Internal] Dear ImGui will maintain those fields. Forward compatibility not guaranteed!
3964 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3965
3966 ImGuiContext *Ctx; // Parent UI context (needs to be set explicitly by parent).
3967
3968 // Main Input State
3969 // (this block used to be written by backend, since 1.87 it is best to NOT write to those directly, call the AddXXX
3970 // functions above instead) (reading from those variables is fair game, as they are extremely unlikely to be moving
3971 // anywhere)
3972 ImVec2 MousePos; // Mouse position, in pixels. Set to ImVec2(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX) if mouse is unavailable (on another
3973 // screen, etc.)
3974 bool MouseDown[5]; // Mouse buttons: 0=left, 1=right, 2=middle + extras (ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT == 5). Dear ImGui
3975 // mostly uses left and right buttons. Other buttons allow us to track if the mouse is being used
3976 // by your application + available to user as a convenience via IsMouse** API.
3977 float MouseWheel; // Mouse wheel Vertical: 1 unit scrolls about 5 lines text. >0 scrolls Up, <0 scrolls Down. Hold
3978 // SHIFT to turn vertical scroll into horizontal scroll.
3979 float MouseWheelH; // Mouse wheel Horizontal. >0 scrolls Left, <0 scrolls Right. Most users don't have a mouse with
3980 // a horizontal wheel, may not be filled by all backends.
3981 ImGuiMouseSource MouseSource; // Mouse actual input peripheral (Mouse/TouchScreen/Pen).
3982 ImGuiID MouseHoveredViewport; // (Optional) Modify using io.AddMouseViewportEvent(). With multi-viewports: viewport
3983 // the OS mouse is hovering. If possible _IGNORING_ viewports with the
3984 // ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag is much better (few backends can handle that). Set
3985 // io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport if you can provide
3986 // this info. If you don't imgui will infer the value using the rectangles and last
3987 // focused time of the viewports it knows about (ignoring other OS windows).
3988 bool KeyCtrl; // Keyboard modifier down: Control
3989 bool KeyShift; // Keyboard modifier down: Shift
3990 bool KeyAlt; // Keyboard modifier down: Alt
3991 bool KeySuper; // Keyboard modifier down: Cmd/Super/Windows
3992
3993 // Other state maintained from data above + IO function calls
3994 ImGuiKeyChord
3995 KeyMods; // Key mods flags (any of ImGuiMod_Ctrl/ImGuiMod_Shift/ImGuiMod_Alt/ImGuiMod_Super flags, same as
3996 // io.KeyCtrl/KeyShift/KeyAlt/KeySuper but merged into flags. Read-only, updated by NewFrame()
3997 ImGuiKeyData
3998 KeysData[ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT]; // Key state for all known keys. Use IsKeyXXX() functions to access this.
3999 bool WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose; // Alternative to WantCaptureMouse: (WantCaptureMouse == true &&
4000 // WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose == false) when a click over void is
4001 // expected to close a popup.
4002 ImVec2 MousePosPrev; // Previous mouse position (note that MouseDelta is not necessary == MousePos-MousePosPrev, in
4003 // case either position is invalid)
4004 ImVec2 MouseClickedPos[5]; // Position at time of clicking
4005 double MouseClickedTime[5]; // Time of last click (used to figure out double-click)
4006 bool MouseClicked[5]; // Mouse button went from !Down to Down (same as MouseClickedCount[x] != 0)
4007 bool MouseDoubleClicked[5]; // Has mouse button been double-clicked? (same as MouseClickedCount[x] == 2)
4008 ImU16 MouseClickedCount[5]; // == 0 (not clicked), == 1 (same as MouseClicked[]), == 2 (double-clicked), == 3
4009 // (triple-clicked) etc. when going from !Down to Down
4010 ImU16 MouseClickedLastCount[5]; // Count successive number of clicks. Stays valid after mouse release. Reset after
4011 // another click is done.
4012 bool MouseReleased[5]; // Mouse button went from Down to !Down
4013 double MouseReleasedTime[5]; // Time of last released (rarely used! but useful to handle delayed single-click when
4014 // trying to disambiguate them from double-click).
4015 bool
4016 MouseDownOwned[5]; // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window or over void blocked by a popup. We
4017 // don't request mouse capture from the application if click started outside ImGui bounds.
4018 bool MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[5]; // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window.
4019 bool MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap; // On a non-Mac system, holding SHIFT requests WheelY to perform the equivalent of a
4020 // WheelX event. On a Mac system this is already enforced by the system.
4021 bool MouseCtrlLeftAsRightClick; // (OSX) Set to true when the current click was a Ctrl+click that spawned a
4022 // simulated right click
4023 float MouseDownDuration[5]; // Duration the mouse button has been down (0.0f == just clicked)
4024 float MouseDownDurationPrev[5]; // Previous time the mouse button has been down
4025 ImVec2 MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[5]; // Maximum distance, absolute, on each axis, of how much mouse has traveled from
4026 // the clicking point
4027 float MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[5]; // Squared maximum distance of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point
4028 // (used for moving thresholds)
4029 float PenPressure; // Touch/Pen pressure (0.0f to 1.0f, should be >0.0f only when MouseDown[0] == true). Helper
4030 // storage currently unused by Dear ImGui.
4031 bool AppFocusLost; // Only modify via AddFocusEvent()
4032 bool AppAcceptingEvents; // Only modify via SetAppAcceptingEvents()
4033 ImWchar16 InputQueueSurrogate; // For AddInputCharacterUTF16()
4034 ImVector<ImWchar> InputQueueCharacters; // Queue of _characters_ input (obtained by platform backend). Fill using
4035 // AddInputCharacter() helper.
4036
4037 // Legacy: before 1.87, we required backend to fill io.KeyMap[] (imgui->native map) during initialization and
4038 // io.KeysDown[] (native indices) every frame. This is still temporarily supported as a legacy feature. However the
4039 // new preferred scheme is for backend to call io.AddKeyEvent().
4040 // Old (<1.87): ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGui::GetIO().KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space]) --> New (1.87+)
4041 // ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space) Old (<1.87): ImGui::IsKeyPressed(MYPLATFORM_KEY_SPACE) --> New (1.87+)
4042 // ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space)
4043 // Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4921 for details.
4044 // int KeyMap[ImGuiKey_COUNT]; // [LEGACY] Input: map of indices into the KeysDown[512] entries
4045 // array which represent your "native" keyboard state. The first 512 are now unused and should be kept zero. Legacy
4046 // backend will write into KeyMap[] using ImGuiKey_ indices which are always >512. bool KeysDown[ImGuiKey_COUNT]; //
4047 // [LEGACY] Input: Keyboard keys that are pressed (ideally left in the "native" order your engine has access to
4048 // keyboard keys, so you can use your own defines/enums for keys). This used to be [512] sized. It is now
4049 // ImGuiKey_COUNT to allow legacy io.KeysDown[GetKeyIndex(...)] to work without an overflow. float
4050 // NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_COUNT]; // [LEGACY] Since 1.88, NavInputs[] was removed. Backends from 1.60 to 1.86
4051 // won't build. Feed gamepad inputs via io.AddKeyEvent() and ImGuiKey_GamepadXXX enums. void* ImeWindowHandle;
4052 // // [Obsoleted in 1.87] Set ImGuiViewport::PlatformHandleRaw instead. Set this to your HWND to get automatic IME
4053 // cursor positioning.
4054
4055 // Legacy: before 1.91.1, clipboard functions were stored in ImGuiIO instead of ImGuiPlatformIO.
4056 // As this is will affect all users of custom engines/backends, we are providing proper legacy redirection (will
4057 // obsolete).
4058#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4059 const char *(*GetClipboardTextFn)(void *user_data);
4060 void (*SetClipboardTextFn)(void *user_data, const char *text);
4061 void *ClipboardUserData;
4062#endif
4063
4064 IMGUI_API ImGuiIO();
4065};
4066
4067//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4068// [SECTION] Misc data structures (ImGuiInputTextCallbackData, ImGuiSizeCallbackData, ImGuiPayload)
4069//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4070
4071// Shared state of InputText(), passed as an argument to your callback when a ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* flag is
4072// used. The callback function should return 0 by default. Callbacks (follow a flag name and see comments in
4073// ImGuiInputTextFlags_ declarations for more details)
4074// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit: Callback on buffer edit. Note that InputText() already returns true on
4075// edit + you can always use IsItemEdited(). The callback is useful to manipulate the underlying buffer while focus is
4076// active.
4077// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways: Callback on each iteration
4078// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion: Callback on pressing TAB
4079// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory: Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows
4080// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter: Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify
4081// 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.
4082// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize: Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter
4083// value), allowing the string to grow.
4084struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData
4085{
4086 ImGuiContext *Ctx; // Parent UI context
4087 ImGuiInputTextFlags EventFlag; // One ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* // Read-only
4088 ImGuiInputTextFlags Flags; // What user passed to InputText() // Read-only
4089 void *UserData; // What user passed to InputText() // Read-only
4090
4091 // Arguments for the different callback events
4092 // - During Resize callback, Buf will be same as your input buffer.
4093 // - However, during Completion/History/Always callback, Buf always points to our own internal data (it is not the
4094 // same as your buffer)! Changes to it will be reflected into your own buffer shortly after the callback.
4095 // - To modify the text buffer in a callback, prefer using the InsertChars() / DeleteChars() function. InsertChars()
4096 // will take care of calling the resize callback if necessary.
4097 // - If you know your edits are not going to resize the underlying buffer allocation, you may modify the contents of
4098 // 'Buf[]' directly. You need to update 'BufTextLen' accordingly (0 <= BufTextLen < BufSize) and set 'BufDirty'' to
4099 // true so InputText can update its internal state.
4100 ImWchar EventChar; // Character input // Read-write // [CharFilter] Replace character with
4101 // another one, or set to zero to drop. return 1 is equivalent to setting EventChar=0;
4102 ImGuiKey EventKey; // Key pressed (Up/Down/TAB) // Read-only // [Completion,History]
4103 char *Buf; // Text buffer // Read-write // [Resize] Can replace pointer /
4104 // [Completion,History,Always] Only write to pointed data, don't replace the actual pointer!
4105 int BufTextLen; // Text length (in bytes) // Read-write // [Resize,Completion,History,Always]
4106 // Exclude zero-terminator storage. In C land: == strlen(some_text), in C++ land: string.length()
4107 int BufSize; // Buffer size (in bytes) = capacity+1 // Read-only // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Include
4108 // zero-terminator storage. In C land == ARRAYSIZE(my_char_array), in C++ land: string.capacity()+1
4109 bool BufDirty; // Set if you modify Buf/BufTextLen! // Write // [Completion,History,Always]
4110 int CursorPos; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always]
4111 int SelectionStart; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always] == to
4112 // SelectionEnd when no selection)
4113 int SelectionEnd; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always]
4114
4115 // Helper functions for text manipulation.
4116 // Use those function to benefit from the CallbackResize behaviors. Calling those function reset the selection.
4117 IMGUI_API ImGuiInputTextCallbackData();
4118 IMGUI_API void DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count);
4119 IMGUI_API void InsertChars(int pos, const char *text, const char *text_end = NULL);
4120 void SelectAll()
4121 {
4122 SelectionStart = 0;
4123 SelectionEnd = BufTextLen;
4124 }
4125 void ClearSelection()
4126 {
4127 SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = BufTextLen;
4128 }
4129 bool HasSelection() const
4130 {
4131 return SelectionStart != SelectionEnd;
4132 }
4133};
4134
4135// Resizing callback data to apply custom constraint. As enabled by SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Callback is called
4136// during the next Begin(). NB: For basic min/max size constraint on each axis you don't need to use the callback! The
4137// SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() parameters are enough.
4138struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData
4139{
4140 void *UserData; // Read-only. What user passed to SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Generally store an integer or
4141 // float in here (need reinterpret_cast<>).
4142 ImVec2 Pos; // Read-only. Window position, for reference.
4143 ImVec2 CurrentSize; // Read-only. Current window size.
4144 ImVec2 DesiredSize; // Read-write. Desired size, based on user's mouse position. Write to this field to restrain
4145 // resizing.
4146};
4147
4148// [ALPHA] Rarely used / very advanced uses only. Use with SetNextWindowClass() and DockSpace() functions.
4149// Important: the content of this class is still highly WIP and likely to change and be refactored
4150// before we stabilize Docking features. Please be mindful if using this.
4151// Provide hints:
4152// - To the platform backend via altered viewport flags (enable/disable OS decoration, OS task bar icons, etc.)
4153// - To the platform backend for OS level parent/child relationships of viewport.
4154// - To the docking system for various options and filtering.
4155struct ImGuiWindowClass
4156{
4157 ImGuiID ClassId; // User data. 0 = Default class (unclassed). Windows of different classes cannot be docked with
4158 // each others.
4159 ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // Hint for the platform backend. -1: use default. 0: request platform backend to not
4160 // parent the platform. != 0: request platform backend to create a parent<>child
4161 // relationship between the platform windows. Not conforming backends are free to e.g.
4162 // parent every viewport to the main viewport or not.
4163 ImGuiID FocusRouteParentWindowId; // ID of parent window for shortcut focus route evaluation, e.g. Shortcut() call
4164 // from Parent Window will succeed when this window is focused.
4165 ImGuiViewportFlags ViewportFlagsOverrideSet; // Viewport flags to set when a window of this class owns a viewport.
4166 // This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override
4167 // the defaults on a per-window basis.
4168 ImGuiViewportFlags ViewportFlagsOverrideClear; // Viewport flags to clear when a window of this class owns a
4169 // viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar
4170 // icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
4171 ImGuiTabItemFlags TabItemFlagsOverrideSet; // [EXPERIMENTAL] TabItem flags to set when a window of this class gets
4172 // submitted into a dock node tab bar. May use with
4173 // ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading or ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing.
4174 ImGuiDockNodeFlags DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet; // [EXPERIMENTAL] Dock node flags to set when a window of this class is
4175 // hosted by a dock node (it doesn't have to be selected!)
4176 bool DockingAlwaysTabBar; // Set to true to enforce single floating windows of this class always having their own
4177 // docking node (equivalent of setting the global io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar)
4178 bool DockingAllowUnclassed; // Set to true to allow windows of this class to be docked/merged with an unclassed
4179 // window. // FIXME-DOCK: Move to DockNodeFlags override?
4180
4181 ImGuiWindowClass()
4182 {
4183 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4184 ParentViewportId = (ImGuiID)-1;
4185 DockingAllowUnclassed = true;
4186 }
4187};
4188
4189// Data payload for Drag and Drop operations: AcceptDragDropPayload(), GetDragDropPayload()
4190struct ImGuiPayload
4191{
4192 // Members
4193 void *Data; // Data (copied and owned by dear imgui)
4194 int DataSize; // Data size
4195
4196 // [Internal]
4197 ImGuiID SourceId; // Source item id
4198 ImGuiID SourceParentId; // Source parent id (if available)
4199 int DataFrameCount; // Data timestamp
4200 char DataType[32 + 1]; // Data type tag (short user-supplied string, 32 characters max)
4201 bool Preview; // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse has been hovering the target item (nb: handle
4202 // overlapping drag targets)
4203 bool Delivery; // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse button is released over the target item.
4204
4205 ImGuiPayload()
4206 {
4207 Clear();
4208 }
4209 void Clear()
4210 {
4211 SourceId = SourceParentId = 0;
4212 Data = NULL;
4213 DataSize = 0;
4214 memset(DataType, 0, sizeof(DataType));
4215 DataFrameCount = -1;
4216 Preview = Delivery = false;
4217 }
4218 bool IsDataType(const char *type) const
4219 {
4220 return DataFrameCount != -1 && strcmp(type, DataType) == 0;
4221 }
4222 bool IsPreview() const
4223 {
4224 return Preview;
4225 }
4226 bool IsDelivery() const
4227 {
4228 return Delivery;
4229 }
4230};
4231
4232//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4233// [SECTION] Helpers (ImGuiOnceUponAFrame, ImGuiTextFilter, ImGuiTextBuffer, ImGuiStorage, ImGuiListClipper, Math
4234// Operators, ImColor)
4235//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4236
4237// Helper: Unicode defines
4238#define IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_INVALID 0xFFFD // Invalid Unicode code point (standard value).
4239#ifdef IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32
4240#define IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX 0x10FFFF // Maximum Unicode code point supported by this build.
4241#else
4242#define IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX 0xFFFF // Maximum Unicode code point supported by this build.
4243#endif
4244
4245// Helper: Execute a block of code at maximum once a frame. Convenient if you want to quickly create a UI within
4246// deep-nested code that runs multiple times every frame. Usage: static ImGuiOnceUponAFrame oaf; if (oaf)
4247// ImGui::Text("This will be called only once per frame");
4248struct ImGuiOnceUponAFrame
4249{
4250 ImGuiOnceUponAFrame()
4251 {
4252 RefFrame = -1;
4253 }
4254 mutable int RefFrame;
4255 operator bool() const
4256 {
4257 int current_frame = ImGui::GetFrameCount();
4258 if (RefFrame == current_frame)
4259 return false;
4260 RefFrame = current_frame;
4261 return true;
4262 }
4263};
4264
4265// Helper: Parse and apply text filters. In format "aaaaa[,bbbb][,ccccc]"
4266struct ImGuiTextFilter
4267{
4268 IMGUI_API ImGuiTextFilter(const char *default_filter = "");
4269 IMGUI_API bool Draw(const char *label = "Filter (inc,-exc)", float width = 0.0f); // Helper calling InputText+Build
4270 IMGUI_API bool PassFilter(const char *text, const char *text_end = NULL) const;
4271 IMGUI_API void Build();
4272 void Clear()
4273 {
4274 InputBuf[0] = 0;
4275 Build();
4276 }
4277 bool IsActive() const
4278 {
4279 return !Filters.empty();
4280 }
4281
4282 // [Internal]
4283 struct ImGuiTextRange
4284 {
4285 const char *b;
4286 const char *e;
4287
4288 ImGuiTextRange()
4289 {
4290 b = e = NULL;
4291 }
4292 ImGuiTextRange(const char *_b, const char *_e)
4293 {
4294 b = _b;
4295 e = _e;
4296 }
4297 bool empty() const
4298 {
4299 return b == e;
4300 }
4301 IMGUI_API void split(char separator, ImVector<ImGuiTextRange> *out) const;
4302 };
4303 char InputBuf[256];
4304 ImVector<ImGuiTextRange> Filters;
4305 int CountGrep;
4306};
4307
4308// Helper: Growable text buffer for logging/accumulating text
4309// (this could be called 'ImGuiTextBuilder' / 'ImGuiStringBuilder')
4310struct ImGuiTextBuffer
4311{
4312 ImVector<char> Buf;
4313 IMGUI_API static char EmptyString[1];
4314
4315 ImGuiTextBuffer()
4316 {
4317 }
4318 inline char operator[](int i) const
4319 {
4320 IM_ASSERT(Buf.Data != NULL);
4321 return Buf.Data[i];
4322 }
4323 const char *begin() const
4324 {
4325 return Buf.Data ? &Buf.front() : EmptyString;
4326 }
4327 const char *end() const
4328 {
4329 return Buf.Data ? &Buf.back() : EmptyString;
4330 } // Buf is zero-terminated, so end() will point on the zero-terminator
4331 int size() const
4332 {
4333 return Buf.Size ? Buf.Size - 1 : 0;
4334 }
4335 bool empty() const
4336 {
4337 return Buf.Size <= 1;
4338 }
4339 void clear()
4340 {
4341 Buf.clear();
4342 }
4343 void resize(int size)
4344 {
4345 if (Buf.Size > size)
4346 Buf.Data[size] = 0;
4347 Buf.resize(size ? size + 1 : 0, 0);
4348 } // Similar to resize(0) on ImVector: empty string but don't free buffer.
4349 void reserve(int capacity)
4350 {
4351 Buf.reserve(capacity);
4352 }
4353 const char *c_str() const
4354 {
4355 return Buf.Data ? Buf.Data : EmptyString;
4356 }
4357 IMGUI_API void append(const char *str, const char *str_end = NULL);
4358 IMGUI_API void appendf(const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2);
4359 IMGUI_API void appendfv(const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
4360};
4361
4362// [Internal] Key+Value for ImGuiStorage
4363struct ImGuiStoragePair
4364{
4365 ImGuiID key;
4366 union {
4367 int val_i;
4368 float val_f;
4369 void *val_p;
4370 };
4371 ImGuiStoragePair(ImGuiID _key, int _val)
4372 {
4373 key = _key;
4374 val_i = _val;
4375 }
4376 ImGuiStoragePair(ImGuiID _key, float _val)
4377 {
4378 key = _key;
4379 val_f = _val;
4380 }
4381 ImGuiStoragePair(ImGuiID _key, void *_val)
4382 {
4383 key = _key;
4384 val_p = _val;
4385 }
4386};
4387
4388// Helper: Key->Value storage
4389// Typically you don't have to worry about this since a storage is held within each Window.
4390// We use it to e.g. store collapse state for a tree (Int 0/1)
4391// This is optimized for efficient lookup (dichotomy into a contiguous buffer) and rare insertion (typically tied to
4392// user interactions aka max once a frame) You can use it as custom user storage for temporary values. Declare your own
4393// storage if, for example:
4394// - You want to manipulate the open/close state of a particular sub-tree in your interface (tree node uses Int 0/1 to
4395// store their state).
4396// - You want to store custom debug data easily without adding or editing structures in your code (probably not
4397// efficient, but convenient) Types are NOT stored, so it is up to you to make sure your Key don't collide with
4398// different types.
4399struct ImGuiStorage
4400{
4401 // [Internal]
4402 ImVector<ImGuiStoragePair> Data;
4403
4404 // - Get***() functions find pair, never add/allocate. Pairs are sorted so a query is O(log N)
4405 // - Set***() functions find pair, insertion on demand if missing.
4406 // - Sorted insertion is costly, paid once. A typical frame shouldn't need to insert any new pair.
4407 void Clear()
4408 {
4409 Data.clear();
4410 }
4411 IMGUI_API int GetInt(ImGuiID key, int default_val = 0) const;
4412 IMGUI_API void SetInt(ImGuiID key, int val);
4413 IMGUI_API bool GetBool(ImGuiID key, bool default_val = false) const;
4414 IMGUI_API void SetBool(ImGuiID key, bool val);
4415 IMGUI_API float GetFloat(ImGuiID key, float default_val = 0.0f) const;
4416 IMGUI_API void SetFloat(ImGuiID key, float val);
4417 IMGUI_API void *GetVoidPtr(ImGuiID key) const; // default_val is NULL
4418 IMGUI_API void SetVoidPtr(ImGuiID key, void *val);
4419
4420 // - Get***Ref() functions finds pair, insert on demand if missing, return pointer. Useful if you intend to do
4421 // Get+Set.
4422 // - References are only valid until a new value is added to the storage. Calling a Set***() function or a
4423 // Get***Ref() function invalidates the pointer.
4424 // - A typical use case where this is convenient for quick hacking (e.g. add storage during a live Edit&Continue
4425 // session if you can't modify existing struct)
4426 // float* pvar = ImGui::GetFloatRef(key); ImGui::SliderFloat("var", pvar, 0, 100.0f); some_var += *pvar;
4427 IMGUI_API int *GetIntRef(ImGuiID key, int default_val = 0);
4428 IMGUI_API bool *GetBoolRef(ImGuiID key, bool default_val = false);
4429 IMGUI_API float *GetFloatRef(ImGuiID key, float default_val = 0.0f);
4430 IMGUI_API void **GetVoidPtrRef(ImGuiID key, void *default_val = NULL);
4431
4432 // Advanced: for quicker full rebuild of a storage (instead of an incremental one), you may add all your contents
4433 // and then sort once.
4434 IMGUI_API void BuildSortByKey();
4435 // Obsolete: use on your own storage if you know only integer are being stored (open/close all tree nodes)
4436 IMGUI_API void SetAllInt(int val);
4437
4438#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4439 // typedef ::ImGuiStoragePair ImGuiStoragePair; // 1.90.8: moved type outside struct
4440#endif
4441};
4442
4443// Helper: Manually clip large list of items.
4444// If you have lots evenly spaced items and you have random access to the list, you can perform coarse
4445// clipping based on visibility to only submit items that are in view.
4446// The clipper calculates the range of visible items and advance the cursor to compensate for the non-visible items we
4447// have skipped. (Dear ImGui already clip items based on their bounds but: it needs to first layout the item to do so,
4448// and generally
4449// fetching/submitting your own data incurs additional cost. Coarse clipping using ImGuiListClipper allows you to
4450// easily scale using lists with tens of thousands of items without a problem)
4451// Usage:
4452// ImGuiListClipper clipper;
4453// clipper.Begin(1000); // We have 1000 elements, evenly spaced.
4454// while (clipper.Step())
4455// for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
4456// ImGui::Text("line number %d", i);
4457// Generally what happens is:
4458// - Clipper lets you process the first element (DisplayStart = 0, DisplayEnd = 1) regardless of it being visible or
4459// not.
4460// - User code submit that one element.
4461// - Clipper can measure the height of the first element
4462// - Clipper calculate the actual range of elements to display based on the current clipping rectangle, position the
4463// cursor before the first visible element.
4464// - User code submit visible elements.
4465// - The clipper also handles various subtleties related to keyboard/gamepad navigation, wrapping etc.
4466struct ImGuiListClipper
4467{
4468 ImGuiContext *Ctx; // Parent UI context
4469 int DisplayStart; // First item to display, updated by each call to Step()
4470 int DisplayEnd; // End of items to display (exclusive)
4471 int ItemsCount; // [Internal] Number of items
4472 float ItemsHeight; // [Internal] Height of item after a first step and item submission can calculate it
4473 float StartPosY; // [Internal] Cursor position at the time of Begin() or after table frozen rows are all processed
4474 double StartSeekOffsetY; // [Internal] Account for frozen rows in a table and initial loss of precision in very
4475 // large windows.
4476 void *TempData; // [Internal] Internal data
4477
4478 // items_count: Use INT_MAX if you don't know how many items you have (in which case the cursor won't be advanced in
4479 // the final step, and you can call SeekCursorForItem() manually if you need) items_height: Use -1.0f to be
4480 // calculated automatically on first step. Otherwise pass in the distance between your items, typically
4481 // GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() or GetFrameHeightWithSpacing().
4482 IMGUI_API ImGuiListClipper();
4483 IMGUI_API ~ImGuiListClipper();
4484 IMGUI_API void Begin(int items_count, float items_height = -1.0f);
4485 IMGUI_API void End(); // Automatically called on the last call of Step() that returns false.
4486 IMGUI_API bool Step(); // Call until it returns false. The DisplayStart/DisplayEnd fields will be set and you can
4487 // process/draw those items.
4488
4489 // Call IncludeItemByIndex() or IncludeItemsByIndex() *BEFORE* first call to Step() if you need a range of items to
4490 // not be clipped, regardless of their visibility. (Due to alignment / padding of certain items it is possible that
4491 // an extra item may be included on either end of the display range).
4492 inline void IncludeItemByIndex(int item_index)
4493 {
4494 IncludeItemsByIndex(item_index, item_index + 1);
4495 }
4496 IMGUI_API void IncludeItemsByIndex(
4497 int item_begin, int item_end); // item_end is exclusive e.g. use (42, 42+1) to make item 42 never clipped.
4498
4499 // Seek cursor toward given item. This is automatically called while stepping.
4500 // - The only reason to call this is: you can use ImGuiListClipper::Begin(INT_MAX) if you don't know item count
4501 // ahead of time.
4502 // - In this case, after all steps are done, you'll want to call SeekCursorForItem(item_count).
4503 IMGUI_API void SeekCursorForItem(int item_index);
4504
4505#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4506 inline void IncludeRangeByIndices(int item_begin, int item_end)
4507 {
4508 IncludeItemsByIndex(item_begin, item_end);
4509 } // [renamed in 1.89.9]
4510 inline void ForceDisplayRangeByIndices(int item_begin, int item_end)
4511 {
4512 IncludeItemsByIndex(item_begin, item_end);
4513 } // [renamed in 1.89.6]
4514 // inline ImGuiListClipper(int items_count, float items_height = -1.0f) { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); ItemsCount
4515 // = -1; Begin(items_count, items_height); } // [removed in 1.79]
4516#endif
4517};
4518
4519// Helpers: ImVec2/ImVec4 operators
4520// - It is important that we are keeping those disabled by default so they don't leak in user space.
4521// - This is in order to allow user enabling implicit cast operators between ImVec2/ImVec4 and their own types (using
4522// IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h)
4523// - Add '#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS' before including this file (or in imconfig.h) to access courtesy maths
4524// operators for ImVec2 and ImVec4.
4525// - We intentionally provide ImVec2*float but not float*ImVec2: this is rare enough and we want to reduce the surface
4526// for possible user mistake.
4527#ifdef IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS
4528#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS_IMPLEMENTED
4529IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
4530// ImVec2 operators
4531static inline ImVec2 operator*(const ImVec2 &lhs, const float rhs)
4532{
4533 return ImVec2(lhs.x * rhs, lhs.y * rhs);
4534}
4535static inline ImVec2 operator/(const ImVec2 &lhs, const float rhs)
4536{
4537 return ImVec2(lhs.x / rhs, lhs.y / rhs);
4538}
4539static inline ImVec2 operator+(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4540{
4541 return ImVec2(lhs.x + rhs.x, lhs.y + rhs.y);
4542}
4543static inline ImVec2 operator-(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4544{
4545 return ImVec2(lhs.x - rhs.x, lhs.y - rhs.y);
4546}
4547static inline ImVec2 operator*(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4548{
4549 return ImVec2(lhs.x * rhs.x, lhs.y * rhs.y);
4550}
4551static inline ImVec2 operator/(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4552{
4553 return ImVec2(lhs.x / rhs.x, lhs.y / rhs.y);
4554}
4555static inline ImVec2 operator-(const ImVec2 &lhs)
4556{
4557 return ImVec2(-lhs.x, -lhs.y);
4558}
4559static inline ImVec2 &operator*=(ImVec2 &lhs, const float rhs)
4560{
4561 lhs.x *= rhs;
4562 lhs.y *= rhs;
4563 return lhs;
4564}
4565static inline ImVec2 &operator/=(ImVec2 &lhs, const float rhs)
4566{
4567 lhs.x /= rhs;
4568 lhs.y /= rhs;
4569 return lhs;
4570}
4571static inline ImVec2 &operator+=(ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4572{
4573 lhs.x += rhs.x;
4574 lhs.y += rhs.y;
4575 return lhs;
4576}
4577static inline ImVec2 &operator-=(ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4578{
4579 lhs.x -= rhs.x;
4580 lhs.y -= rhs.y;
4581 return lhs;
4582}
4583static inline ImVec2 &operator*=(ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4584{
4585 lhs.x *= rhs.x;
4586 lhs.y *= rhs.y;
4587 return lhs;
4588}
4589static inline ImVec2 &operator/=(ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4590{
4591 lhs.x /= rhs.x;
4592 lhs.y /= rhs.y;
4593 return lhs;
4594}
4595static inline bool operator==(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4596{
4597 return lhs.x == rhs.x && lhs.y == rhs.y;
4598}
4599static inline bool operator!=(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
4600{
4601 return lhs.x != rhs.x || lhs.y != rhs.y;
4602}
4603// ImVec4 operators
4604static inline ImVec4 operator*(const ImVec4 &lhs, const float rhs)
4605{
4606 return ImVec4(lhs.x * rhs, lhs.y * rhs, lhs.z * rhs, lhs.w * rhs);
4607}
4608static inline ImVec4 operator/(const ImVec4 &lhs, const float rhs)
4609{
4610 return ImVec4(lhs.x / rhs, lhs.y / rhs, lhs.z / rhs, lhs.w / rhs);
4611}
4612static inline ImVec4 operator+(const ImVec4 &lhs, const ImVec4 &rhs)
4613{
4614 return ImVec4(lhs.x + rhs.x, lhs.y + rhs.y, lhs.z + rhs.z, lhs.w + rhs.w);
4615}
4616static inline ImVec4 operator-(const ImVec4 &lhs, const ImVec4 &rhs)
4617{
4618 return ImVec4(lhs.x - rhs.x, lhs.y - rhs.y, lhs.z - rhs.z, lhs.w - rhs.w);
4619}
4620static inline ImVec4 operator*(const ImVec4 &lhs, const ImVec4 &rhs)
4621{
4622 return ImVec4(lhs.x * rhs.x, lhs.y * rhs.y, lhs.z * rhs.z, lhs.w * rhs.w);
4623}
4624static inline ImVec4 operator/(const ImVec4 &lhs, const ImVec4 &rhs)
4625{
4626 return ImVec4(lhs.x / rhs.x, lhs.y / rhs.y, lhs.z / rhs.z, lhs.w / rhs.w);
4627}
4628static inline ImVec4 operator-(const ImVec4 &lhs)
4629{
4630 return ImVec4(-lhs.x, -lhs.y, -lhs.z, -lhs.w);
4631}
4632static inline bool operator==(const ImVec4 &lhs, const ImVec4 &rhs)
4633{
4634 return lhs.x == rhs.x && lhs.y == rhs.y && lhs.z == rhs.z && lhs.w == rhs.w;
4635}
4636static inline bool operator!=(const ImVec4 &lhs, const ImVec4 &rhs)
4637{
4638 return lhs.x != rhs.x || lhs.y != rhs.y || lhs.z != rhs.z || lhs.w != rhs.w;
4639}
4640IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
4641#endif
4642
4643// Helpers macros to generate 32-bit encoded colors
4644// - User can declare their own format by #defining the 5 _SHIFT/_MASK macros in their imconfig file.
4645// - Any setting other than the default will need custom backend support. The only standard backend that supports
4646// anything else than the default is DirectX9.
4647#ifndef IM_COL32_R_SHIFT
4648#ifdef IMGUI_USE_BGRA_PACKED_COLOR
4649#define IM_COL32_R_SHIFT 16
4650#define IM_COL32_G_SHIFT 8
4651#define IM_COL32_B_SHIFT 0
4652#define IM_COL32_A_SHIFT 24
4653#define IM_COL32_A_MASK 0xFF000000
4654#else
4655#define IM_COL32_R_SHIFT 0
4656#define IM_COL32_G_SHIFT 8
4657#define IM_COL32_B_SHIFT 16
4658#define IM_COL32_A_SHIFT 24
4659#define IM_COL32_A_MASK 0xFF000000
4660#endif
4661#endif
4662#define IM_COL32(R, G, B, A) \
4663 (((ImU32)(A) << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT) | ((ImU32)(B) << IM_COL32_B_SHIFT) | ((ImU32)(G) << IM_COL32_G_SHIFT) | \
4664 ((ImU32)(R) << IM_COL32_R_SHIFT))
4665#define IM_COL32_WHITE IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255) // Opaque white = 0xFFFFFFFF
4666#define IM_COL32_BLACK IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255) // Opaque black
4667#define IM_COL32_BLACK_TRANS IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 0) // Transparent black = 0x00000000
4668
4669// Helper: ImColor() implicitly converts colors to either ImU32 (packed 4x1 byte) or ImVec4 (4x1 float)
4670// Prefer using IM_COL32() macros if you want a guaranteed compile-time ImU32 for usage with ImDrawList API.
4671// **Avoid storing ImColor! Store either u32 of ImVec4. This is not a full-featured color class. MAY OBSOLETE.
4672// **None of the ImGui API are using ImColor directly but you can use it as a convenience to pass colors in either ImU32
4673// or ImVec4 formats. Explicitly cast to ImU32 or ImVec4 if needed.
4674struct ImColor
4675{
4676 ImVec4 Value;
4677
4678 constexpr ImColor()
4679 {
4680 }
4681 constexpr ImColor(float r, float g, float b, float a = 1.0f) : Value(r, g, b, a)
4682 {
4683 }
4684 constexpr ImColor(const ImVec4 &col) : Value(col)
4685 {
4686 }
4687 constexpr ImColor(int r, int g, int b, int a = 255)
4688 : Value((float)r * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)g * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)b * (1.0f / 255.0f),
4689 (float)a * (1.0f / 255.0f))
4690 {
4691 }
4692 constexpr ImColor(ImU32 rgba)
4693 : Value((float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_R_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f),
4694 (float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_G_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f),
4695 (float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_B_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f),
4696 (float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_A_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f))
4697 {
4698 }
4699 inline operator ImU32() const
4700 {
4701 return ImGui::ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(Value);
4702 }
4703 inline operator ImVec4() const
4704 {
4705 return Value;
4706 }
4707
4708 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: May need to obsolete/cleanup those helpers.
4709 inline void SetHSV(float h, float s, float v, float a = 1.0f)
4710 {
4711 ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(h, s, v, Value.x, Value.y, Value.z);
4712 Value.w = a;
4713 }
4714 static ImColor HSV(float h, float s, float v, float a = 1.0f)
4715 {
4716 float r, g, b;
4717 ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(h, s, v, r, g, b);
4718 return ImColor(r, g, b, a);
4719 }
4720};
4721
4722//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4723// [SECTION] Multi-Select API flags and structures (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags, ImGuiSelectionRequestType,
4724// ImGuiSelectionRequest, ImGuiMultiSelectIO, ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage)
4725//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4726
4727// Multi-selection system
4728// Documentation at: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Multi-Select
4729// - Refer to 'Demo->Widgets->Selection State & Multi-Select' for demos using this.
4730// - This system implements standard multi-selection idioms (CTRL+Mouse/Keyboard, SHIFT+Mouse/Keyboard, etc)
4731// with support for clipper (skipping non-visible items), box-select and many other details.
4732// - Selectable(), Checkbox() are supported but custom widgets may use it as well.
4733// - TreeNode() is technically supported but... using this correctly is more complicated: you need some sort of
4734// linear/random access to your tree,
4735// which is suited to advanced trees setups also implementing filters and clipper. We will work toward simplifying and
4736// demoing it.
4737// - In the spirit of Dear ImGui design, your code owns actual selection data.
4738// This is designed to allow all kinds of selection storage you may use in your application e.g. set/map/hash.
4739// About ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage:
4740// - This is an optional helper to store a selection state and apply selection requests.
4741// - It is used by our demos and provided as a convenience to quickly implement multi-selection.
4742// Usage:
4743// - Identify submitted items with SetNextItemSelectionUserData(), most likely using an index into your current
4744// data-set.
4745// - Store and maintain actual selection data using persistent object identifiers.
4746// - Usage flow:
4747// BEGIN - (1) Call BeginMultiSelect() and retrieve the ImGuiMultiSelectIO* result.
4748// - (2) Honor request list (SetAll/SetRange requests) by updating your selection data. Same code as Step 6.
4749// - (3) [If using clipper] You need to make sure RangeSrcItem is always submitted. Calculate its index and
4750// pass to clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(). If storing indices in ImGuiSelectionUserData, a simple
4751// clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(ms_io->RangeSrcItem) call will work.
4752// LOOP - (4) Submit your items with SetNextItemSelectionUserData() + Selectable()/TreeNode() calls.
4753// END - (5) Call EndMultiSelect() and retrieve the ImGuiMultiSelectIO* result.
4754// - (6) Honor request list (SetAll/SetRange requests) by updating your selection data. Same code as Step 2.
4755// If you submit all items (no clipper), Step 2 and 3 are optional and will be handled by each item themselves. It
4756// is fine to always honor those steps.
4757// About ImGuiSelectionUserData:
4758// - This can store an application-defined identifier (e.g. index or pointer) submitted via
4759// SetNextItemSelectionUserData().
4760// - In return we store them into RangeSrcItem/RangeFirstItem/RangeLastItem and other fields in ImGuiMultiSelectIO.
4761// - Most applications will store an object INDEX, hence the chosen name and type. Storing an index is natural, because
4762// SetRange requests will give you two end-points and you will need to iterate/interpolate between them to update your
4763// selection.
4764// - However it is perfectly possible to store a POINTER or another IDENTIFIER inside ImGuiSelectionUserData.
4765// Our system never assume that you identify items by indices, it never attempts to interpolate between two values.
4766// - If you enable ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect then it is guaranteed that you will never have to interpolate
4767// between two ImGuiSelectionUserData, which may be a convenient way to use part of the feature with less code work.
4768// - As most users will want to store an index, for convenience and to reduce confusion we use ImS64 instead of void*,
4769// being syntactically easier to downcast. Feel free to reinterpret_cast and store a pointer inside.
4770
4771// Flags for BeginMultiSelect()
4772enum ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_
4773{
4774 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_None = 0,
4775 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect =
4776 1 << 0, // Disable selecting more than one item. This is available to allow single-selection code to share same
4777 // code/logic if desired. It essentially disables the main purpose of BeginMultiSelect() tho!
4778 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoSelectAll = 1 << 1, // Disable CTRL+A shortcut to select all.
4779 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect =
4780 1 << 2, // Disable Shift+selection mouse/keyboard support (useful for unordered 2D selection). With BoxSelect is
4781 // also ensure contiguous SetRange requests are not combined into one. This allows not handling
4782 // interpolation in SetRange requests.
4783 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect = 1 << 3, // Disable selecting items when navigating (useful for e.g. supporting
4784 // range-select in a list of checkboxes).
4785 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear =
4786 1 << 4, // Disable clearing selection when navigating or selecting another one (generally used with
4787 // ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect. useful for e.g. supporting range-select in a list of checkboxes).
4788 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClearOnReselect =
4789 1 << 5, // Disable clearing selection when clicking/selecting an already selected item.
4790 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d =
4791 1 << 6, // Enable box-selection with same width and same x pos items (e.g. full row Selectable()). Box-selection
4792 // works better with little bit of spacing between items hit-box in order to be able to aim at empty
4793 // space.
4794 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d =
4795 1 << 7, // Enable box-selection with varying width or varying x pos items support (e.g. different width labels,
4796 // or 2D layout/grid). This is slower: alters clipping logic so that e.g. horizontal movements will
4797 // update selection of normally clipped items.
4798 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelectNoScroll = 1 << 8, // Disable scrolling when box-selecting near edges of scope.
4799 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape = 1 << 9, // Clear selection when pressing Escape while scope is focused.
4800 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnClickVoid = 1 << 10, // Clear selection when clicking on empty location within scope.
4801 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow =
4802 1 << 11, // Scope for _BoxSelect and _ClearOnClickVoid is whole window (Default). Use if BeginMultiSelect()
4803 // covers a whole window or used a single time in same window.
4804 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect = 1 << 12, // Scope for _BoxSelect and _ClearOnClickVoid is rectangle encompassing
4805 // BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect(). Use if BeginMultiSelect() is
4806 // called multiple times in same window.
4807 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClick =
4808 1 << 13, // Apply selection on mouse down when clicking on unselected item. (Default)
4809 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease =
4810 1 << 14, // Apply selection on mouse release when clicking an unselected item. Allow dragging an unselected item
4811 // without altering selection.
4812 // ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_RangeSelect2d = 1 << 15, // Shift+Selection uses 2d geometry instead of linear
4813 // sequence, so possible to use Shift+up/down to select vertically in grid. Analogous to what BoxSelect does.
4814 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NavWrapX =
4815 1 << 16, // [Temporary] Enable navigation wrapping on X axis. Provided as a convenience because we don't have a
4816 // design for the general Nav API for this yet. When the more general feature be public we may obsolete
4817 // this flag in favor of new one.
4818};
4819
4820// Main IO structure returned by BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect().
4821// This mainly contains a list of selection requests.
4822// - Use 'Demo->Tools->Debug Log->Selection' to see requests as they happen.
4823// - Some fields are only useful if your list is dynamic and allows deletion (getting post-deletion focus/state right is
4824// shown in the demo)
4825// - Below: who reads/writes each fields? 'r'=read, 'w'=write, 'ms'=multi-select code, 'app'=application/user code.
4826struct ImGuiMultiSelectIO
4827{
4828 //------------------------------------------// BeginMultiSelect / EndMultiSelect
4829 ImVector<ImGuiSelectionRequest>
4830 Requests; // ms:w, app:r / ms:w app:r // Requests to apply to your selection data.
4831 ImGuiSelectionUserData RangeSrcItem; // ms:w app:r / // (If using clipper) Begin: Source item
4832 // (often the first selected item) must never be clipped: use
4833 // clipper.IncludeItemByIndex() to ensure it is submitted.
4834 ImGuiSelectionUserData NavIdItem; // ms:w, app:r / // (If using deletion) Last known
4835 // SetNextItemSelectionUserData() value for NavId (if part of submitted items).
4836 bool NavIdSelected; // ms:w, app:r / app:r // (If using deletion) Last known selection state for NavId
4837 // (if part of submitted items).
4838 bool RangeSrcReset; // app:w / ms:r // (If using deletion) Set before EndMultiSelect() to reset
4839 // ResetSrcItem (e.g. if deleted selection).
4840 int ItemsCount; // ms:w, app:r / app:r // 'int items_count' parameter to BeginMultiSelect() is copied
4841 // here for convenience, allowing simpler calls to your ApplyRequests handler. Not used internally.
4842};
4843
4844// Selection request type
4845enum ImGuiSelectionRequestType
4846{
4847 ImGuiSelectionRequestType_None = 0,
4848 ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll, // Request app to clear selection (if Selected==false) or select all items (if
4849 // Selected==true). We cannot set RangeFirstItem/RangeLastItem as its contents is
4850 // entirely up to user (not necessarily an index)
4851 ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange, // Request app to select/unselect [RangeFirstItem..RangeLastItem] items
4852 // (inclusive) based on value of Selected. Only EndMultiSelect() request this,
4853 // app code can read after BeginMultiSelect() and it will always be false.
4854};
4855
4856// Selection request item
4857struct ImGuiSelectionRequest
4858{
4859 //------------------------------------------// BeginMultiSelect / EndMultiSelect
4860 ImGuiSelectionRequestType Type; // ms:w, app:r / ms:w, app:r // Request type. You'll most often receive 1
4861 // Clear + 1 SetRange with a single-item range.
4862 bool Selected; // ms:w, app:r / ms:w, app:r // Parameter for SetAll/SetRange requests (true = select, false
4863 // = unselect)
4864 ImS8 RangeDirection; // / ms:w app:r // Parameter for SetRange request: +1 when RangeFirstItem
4865 // comes before RangeLastItem, -1 otherwise. Useful if you want to preserve
4866 // selection order on a backward Shift+Click.
4867 ImGuiSelectionUserData
4868 RangeFirstItem; // / ms:w, app:r // Parameter for SetRange request (this is generally ==
4869 // RangeSrcItem when shift selecting from top to bottom).
4870 ImGuiSelectionUserData
4871 RangeLastItem; // / ms:w, app:r // Parameter for SetRange request (this is generally ==
4872 // RangeSrcItem when shift selecting from bottom to top). Inclusive!
4873};
4874
4875// Optional helper to store multi-selection state + apply multi-selection requests.
4876// - Used by our demos and provided as a convenience to easily implement basic multi-selection.
4877// - Iterate selection with 'void* it = NULL; ImGuiID id; while (selection.GetNextSelectedItem(&it, &id)) { ... }'
4878// Or you can check 'if (Contains(id)) { ... }' for each possible object if their number is not too high to iterate.
4879// - USING THIS IS NOT MANDATORY. This is only a helper and not a required API.
4880// To store a multi-selection, in your application you could:
4881// - Use this helper as a convenience. We use our simple key->value ImGuiStorage as a std::set<ImGuiID> replacement.
4882// - Use your own external storage: e.g. std::set<MyObjectId>, std::vector<MyObjectId>, interval trees, intrusively
4883// stored selection etc. In ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage we:
4884// - always use indices in the multi-selection API (passed to SetNextItemSelectionUserData(), retrieved in
4885// ImGuiMultiSelectIO)
4886// - use the AdapterIndexToStorageId() indirection layer to abstract how persistent selection data is derived from an
4887// index.
4888// - use decently optimized logic to allow queries and insertion of very large selection sets.
4889// - do not preserve selection order.
4890// Many combinations are possible depending on how you prefer to store your items and how you prefer to store your
4891// selection. Large applications are likely to eventually want to get rid of this indirection layer and do their own
4892// thing. See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Multi-Select for details and pseudo-code using this helper.
4893struct ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage
4894{
4895 // Members
4896 int Size; // // Number of selected items, maintained by this helper.
4897 bool PreserveOrder; // = false // GetNextSelectedItem() will return ordered selection (currently implemented by two
4898 // additional sorts of selection. Could be improved)
4899 void *UserData; // = NULL // User data for use by adapter function // e.g. selection.UserData =
4900 // (void*)my_items;
4901 ImGuiID (*AdapterIndexToStorageId)(
4902 ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage *self,
4903 int idx); // e.g. selection.AdapterIndexToStorageId = [](ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* self, int idx) { return
4904 // ((MyItems**)self->UserData)[idx]->ID; };
4905 int _SelectionOrder; // [Internal] Increasing counter to store selection order
4906 ImGuiStorage _Storage; // [Internal] Selection set. Think of this as similar to e.g. std::set<ImGuiID>. Prefer not
4907 // accessing directly: iterate with GetNextSelectedItem().
4908
4909 // Methods
4910 IMGUI_API ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage();
4911 IMGUI_API void ApplyRequests(
4912 ImGuiMultiSelectIO *ms_io); // Apply selection requests coming from BeginMultiSelect() and EndMultiSelect()
4913 // functions. It uses 'items_count' passed to BeginMultiSelect()
4914 IMGUI_API bool Contains(ImGuiID id) const; // Query if an item id is in selection.
4915 IMGUI_API void Clear(); // Clear selection
4916 IMGUI_API void Swap(ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage &r); // Swap two selections
4917 IMGUI_API void SetItemSelected(
4918 ImGuiID id, bool selected); // Add/remove an item from selection (generally done by ApplyRequests() function)
4919 IMGUI_API bool GetNextSelectedItem(void **opaque_it,
4920 ImGuiID *out_id); // Iterate selection with 'void* it = NULL; ImGuiID id; while
4921 // (selection.GetNextSelectedItem(&it, &id)) { ... }'
4922 inline ImGuiID GetStorageIdFromIndex(int idx)
4923 {
4924 return AdapterIndexToStorageId(this, idx);
4925 } // Convert index to item id based on provided adapter.
4926};
4927
4928// Optional helper to apply multi-selection requests to existing randomly accessible storage.
4929// Convenient if you want to quickly wire multi-select API on e.g. an array of bool or items storing their own selection
4930// state.
4931struct ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage
4932{
4933 // Members
4934 void *UserData; // User data for use by adapter function // e.g. selection.UserData =
4935 // (void*)my_items;
4936 void (*AdapterSetItemSelected)(
4937 ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage *self, int idx,
4938 bool selected); // e.g. AdapterSetItemSelected = [](ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage* self, int idx, bool selected)
4939 // { ((MyItems**)self->UserData)[idx]->Selected = selected; }
4940
4941 // Methods
4942 IMGUI_API ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage();
4943 IMGUI_API void ApplyRequests(
4944 ImGuiMultiSelectIO *ms_io); // Apply selection requests by using AdapterSetItemSelected() calls
4945};
4946
4947//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4948// [SECTION] Drawing API (ImDrawCmd, ImDrawIdx, ImDrawVert, ImDrawChannel, ImDrawListSplitter, ImDrawListFlags,
4949// ImDrawList, ImDrawData) Hold a series of drawing commands. The user provides a renderer for ImDrawData which
4950// essentially contains an array of ImDrawList.
4951//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4952
4953// The maximum line width to bake anti-aliased textures for. Build atlas with ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines to disable
4954// baking.
4955#ifndef IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX
4956#define IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX (32)
4957#endif
4958
4959// ImDrawIdx: vertex index. [Compile-time configurable type]
4960// - To use 16-bit indices + allow large meshes: backend need to set 'io.BackendFlags |=
4961// ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' and handle ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset (recommended).
4962// - To use 32-bit indices: override with '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' in your imconfig.h file.
4963#ifndef ImDrawIdx
4964typedef unsigned short ImDrawIdx; // Default: 16-bit (for maximum compatibility with renderer backends)
4965#endif
4966
4967// ImDrawCallback: Draw callbacks for advanced uses [configurable type: override in imconfig.h]
4968// NB: You most likely do NOT need to use draw callbacks just to create your own widget or customized UI rendering,
4969// you can poke into the draw list for that! Draw callback may be useful for example to:
4970// A) Change your GPU render state,
4971// B) render a complex 3D scene inside a UI element without an intermediate texture/render target, etc.
4972// The expected behavior from your rendering function is 'if (cmd.UserCallback != NULL) { cmd.UserCallback(parent_list,
4973// cmd); } else { RenderTriangles() }' If you want to override the signature of ImDrawCallback, you can simply use e.g.
4974// '#define ImDrawCallback MyDrawCallback' (in imconfig.h) + update rendering backend accordingly.
4975#ifndef ImDrawCallback
4976typedef void (*ImDrawCallback)(const ImDrawList *parent_list, const ImDrawCmd *cmd);
4977#endif
4978
4979// Special Draw callback value to request renderer backend to reset the graphics/render state.
4980// The renderer backend needs to handle this special value, otherwise it will crash trying to call a function at this
4981// address. This is useful, for example, if you submitted callbacks which you know have altered the render state and you
4982// want it to be restored. Render state is not reset by default because they are many perfectly useful way of altering
4983// render state (e.g. changing shader/blending settings before an Image call).
4984#define ImDrawCallback_ResetRenderState (ImDrawCallback)(-8)
4985
4986// Typically, 1 command = 1 GPU draw call (unless command is a callback)
4987// - VtxOffset: When 'io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' is enabled,
4988// this fields allow us to render meshes larger than 64K vertices while keeping 16-bit indices.
4989// Backends made for <1.71. will typically ignore the VtxOffset fields.
4990// - The ClipRect/TextureId/VtxOffset fields must be contiguous as we memcmp() them together (this is asserted for).
4991struct ImDrawCmd
4992{
4993 ImVec4 ClipRect; // 4*4 // Clipping rectangle (x1, y1, x2, y2). Subtract ImDrawData->DisplayPos to get clipping
4994 // rectangle in "viewport" coordinates
4995 ImTextureID TextureId; // 4-8 // User-provided texture ID. Set by user in ImfontAtlas::SetTexID() for fonts or
4996 // passed to Image*() functions. Ignore if never using images or multiple fonts atlas.
4997 unsigned int VtxOffset; // 4 // Start offset in vertex buffer. ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset: always 0,
4998 // otherwise may be >0 to support meshes larger than 64K vertices with 16-bit indices.
4999 unsigned int IdxOffset; // 4 // Start offset in index buffer.
5000 unsigned int ElemCount; // 4 // Number of indices (multiple of 3) to be rendered as triangles. Vertices are
5001 // stored in the callee ImDrawList's vtx_buffer[] array, indices in idx_buffer[].
5002 ImDrawCallback UserCallback; // 4-8 // If != NULL, call the function instead of rendering the vertices. clip_rect
5003 // and texture_id will be set normally.
5004 void *UserCallbackData; // 4-8 // Callback user data (when UserCallback != NULL). If called AddCallback() with size
5005 // == 0, this is a copy of the AddCallback() argument. If called AddCallback() with size >
5006 // 0, this is pointing to a buffer where data is stored.
5007 int UserCallbackDataSize; // 4 // Size of callback user data when using storage, otherwise 0.
5008 int UserCallbackDataOffset; // 4 // [Internal] Offset of callback user data when using storage, otherwise -1.
5009
5010 ImDrawCmd()
5011 {
5012 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
5013 } // Also ensure our padding fields are zeroed
5014
5015 // Since 1.83: returns ImTextureID associated with this draw call. Warning: DO NOT assume this is always same as
5016 // 'TextureId' (we will change this function for an upcoming feature)
5017 inline ImTextureID GetTexID() const
5018 {
5019 return TextureId;
5020 }
5021};
5022
5023// Vertex layout
5024#ifndef IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT
5025struct ImDrawVert
5026{
5027 ImVec2 pos;
5028 ImVec2 uv;
5029 ImU32 col;
5030};
5031#else
5032// You can override the vertex format layout by defining IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT in imconfig.h
5033// The code expect ImVec2 pos (8 bytes), ImVec2 uv (8 bytes), ImU32 col (4 bytes), but you can re-order them or add
5034// other fields as needed to simplify integration in your engine. The type has to be described within the macro (you can
5035// either declare the struct or use a typedef). This is because ImVec2/ImU32 are likely not declared at the time you'd
5036// want to set your type up. NOTE: IMGUI DOESN'T CLEAR THE STRUCTURE AND DOESN'T CALL A CONSTRUCTOR SO ANY CUSTOM FIELD
5037// WILL BE UNINITIALIZED. IF YOU ADD EXTRA FIELDS (SUCH AS A 'Z' COORDINATES) YOU WILL NEED TO CLEAR THEM DURING RENDER
5038// OR TO IGNORE THEM.
5039IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT;
5040#endif
5041
5042// [Internal] For use by ImDrawList
5043struct ImDrawCmdHeader
5044{
5045 ImVec4 ClipRect;
5046 ImTextureID TextureId;
5047 unsigned int VtxOffset;
5048};
5049
5050// [Internal] For use by ImDrawListSplitter
5051struct ImDrawChannel
5052{
5053 ImVector<ImDrawCmd> _CmdBuffer;
5054 ImVector<ImDrawIdx> _IdxBuffer;
5055};
5056
5057// Split/Merge functions are used to split the draw list into different layers which can be drawn into out of order.
5058// This is used by the Columns/Tables API, so items of each column can be batched together in a same draw call.
5059struct ImDrawListSplitter
5060{
5061 int _Current; // Current channel number (0)
5062 int _Count; // Number of active channels (1+)
5063 ImVector<ImDrawChannel> _Channels; // Draw channels (not resized down so _Count might be < Channels.Size)
5064
5065 inline ImDrawListSplitter()
5066 {
5067 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
5068 }
5069 inline ~ImDrawListSplitter()
5070 {
5071 ClearFreeMemory();
5072 }
5073 inline void Clear()
5074 {
5075 _Current = 0;
5076 _Count = 1;
5077 } // Do not clear Channels[] so our allocations are reused next frame
5078 IMGUI_API void ClearFreeMemory();
5079 IMGUI_API void Split(ImDrawList *draw_list, int count);
5080 IMGUI_API void Merge(ImDrawList *draw_list);
5081 IMGUI_API void SetCurrentChannel(ImDrawList *draw_list, int channel_idx);
5082};
5083
5084// Flags for ImDrawList functions
5085// (Legacy: bit 0 must always correspond to ImDrawFlags_Closed to be backward compatible with old API using a bool.
5086// Bits 1..3 must be unused)
5087enum ImDrawFlags_
5088{
5089 ImDrawFlags_None = 0,
5090 ImDrawFlags_Closed = 1 << 0, // PathStroke(), AddPolyline(): specify that shape should be closed (Important: this is
5091 // always == 1 for legacy reason)
5092 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft = 1 << 4, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-left corner
5093 // only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x01.
5094 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight =
5095 1 << 5, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f,
5096 // we default to all corners). Was 0x02.
5097 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft =
5098 1 << 6, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-left corner only (when rounding >
5099 // 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x04.
5100 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight =
5101 1 << 7, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-right corner only (when rounding >
5102 // 0.0f, we default to all corners). Wax 0x08.
5103 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone = 1 << 8, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): disable rounding on all corners
5104 // (when rounding > 0.0f). This is NOT zero, NOT an implicit flag!
5105 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight,
5106 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottom = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight,
5107 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft,
5108 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight,
5109 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight |
5110 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight,
5111 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersDefault_ =
5112 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll, // Default to ALL corners if none of the _RoundCornersXX flags are specified.
5113 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersMask_ = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone,
5114};
5115
5116// Flags for ImDrawList instance. Those are set automatically by ImGui:: functions from ImGuiIO settings, and generally
5117// not manipulated directly. It is however possible to temporarily alter flags between calls to ImDrawList:: functions.
5118enum ImDrawListFlags_
5119{
5120 ImDrawListFlags_None = 0,
5121 ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines =
5122 1 << 0, // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders (*2 the number of triangles for 1.0f wide line or lines thin enough
5123 // to be drawn using textures, otherwise *3 the number of triangles)
5124 ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex =
5125 1 << 1, // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures when possible. Require backend to render with
5126 // bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering).
5127 ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill =
5128 1 << 2, // Enable anti-aliased edge around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles).
5129 ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset = 1 << 3, // Can emit 'VtxOffset > 0' to allow large meshes. Set when
5130 // 'ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' is enabled.
5131};
5132
5133// Draw command list
5134// This is the low-level list of polygons that ImGui:: functions are filling. At the end of the frame,
5135// all command lists are passed to your ImGuiIO::RenderDrawListFn function for rendering.
5136// Each dear imgui window contains its own ImDrawList. You can use ImGui::GetWindowDrawList() to
5137// access the current window draw list and draw custom primitives.
5138// You can interleave normal ImGui:: calls and adding primitives to the current draw list.
5139// In single viewport mode, top-left is == GetMainViewport()->Pos (generally 0,0), bottom-right is ==
5140// GetMainViewport()->Pos+Size (generally io.DisplaySize). You are totally free to apply whatever transformation matrix
5141// you want to the data (depending on the use of the transformation you may want to apply it to ClipRect as well!)
5142// Important: Primitives are always added to the list and not culled (culling is done at higher-level by ImGui::
5143// functions), if you use this API a lot consider coarse culling your drawn objects.
5144struct ImDrawList
5145{
5146 // This is what you have to render
5147 ImVector<ImDrawCmd>
5148 CmdBuffer; // Draw commands. Typically 1 command = 1 GPU draw call, unless the command is a callback.
5149 ImVector<ImDrawIdx> IdxBuffer; // Index buffer. Each command consume ImDrawCmd::ElemCount of those
5150 ImVector<ImDrawVert> VtxBuffer; // Vertex buffer.
5151 ImDrawListFlags Flags; // Flags, you may poke into these to adjust anti-aliasing settings per-primitive.
5152
5153 // [Internal, used while building lists]
5154 unsigned int _VtxCurrentIdx; // [Internal] generally == VtxBuffer.Size unless we are past 64K vertices, in which
5155 // case this gets reset to 0.
5156 ImDrawListSharedData *_Data; // Pointer to shared draw data (you can use ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData() to get the
5157 // one from current ImGui context)
5158 ImDrawVert *_VtxWritePtr; // [Internal] point within VtxBuffer.Data after each add command (to avoid using the
5159 // ImVector<> operators too much)
5160 ImDrawIdx *_IdxWritePtr; // [Internal] point within IdxBuffer.Data after each add command (to avoid using the
5161 // ImVector<> operators too much)
5162 ImVector<ImVec2> _Path; // [Internal] current path building
5163 ImDrawCmdHeader
5164 _CmdHeader; // [Internal] template of active commands. Fields should match those of CmdBuffer.back().
5165 ImDrawListSplitter _Splitter; // [Internal] for channels api (note: prefer using your own persistent instance of
5166 // ImDrawListSplitter!)
5167 ImVector<ImVec4> _ClipRectStack; // [Internal]
5168 ImVector<ImTextureID> _TextureIdStack; // [Internal]
5169 ImVector<ImU8> _CallbacksDataBuf; // [Internal]
5170 float _FringeScale; // [Internal] anti-alias fringe is scaled by this value, this helps to keep things sharp while
5171 // zooming at vertex buffer content
5172 const char *_OwnerName; // Pointer to owner window's name for debugging
5173
5174 // If you want to create ImDrawList instances, pass them ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData().
5175 // (advanced: you may create and use your own ImDrawListSharedData so you can use ImDrawList without ImGui, but
5176 // that's more involved)
5177 IMGUI_API ImDrawList(ImDrawListSharedData *shared_data);
5178 IMGUI_API ~ImDrawList();
5179
5180 IMGUI_API void PushClipRect(const ImVec2 &clip_rect_min, const ImVec2 &clip_rect_max,
5181 bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect =
5182 false); // Render-level scissoring. This is passed down to your render function but
5183 // not used for CPU-side coarse clipping. Prefer using higher-level
5184 // ImGui::PushClipRect() to affect logic (hit-testing and widget culling)
5185 IMGUI_API void PushClipRectFullScreen();
5186 IMGUI_API void PopClipRect();
5187 IMGUI_API void PushTextureID(ImTextureID texture_id);
5188 IMGUI_API void PopTextureID();
5189 inline ImVec2 GetClipRectMin() const
5190 {
5191 const ImVec4 &cr = _ClipRectStack.back();
5192 return ImVec2(cr.x, cr.y);
5193 }
5194 inline ImVec2 GetClipRectMax() const
5195 {
5196 const ImVec4 &cr = _ClipRectStack.back();
5197 return ImVec2(cr.z, cr.w);
5198 }
5199
5200 // Primitives
5201 // - Filled shapes must always use clockwise winding order. The anti-aliasing fringe depends on it.
5202 // Counter-clockwise shapes will have "inward" anti-aliasing.
5203 // - For rectangular primitives, "p_min" and "p_max" represent the upper-left and lower-right corners.
5204 // - For circle primitives, use "num_segments == 0" to automatically calculate tessellation (preferred).
5205 // In older versions (until Dear ImGui 1.77) the AddCircle functions defaulted to num_segments == 12.
5206 // In future versions we will use textures to provide cheaper and higher-quality circles.
5207 // Use AddNgon() and AddNgonFilled() functions if you need to guarantee a specific number of sides.
5208 IMGUI_API void AddLine(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
5209 IMGUI_API void AddRect(const ImVec2 &p_min, const ImVec2 &p_max, ImU32 col, float rounding = 0.0f,
5210 ImDrawFlags flags = 0,
5211 float thickness = 1.0f); // a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)
5212 IMGUI_API void AddRectFilled(const ImVec2 &p_min, const ImVec2 &p_max, ImU32 col, float rounding = 0.0f,
5213 ImDrawFlags flags = 0); // a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)
5214 IMGUI_API void AddRectFilledMultiColor(const ImVec2 &p_min, const ImVec2 &p_max, ImU32 col_upr_left,
5215 ImU32 col_upr_right, ImU32 col_bot_right, ImU32 col_bot_left);
5216 IMGUI_API void AddQuad(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4, ImU32 col,
5217 float thickness = 1.0f);
5218 IMGUI_API void AddQuadFilled(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4, ImU32 col);
5219 IMGUI_API void AddTriangle(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
5220 IMGUI_API void AddTriangleFilled(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, ImU32 col);
5221 IMGUI_API void AddCircle(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments = 0,
5222 float thickness = 1.0f);
5223 IMGUI_API void AddCircleFilled(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments = 0);
5224 IMGUI_API void AddNgon(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments, float thickness = 1.0f);
5225 IMGUI_API void AddNgonFilled(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments);
5226 IMGUI_API void AddEllipse(const ImVec2 &center, const ImVec2 &radius, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f,
5227 int num_segments = 0, float thickness = 1.0f);
5228 IMGUI_API void AddEllipseFilled(const ImVec2 &center, const ImVec2 &radius, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f,
5229 int num_segments = 0);
5230 IMGUI_API void AddText(const ImVec2 &pos, ImU32 col, const char *text_begin, const char *text_end = NULL);
