5231 IMGUI_API void AddText(ImFont *font, float font_size, const ImVec2 &pos, ImU32 col, const char *text_begin,
5232 const char *text_end = NULL, float wrap_width = 0.0f,
5233 const ImVec4 *cpu_fine_clip_rect = NULL);
5234 IMGUI_API void AddBezierCubic(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4, ImU32 col,
5235 float thickness, int num_segments = 0); // Cubic Bezier (4 control points)
5236 IMGUI_API void AddBezierQuadratic(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, ImU32 col, float thickness,
5237 int num_segments = 0); // Quadratic Bezier (3 control points)
5238
5239 // General polygon
5240 // - Only simple polygons are supported by filling functions (no self-intersections, no holes).
5241 // - Concave polygon fill is more expensive than convex one: it has O(N^2) complexity. Provided as a convenience for
5242 // the user but not used by the main library.
5243 IMGUI_API void AddPolyline(const ImVec2 *points, int num_points, ImU32 col, ImDrawFlags flags, float thickness);
5244 IMGUI_API void AddConvexPolyFilled(const ImVec2 *points, int num_points, ImU32 col);
5245 IMGUI_API void AddConcavePolyFilled(const ImVec2 *points, int num_points, ImU32 col);
5246
5247 // Image primitives
5248 // - Read FAQ to understand what ImTextureID is.
5249 // - "p_min" and "p_max" represent the upper-left and lower-right corners of the rectangle.
5250 // - "uv_min" and "uv_max" represent the normalized texture coordinates to use for those corners. Using (0,0)->(1,1)
5251 // texture coordinates will generally display the entire texture.
5252 IMGUI_API void AddImage(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &p_min, const ImVec2 &p_max,
5253 const ImVec2 &uv_min = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2 &uv_max = ImVec2(1, 1),
5254 ImU32 col = IM_COL32_WHITE);
5255 IMGUI_API void AddImageQuad(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3,
5256 const ImVec2 &p4, const ImVec2 &uv1 = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2 &uv2 = ImVec2(1, 0),
5257 const ImVec2 &uv3 = ImVec2(1, 1), const ImVec2 &uv4 = ImVec2(0, 1),
5258 ImU32 col = IM_COL32_WHITE);
5259 IMGUI_API void AddImageRounded(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2 &p_min, const ImVec2 &p_max,
5260 const ImVec2 &uv_min, const ImVec2 &uv_max, ImU32 col, float rounding,
5261 ImDrawFlags flags = 0);
5262
5263 // Stateful path API, add points then finish with PathFillConvex() or PathStroke()
5264 // - Important: filled shapes must always use clockwise winding order! The anti-aliasing fringe depends on it.
5265 // Counter-clockwise shapes will have "inward" anti-aliasing.
5266 // so e.g. 'PathArcTo(center, radius, PI * -0.5f, PI)' is ok, whereas 'PathArcTo(center, radius, PI, PI * -0.5f)'
5267 // won't have correct anti-aliasing when followed by PathFillConvex().
5268 inline void PathClear()
5269 {
5270 _Path.Size = 0;
5271 }
5272 inline void PathLineTo(const ImVec2 &pos)
5273 {
5274 _Path.push_back(pos);
5275 }
5276 inline void PathLineToMergeDuplicate(const ImVec2 &pos)
5277 {
5278 if (_Path.Size == 0 || memcmp(&_Path.Data[_Path.Size - 1], &pos, 8) != 0)
5279 _Path.push_back(pos);
5280 }
5281 inline void PathFillConvex(ImU32 col)
5282 {
5283 AddConvexPolyFilled(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col);
5284 _Path.Size = 0;
5285 }
5286 inline void PathFillConcave(ImU32 col)
5287 {
5288 AddConcavePolyFilled(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col);
5289 _Path.Size = 0;
5290 }
5291 inline void PathStroke(ImU32 col, ImDrawFlags flags = 0, float thickness = 1.0f)
5292 {
5293 AddPolyline(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col, flags, thickness);
5294 _Path.Size = 0;
5295 }
5296 IMGUI_API void PathArcTo(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments = 0);
5297 IMGUI_API void PathArcToFast(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, int a_min_of_12,
5298 int a_max_of_12); // Use precomputed angles for a 12 steps circle
5299 IMGUI_API void PathEllipticalArcTo(const ImVec2 &center, const ImVec2 &radius, float rot, float a_min, float a_max,
5300 int num_segments = 0); // Ellipse
5301 IMGUI_API void PathBezierCubicCurveTo(const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4,
5302 int num_segments = 0); // Cubic Bezier (4 control points)
5303 IMGUI_API void PathBezierQuadraticCurveTo(const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3,
5304 int num_segments = 0); // Quadratic Bezier (3 control points)
5305 IMGUI_API void PathRect(const ImVec2 &rect_min, const ImVec2 &rect_max, float rounding = 0.0f,
5306 ImDrawFlags flags = 0);
5307
5308 // Advanced: Draw Callbacks
5309 // - May be used to alter render state (change sampler, blending, current shader). May be used to emit custom
5310 // rendering commands (difficult to do correctly, but possible).
5311 // - Use special ImDrawCallback_ResetRenderState callback to instruct backend to reset its render state to the
5312 // default.
5313 // - Your rendering loop must check for 'UserCallback' in ImDrawCmd and call the function instead of rendering
5314 // triangles. All standard backends are honoring this.
5315 // - For some backends, the callback may access selected render-states exposed by the backend in a
5316 // ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderState structure pointed to by platform_io.Renderer_RenderState.
5317 // - IMPORTANT: please be mindful of the different level of indirection between using size==0 (copying argument) and
5318 // using size>0 (copying pointed data into a buffer).
5319 // - If userdata_size == 0: we copy/store the 'userdata' argument as-is. It will be available unmodified in
5320 // ImDrawCmd::UserCallbackData during render.
5321 // - If userdata_size > 0, we copy/store 'userdata_size' bytes pointed to by 'userdata'. We store them in a
5322 // buffer stored inside the drawlist. ImDrawCmd::UserCallbackData will point inside that buffer so you have to
5323 // retrieve data from there. Your callback may need to use ImDrawCmd::UserCallbackDataSize if you expect
5324 // dynamically-sized data.
5325 // - Support for userdata_size > 0 was added in v1.91.4, October 2024. So earlier code always only allowed to
5326 // copy/store a simple void*.
5327 IMGUI_API void AddCallback(ImDrawCallback callback, void *userdata, size_t userdata_size = 0);
5328
5329 // Advanced: Miscellaneous
5330 IMGUI_API void AddDrawCmd(); // This is useful if you need to forcefully create a new draw call (to allow for
5331 // dependent rendering / blending). Otherwise primitives are merged into the same
5332 // draw-call as much as possible
5333 IMGUI_API ImDrawList *CloneOutput() const; // Create a clone of the CmdBuffer/IdxBuffer/VtxBuffer.
5334
5335 // Advanced: Channels
5336 // - Use to split render into layers. By switching channels to can render out-of-order (e.g. submit FG primitives
5337 // before BG primitives)
5338 // - Use to minimize draw calls (e.g. if going back-and-forth between multiple clipping rectangles, prefer to append
5339 // into separate channels then merge at the end)
5340 // - This API shouldn't have been in ImDrawList in the first place!
5341 // Prefer using your own persistent instance of ImDrawListSplitter as you can stack them.
5342 // Using the ImDrawList::ChannelsXXXX you cannot stack a split over another.
5343 inline void ChannelsSplit(int count)
5344 {
5345 _Splitter.Split(this, count);
5346 }
5347 inline void ChannelsMerge()
5348 {
5349 _Splitter.Merge(this);
5350 }
5351 inline void ChannelsSetCurrent(int n)
5352 {
5353 _Splitter.SetCurrentChannel(this, n);
5354 }
5355
5356 // Advanced: Primitives allocations
5357 // - We render triangles (three vertices)
5358 // - All primitives needs to be reserved via PrimReserve() beforehand.
5359 IMGUI_API void PrimReserve(int idx_count, int vtx_count);
5360 IMGUI_API void PrimUnreserve(int idx_count, int vtx_count);
5361 IMGUI_API void PrimRect(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b,
5362 ImU32 col); // Axis aligned rectangle (composed of two triangles)
5363 IMGUI_API void PrimRectUV(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &uv_a, const ImVec2 &uv_b, ImU32 col);
5364 IMGUI_API void PrimQuadUV(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &c, const ImVec2 &d, const ImVec2 &uv_a,
5365 const ImVec2 &uv_b, const ImVec2 &uv_c, const ImVec2 &uv_d, ImU32 col);
5366 inline void PrimWriteVtx(const ImVec2 &pos, const ImVec2 &uv, ImU32 col)
5367 {
5368 _VtxWritePtr->pos = pos;
5369 _VtxWritePtr->uv = uv;
5370 _VtxWritePtr->col = col;
5371 _VtxWritePtr++;
5372 _VtxCurrentIdx++;
5373 }
5374 inline void PrimWriteIdx(ImDrawIdx idx)
5375 {
5376 *_IdxWritePtr = idx;
5377 _IdxWritePtr++;
5378 }
5379 inline void PrimVtx(const ImVec2 &pos, const ImVec2 &uv, ImU32 col)
5380 {
5381 PrimWriteIdx((ImDrawIdx)_VtxCurrentIdx);
5382 PrimWriteVtx(pos, uv, col);
5383 } // Write vertex with unique index
5384
5385 // Obsolete names
5386 // inline void AddEllipse(const ImVec2& center, float radius_x, float radius_y, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f, int
5387 // num_segments = 0, float thickness = 1.0f) { AddEllipse(center, ImVec2(radius_x, radius_y), col, rot,
5388 // num_segments, thickness); } // OBSOLETED in 1.90.5 (Mar 2024) inline void AddEllipseFilled(const ImVec2&
5389 // center, float radius_x, float radius_y, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f, int num_segments = 0) {
5390 // AddEllipseFilled(center, ImVec2(radius_x, radius_y), col, rot, num_segments); } //
5391 // OBSOLETED in 1.90.5 (Mar 2024) inline void PathEllipticalArcTo(const ImVec2& center, float radius_x, float
5392 // radius_y, float rot, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments = 0) { PathEllipticalArcTo(center,
5393 // ImVec2(radius_x, radius_y), rot, a_min, a_max, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.90.5 (Mar 2024) inline void
5394 // AddBezierCurve(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float
5395 // thickness, int num_segments = 0) { AddBezierCubic(p1, p2, p3, p4, col, thickness, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED
5396 // in 1.80 (Jan 2021) inline void PathBezierCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, int
5397 // num_segments = 0) { PathBezierCubicCurveTo(p2, p3, p4, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.80 (Jan 2021)
5398
5399 // [Internal helpers]
5400 IMGUI_API void _ResetForNewFrame();
5401 IMGUI_API void _ClearFreeMemory();
5402 IMGUI_API void _PopUnusedDrawCmd();
5403 IMGUI_API void _TryMergeDrawCmds();
5404 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedClipRect();
5405 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedTextureID();
5406 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedVtxOffset();
5407 IMGUI_API void _SetTextureID(ImTextureID texture_id);
5408 IMGUI_API int _CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(float radius) const;
5409 IMGUI_API void _PathArcToFastEx(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, int a_min_sample, int a_max_sample, int a_step);
5410 IMGUI_API void _PathArcToN(const ImVec2 &center, float radius, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments);
5411};
5412
5413// All draw data to render a Dear ImGui frame
5414// (NB: the style and the naming convention here is a little inconsistent, we currently preserve them for backward
5415// compatibility purpose, as this is one of the oldest structure exposed by the library! Basically, ImDrawList ==
5416// CmdList)
5417struct ImDrawData
5418{
5419 bool Valid; // Only valid after Render() is called and before the next NewFrame() is called.
5420 int CmdListsCount; // Number of ImDrawList* to render
5421 int TotalIdxCount; // For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's IdxBuffer.Size
5422 int TotalVtxCount; // For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's VtxBuffer.Size
5423 ImVector<ImDrawList *> CmdLists; // Array of ImDrawList* to render. The ImDrawLists are owned by ImGuiContext and
5424 // only pointed to from here.
5425 ImVec2 DisplayPos; // Top-left position of the viewport to render (== top-left of the orthogonal projection matrix
5426 // to use) (== GetMainViewport()->Pos for the main viewport, == (0.0) in most single-viewport
5427 // applications)
5428 ImVec2 DisplaySize; // Size of the viewport to render (== GetMainViewport()->Size for the main viewport, ==
5429 // io.DisplaySize in most single-viewport applications)
5430 ImVec2 FramebufferScale; // Amount of pixels for each unit of DisplaySize. Based on io.DisplayFramebufferScale.
5431 // Generally (1,1) on normal display, (2,2) on OSX with Retina display.
5432 ImGuiViewport
5433 *OwnerViewport; // Viewport carrying the ImDrawData instance, might be of use to the renderer (generally not).
5434
5435 // Functions
5436 ImDrawData()
5437 {
5438 Clear();
5439 }
5440 IMGUI_API void Clear();
5441 IMGUI_API void AddDrawList(
5442 ImDrawList *draw_list); // Helper to add an external draw list into an existing ImDrawData.
5443 IMGUI_API void DeIndexAllBuffers(); // Helper to convert all buffers from indexed to non-indexed, in case you cannot
5444 // render indexed. Note: this is slow and most likely a waste of resources.
5445 // Always prefer indexed rendering!
5446 IMGUI_API void ScaleClipRects(
5447 const ImVec2 &fb_scale); // Helper to scale the ClipRect field of each ImDrawCmd. Use if your final output
5448 // buffer is at a different scale than Dear ImGui expects, or if there is a difference
5449 // between your window resolution and framebuffer resolution.
5450};
5451
5452//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5453// [SECTION] Font API (ImFontConfig, ImFontGlyph, ImFontAtlasFlags, ImFontAtlas, ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder, ImFont)
5454//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5455
5456// A font input/source (we may rename this to ImFontSource in the future)
5457struct ImFontConfig
5458{
5459 void *FontData; // // TTF/OTF data
5460 int FontDataSize; // // TTF/OTF data size
5461 bool FontDataOwnedByAtlas; // true // TTF/OTF data ownership taken by the container ImFontAtlas (will delete
5462 // memory itself).
5463 bool MergeMode; // false // Merge into previous ImFont, so you can combine multiple inputs font into one ImFont
5464 // (e.g. ASCII font + icons + Japanese glyphs). You may want to use GlyphOffset.y when merge font of
5465 // different heights.
5466 bool PixelSnapH; // false // Align every glyph AdvanceX to pixel boundaries. Useful e.g. if you are merging a
5467 // non-pixel aligned font with the default font. If enabled, you can set OversampleH/V to 1.
5468 int FontNo; // 0 // Index of font within TTF/OTF file
5469 int OversampleH; // 0 (2) // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. 0 == auto == 1 or 2 depending
5470 // on size. Note the difference between 2 and 3 is minimal. You can reduce this to 1 for large
5471 // glyphs save memory. Read https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/tests/oversample/README.md
5472 // for details.
5473 int OversampleV; // 0 (1) // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. 0 == auto == 1. This is not
5474 // really useful as we don't use sub-pixel positions on the Y axis.
5475 float SizePixels; // // Size in pixels for rasterizer (more or less maps to the resulting font height).
5476 // ImVec2 GlyphExtraSpacing; // 0, 0 // (REMOVED IN 1.91.9: use GlyphExtraAdvanceX)
5477 ImVec2 GlyphOffset; // 0, 0 // Offset all glyphs from this font input.
5478 const ImWchar *GlyphRanges; // NULL // THE ARRAY DATA NEEDS TO PERSIST AS LONG AS THE FONT IS ALIVE. Pointer to
5479 // a user-provided list of Unicode range (2 value per range, values are inclusive,
5480 // zero-terminated list).
5481 float GlyphMinAdvanceX; // 0 // Minimum AdvanceX for glyphs, set Min to align font icons, set both Min/Max to
5482 // enforce mono-space font
5483 float GlyphMaxAdvanceX; // FLT_MAX // Maximum AdvanceX for glyphs
5484 float GlyphExtraAdvanceX; // 0 // Extra spacing (in pixels) between glyphs. Please contact us if you are
5485 // using this.
5486 unsigned int FontBuilderFlags; // 0 // Settings for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILDER IMPLEMENTATION
5487 // DEPENDENT. Leave as zero if unsure.
5488 float RasterizerMultiply; // 1.0f // Linearly brighten (>1.0f) or darken (<1.0f) font output. Brightening small
5489 // fonts may be a good workaround to make them more readable. This is a silly thing we may
5490 // remove in the future.
5491 float RasterizerDensity; // 1.0f // DPI scale for rasterization, not altering other font metrics: make it easy
5492 // to swap between e.g. a 100% and a 400% fonts for a zooming display, or handle Retina
5493 // screen. IMPORTANT: If you change this it is expected that you increase/decrease font
5494 // scale roughly to the inverse of this, otherwise quality may look lowered.
5495 ImWchar EllipsisChar; // 0 // Explicitly specify Unicode codepoint of ellipsis character. When fonts are
5496 // being merged first specified ellipsis will be used.
5497
5498 // [Internal]
5499 char Name[40]; // Name (strictly to ease debugging)
5500 ImFont *DstFont;
5501
5502 IMGUI_API ImFontConfig();
5503};
5504
5505// Hold rendering data for one glyph.
5506// (Note: some language parsers may fail to convert the 31+1 bitfield members, in this case maybe drop store a single
5507// u32 or we can rework this)
5508struct ImFontGlyph
5509{
5510 unsigned int Colored : 1; // Flag to indicate glyph is colored and should generally ignore tinting (make it usable
5511 // with no shift on little-endian as this is used in loops)
5512 unsigned int Visible
5513 : 1; // Flag to indicate glyph has no visible pixels (e.g. space). Allow early out when rendering.
5514 unsigned int Codepoint : 30; // 0x0000..0x10FFFF
5515 float AdvanceX; // Horizontal distance to advance layout with
5516 float X0, Y0, X1, Y1; // Glyph corners
5517 float U0, V0, U1, V1; // Texture coordinates
5518};
5519
5520// Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data. Feed your application strings/characters to it then call
5521// BuildRanges(). This is essentially a tightly packed of vector of 64k booleans = 8KB storage.
5522struct ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder
5523{
5524 ImVector<ImU32> UsedChars; // Store 1-bit per Unicode code point (0=unused, 1=used)
5525
5526 ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder()
5527 {
5528 Clear();
5529 }
5530 inline void Clear()
5531 {
5532 int size_in_bytes = (IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX + 1) / 8;
5533 UsedChars.resize(size_in_bytes / (int)sizeof(ImU32));
5534 memset(UsedChars.Data, 0, (size_t)size_in_bytes);
5535 }
5536 inline bool GetBit(size_t n) const
5537 {
5538 int off = (int)(n >> 5);
5539 ImU32 mask = 1u << (n & 31);
5540 return (UsedChars[off] & mask) != 0;
5541 } // Get bit n in the array
5542 inline void SetBit(size_t n)
5543 {
5544 int off = (int)(n >> 5);
5545 ImU32 mask = 1u << (n & 31);
5546 UsedChars[off] |= mask;
5547 } // Set bit n in the array
5548 inline void AddChar(ImWchar c)
5549 {
5550 SetBit(c);
5551 } // Add character
5552 IMGUI_API void AddText(const char *text,
5553 const char *text_end = NULL); // Add string (each character of the UTF-8 string are added)
5554 IMGUI_API void AddRanges(
5555 const ImWchar *ranges); // Add ranges, e.g. builder.AddRanges(ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesDefault()) to force add
5556 // all of ASCII/Latin+Ext
5557 IMGUI_API void BuildRanges(ImVector<ImWchar> *out_ranges); // Output new ranges
5558};
5559
5560// See ImFontAtlas::AddCustomRectXXX functions.
5561struct ImFontAtlasCustomRect
5562{
5563 unsigned short X, Y; // Output // Packed position in Atlas
5564
5565 // [Internal]
5566 unsigned short Width, Height; // Input // Desired rectangle dimension
5567 unsigned int GlyphID : 31; // Input // For custom font glyphs only (ID < 0x110000)
5568 unsigned int GlyphColored : 1; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph is colored, removed tinting.
5569 float GlyphAdvanceX; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph xadvance
5570 ImVec2 GlyphOffset; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph display offset
5571 ImFont *Font; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: target font
5572 ImFontAtlasCustomRect()
5573 {
5574 X = Y = 0xFFFF;
5575 Width = Height = 0;
5576 GlyphID = 0;
5577 GlyphColored = 0;
5578 GlyphAdvanceX = 0.0f;
5579 GlyphOffset = ImVec2(0, 0);
5580 Font = NULL;
5581 }
5582 bool IsPacked() const
5583 {
5584 return X != 0xFFFF;
5585 }
5586};
5587
5588// Flags for ImFontAtlas build
5589enum ImFontAtlasFlags_
5590{
5591 ImFontAtlasFlags_None = 0,
5592 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight = 1 << 0, // Don't round the height to next power of two
5593 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors =
5594 1 << 1, // Don't build software mouse cursors into the atlas (save a little texture memory)
5595 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines =
5596 1 << 2, // Don't build thick line textures into the atlas (save a little texture memory, allow support for
5597 // point/nearest filtering). The AntiAliasedLinesUseTex features uses them, otherwise they will be
5598 // rendered using polygons (more expensive for CPU/GPU).
5599};
5600
5601// Load and rasterize multiple TTF/OTF fonts into a same texture. The font atlas will build a single texture holding:
5602// - One or more fonts.
5603// - Custom graphics data needed to render the shapes needed by Dear ImGui.
5604// - Mouse cursor shapes for software cursor rendering (unless setting 'Flags |= ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors' in
5605// the font atlas).
5606// It is the user-code responsibility to setup/build the atlas, then upload the pixel data into a texture accessible by
5607// your graphics api.
5608// - Optionally, call any of the AddFont*** functions. If you don't call any, the default font embedded in the code
5609// will be loaded for you.
5610// - Call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32() to build and retrieve pixels data.
5611// - Upload the pixels data into a texture within your graphics system (see imgui_impl_xxxx.cpp examples)
5612// - Call SetTexID(my_tex_id); and pass the pointer/identifier to your texture in a format natural to your graphics
5613// API.
5614// This value will be passed back to you during rendering to identify the texture. Read FAQ entry about ImTextureID
5615// for more details.
5616// Common pitfalls:
5617// - If you pass a 'glyph_ranges' array to AddFont*** functions, you need to make sure that your array persist up until
5618// the
5619// atlas is build (when calling GetTexData*** or Build()). We only copy the pointer, not the data.
5620// - Important: By default, AddFontFromMemoryTTF() takes ownership of the data. Even though we are not writing to it, we
5621// will free the pointer on destruction.
5622// You can set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed,
5623// - Even though many functions are suffixed with "TTF", OTF data is supported just as well.
5624// - This is an old API and it is currently awkward for those and various other reasons! We will address them in the
5625// future!
5626struct ImFontAtlas
5627{
5628 IMGUI_API ImFontAtlas();
5629 IMGUI_API ~ImFontAtlas();
5630 IMGUI_API ImFont *AddFont(const ImFontConfig *font_cfg);
5631 IMGUI_API ImFont *AddFontDefault(const ImFontConfig *font_cfg = NULL);
5632 IMGUI_API ImFont *AddFontFromFileTTF(const char *filename, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig *font_cfg = NULL,
5633 const ImWchar *glyph_ranges = NULL);
5634 IMGUI_API ImFont *AddFontFromMemoryTTF(
5635 void *font_data, int font_data_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig *font_cfg = NULL,
5636 const ImWchar *glyph_ranges = NULL); // Note: Transfer ownership of 'ttf_data' to ImFontAtlas! Will be deleted
5637 // after destruction of the atlas. Set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false
5638 // to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed.
5639 IMGUI_API ImFont *AddFontFromMemoryCompressedTTF(
5640 const void *compressed_font_data, int compressed_font_data_size, float size_pixels,
5641 const ImFontConfig *font_cfg = NULL,
5642 const ImWchar *glyph_ranges =
5643 NULL); // 'compressed_font_data' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp.
5644 IMGUI_API ImFont *AddFontFromMemoryCompressedBase85TTF(
5645 const char *compressed_font_data_base85, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig *font_cfg = NULL,
5646 const ImWchar *glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data_base85' still owned by caller. Compress with
5647 // binary_to_compressed_c.cpp with -base85 parameter.
5648 IMGUI_API void ClearInputData(); // Clear input data (all ImFontConfig structures including sizes, TTF data, glyph
5649 // ranges, etc.) = all the data used to build the texture and fonts.
5650 IMGUI_API void ClearFonts(); // Clear input+output font data (same as ClearInputData() + glyphs storage, UV
5651 // coordinates).
5652 IMGUI_API void ClearTexData(); // Clear output texture data (CPU side). Saves RAM once the texture has been copied
5653 // to graphics memory.
5654 IMGUI_API void Clear(); // Clear all input and output.
5655
5656 // Build atlas, retrieve pixel data.
5657 // User is in charge of copying the pixels into graphics memory (e.g. create a texture with your engine). Then store
5658 // your texture handle with SetTexID(). The pitch is always = Width * BytesPerPixels (1 or 4) Building in RGBA32
5659 // format is provided for convenience and compatibility, but note that unless you manually manipulate or copy color
5660 // data into the texture (e.g. when using the AddCustomRect*** api), then the RGB pixels emitted will always be
5661 // white (~75% of memory/bandwidth waste.
5662 IMGUI_API bool Build(); // Build pixels data. This is called automatically for you by the GetTexData*** functions.
5663 IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsAlpha8(unsigned char **out_pixels, int *out_width, int *out_height,
5664 int *out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 1 byte per-pixel
5665 IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsRGBA32(unsigned char **out_pixels, int *out_width, int *out_height,
5666 int *out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 4 bytes-per-pixel
5667 bool IsBuilt() const
5668 {
5669 return Fonts.Size > 0 && TexReady;
5670 } // Bit ambiguous: used to detect when user didn't build texture but effectively we should check TexID != 0 except
5671 // that would be backend dependent...
5672 void SetTexID(ImTextureID id)
5673 {
5674 TexID = id;
5675 }
5676
5677 //-------------------------------------------
5678 // Glyph Ranges
5679 //-------------------------------------------
5680
5681 // Helpers to retrieve list of common Unicode ranges (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list)
5682 // NB: Make sure that your string are UTF-8 and NOT in your local code page.
5683 // Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FONTS.md/#about-utf-8-encoding for details.
5684 // NB: Consider using ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder to build glyph ranges from textual data.
5685 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesDefault(); // Basic Latin, Extended Latin
5686 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesGreek(); // Default + Greek and Coptic
5687 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesKorean(); // Default + Korean characters
5688 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesJapanese(); // Default + Hiragana, Katakana, Half-Width, Selection of 2999
5689 // Ideographs
5690 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesChineseFull(); // Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + full
5691 // set of about 21000 CJK Unified Ideographs
5692 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesChineseSimplifiedCommon(); // Default + Half-Width + Japanese
5693 // Hiragana/Katakana + set of 2500 CJK Unified
5694 // Ideographs for common simplified Chinese
5695 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesCyrillic(); // Default + about 400 Cyrillic characters
5696 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesThai(); // Default + Thai characters
5697 IMGUI_API const ImWchar *GetGlyphRangesVietnamese(); // Default + Vietnamese characters
5698
5699 //-------------------------------------------
5700 // [ALPHA] Custom Rectangles/Glyphs API
5701 //-------------------------------------------
5702
5703 // You can request arbitrary rectangles to be packed into the atlas, for your own purposes.
5704 // - After calling Build(), you can query the rectangle position and render your pixels.
5705 // - If you render colored output, set 'atlas->TexPixelsUseColors = true' as this may help some backends decide of
5706 // preferred texture format.
5707 // - You can also request your rectangles to be mapped as font glyph (given a font + Unicode point),
5708 // so you can render e.g. custom colorful icons and use them as regular glyphs.
5709 // - Read docs/FONTS.md for more details about using colorful icons.
5710 // - Note: this API may be redesigned later in order to support multi-monitor varying DPI settings.
5711 IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectRegular(int width, int height);
5712 IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectFontGlyph(ImFont *font, ImWchar id, int width, int height, float advance_x,
5713 const ImVec2 &offset = ImVec2(0, 0));
5714 ImFontAtlasCustomRect *GetCustomRectByIndex(int index)
5715 {
5716 IM_ASSERT(index >= 0);
5717 return &CustomRects[index];
5718 }
5719
5720 // [Internal]
5721 IMGUI_API void CalcCustomRectUV(const ImFontAtlasCustomRect *rect, ImVec2 *out_uv_min, ImVec2 *out_uv_max) const;
5722
5723 //-------------------------------------------
5724 // Members
5725 //-------------------------------------------
5726
5727 // Input
5728 ImFontAtlasFlags Flags; // Build flags (see ImFontAtlasFlags_)
5729 ImTextureID TexID; // User data to refer to the texture once it has been uploaded to user's graphic systems. It is
5730 // passed back to you during rendering via the ImDrawCmd structure.
5731 int TexDesiredWidth; // Texture width desired by user before Build(). Must be a power-of-two. If have many glyphs
5732 // your graphics API have texture size restrictions you may want to increase texture width to
5733 // decrease height.
5734 int TexGlyphPadding; // FIXME: Should be called "TexPackPadding". Padding between glyphs within texture in pixels.
5735 // Defaults to 1. If your rendering method doesn't rely on bilinear filtering you may set this
5736 // to 0 (will also need to set AntiAliasedLinesUseTex = false).
5737 void *UserData; // Store your own atlas related user-data (if e.g. you have multiple font atlas).
5738
5739 // [Internal]
5740 // NB: Access texture data via GetTexData*() calls! Which will setup a default font for you.
5741 bool Locked; // Marked as Locked by ImGui::NewFrame() so attempt to modify the atlas will assert.
5742 bool TexReady; // Set when texture was built matching current font input
5743 bool TexPixelsUseColors; // Tell whether our texture data is known to use colors (rather than just alpha channel),
5744 // in order to help backend select a format.
5745 unsigned char
5746 *TexPixelsAlpha8; // 1 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight
5747 unsigned int *TexPixelsRGBA32; // 4 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth *
5748 // TexHeight * 4
5749 int TexWidth; // Texture width calculated during Build().
5750 int TexHeight; // Texture height calculated during Build().
5751 ImVec2 TexUvScale; // = (1.0f/TexWidth, 1.0f/TexHeight)
5752 ImVec2 TexUvWhitePixel; // Texture coordinates to a white pixel
5753 ImVector<ImFont *> Fonts; // Hold all the fonts returned by AddFont*. Fonts[0] is the default font upon calling
5754 // ImGui::NewFrame(), use ImGui::PushFont()/PopFont() to change the current font.
5755 ImVector<ImFontAtlasCustomRect> CustomRects; // Rectangles for packing custom texture data into the atlas.
5756 ImVector<ImFontConfig> Sources; // Source/configuration data
5757 ImVec4 TexUvLines[IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX + 1]; // UVs for baked anti-aliased lines
5758
5759 // [Internal] Font builder
5760 const ImFontBuilderIO *FontBuilderIO; // Opaque interface to a font builder (default to stb_truetype, can be changed
5761 // to use FreeType by defining IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE).
5762 unsigned int FontBuilderFlags; // Shared flags (for all fonts) for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILD IMPLEMENTATION
5763 // DEPENDENT. Per-font override is also available in ImFontConfig.
5764
5765 // [Internal] Packing data
5766 int PackIdMouseCursors; // Custom texture rectangle ID for white pixel and mouse cursors
5767 int PackIdLines; // Custom texture rectangle ID for baked anti-aliased lines
5768
5769 // [Obsolete]
5770 // typedef ImFontAtlasCustomRect CustomRect; // OBSOLETED in 1.72+
5771 // typedef ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder GlyphRangesBuilder; // OBSOLETED in 1.67+
5772};
5773
5774// Font runtime data and rendering
5775// ImFontAtlas automatically loads a default embedded font for you when you call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or
5776// GetTexDataAsRGBA32().
5777struct ImFont
5778{
5779 // [Internal] Members: Hot ~20/24 bytes (for CalcTextSize)
5780 ImVector<float>
5781 IndexAdvanceX; // 12-16 // out // Sparse. Glyphs->AdvanceX in a directly indexable way (cache-friendly for
5782 // CalcTextSize functions which only this info, and are often bottleneck in large UI).
5783 float FallbackAdvanceX; // 4 // out // = FallbackGlyph->AdvanceX
5784 float FontSize; // 4 // in // Height of characters/line, set during loading (don't change after loading)
5785
5786 // [Internal] Members: Hot ~28/40 bytes (for RenderText loop)
5787 ImVector<ImU16> IndexLookup; // 12-16 // out // Sparse. Index glyphs by Unicode code-point.
5788 ImVector<ImFontGlyph> Glyphs; // 12-16 // out // All glyphs.
5789 ImFontGlyph *FallbackGlyph; // 4-8 // out // = FindGlyph(FontFallbackChar)
5790
5791 // [Internal] Members: Cold ~32/40 bytes
5792 // Conceptually Sources[] is the list of font sources merged to create this font.
5793 ImFontAtlas *ContainerAtlas; // 4-8 // out // What we has been loaded into
5794 ImFontConfig *Sources; // 4-8 // in // Pointer within ContainerAtlas->Sources[], to SourcesCount instances
5795 short SourcesCount; // 2 // in // Number of ImFontConfig involved in creating this font. Usually 1, or >1 when
5796 // merging multiple font sources into one ImFont.
5797 short EllipsisCharCount; // 1 // out // 1 or 3
5798 ImWchar EllipsisChar; // 2-4 // out // Character used for ellipsis rendering ('...').
5799 ImWchar FallbackChar; // 2-4 // out // Character used if a glyph isn't found (U+FFFD, '?')
5800 float EllipsisWidth; // 4 // out // Total ellipsis Width
5801 float EllipsisCharStep; // 4 // out // Step between characters when EllipsisCount > 0
5802 float Scale; // 4 // in // Base font scale (1.0f), multiplied by the per-window font scale which you can adjust
5803 // with SetWindowFontScale()
5804 float Ascent, Descent; // 4+4 // out // Ascent: distance from top to bottom of e.g. 'A' [0..FontSize] (unscaled)
5805 int MetricsTotalSurface; // 4 // out // Total surface in pixels to get an idea of the font rasterization/texture
5806 // cost (not exact, we approximate the cost of padding between glyphs)
5807 bool DirtyLookupTables; // 1 // out //
5808 ImU8 Used8kPagesMap[(IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX + 1) / 8192 /
5809 8]; // 1 bytes if ImWchar=ImWchar16, 16 bytes if ImWchar==ImWchar32. Store 1-bit for each block
5810 // of 4K codepoints that has one active glyph. This is mainly used to facilitate iterations
5811 // across all used codepoints.
5812
5813 // Methods
5814 IMGUI_API ImFont();
5815 IMGUI_API ~ImFont();
5816 IMGUI_API ImFontGlyph *FindGlyph(ImWchar c);
5817 IMGUI_API ImFontGlyph *FindGlyphNoFallback(ImWchar c);
5818 float GetCharAdvance(ImWchar c)
5819 {
5820 return ((int)c < IndexAdvanceX.Size) ? IndexAdvanceX[(int)c] : FallbackAdvanceX;
5821 }
5822 bool IsLoaded() const
5823 {
5824 return ContainerAtlas != NULL;
5825 }
5826 const char *GetDebugName() const
5827 {
5828 return Sources ? Sources->Name : "<unknown>";
5829 }
5830
5831 // [Internal] Don't use!
5832 // 'max_width' stops rendering after a certain width (could be turned into a 2d size). FLT_MAX to disable.
5833 // 'wrap_width' enable automatic word-wrapping across multiple lines to fit into given width. 0.0f to disable.
5834 IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSizeA(float size, float max_width, float wrap_width, const char *text_begin,
5835 const char *text_end = NULL, const char **remaining = NULL); // utf8
5836 IMGUI_API const char *CalcWordWrapPositionA(float scale, const char *text, const char *text_end, float wrap_width);
5837 IMGUI_API void RenderChar(ImDrawList *draw_list, float size, const ImVec2 &pos, ImU32 col, ImWchar c);
5838 IMGUI_API void RenderText(ImDrawList *draw_list, float size, const ImVec2 &pos, ImU32 col, const ImVec4 &clip_rect,
5839 const char *text_begin, const char *text_end, float wrap_width = 0.0f,
5840 bool cpu_fine_clip = false);
5841
5842 // [Internal] Don't use!
5843 IMGUI_API void BuildLookupTable();
5844 IMGUI_API void ClearOutputData();
5845 IMGUI_API void GrowIndex(int new_size);
5846 IMGUI_API void AddGlyph(const ImFontConfig *src_cfg, ImWchar c, float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float u0,
5847 float v0, float u1, float v1, float advance_x);
5848 IMGUI_API void AddRemapChar(
5849 ImWchar dst, ImWchar src,
5850 bool overwrite_dst = true); // Makes 'dst' character/glyph points to 'src' character/glyph. Currently needs to
5851 // be called AFTER fonts have been built.
5852 IMGUI_API bool IsGlyphRangeUnused(unsigned int c_begin, unsigned int c_last);
5853};
5854
5855//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5856// [SECTION] Viewports
5857//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5858
5859// Flags stored in ImGuiViewport::Flags, giving indications to the platform backends.
5860enum ImGuiViewportFlags_
5861{
5862 ImGuiViewportFlags_None = 0,
5863 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow = 1 << 0, // Represent a Platform Window
5864 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformMonitor = 1 << 1, // Represent a Platform Monitor (unused yet)
5865 ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp =
5866 1 << 2, // Platform Window: Is created/managed by the user application? (rather than our backend)
5867 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration =
5868 1 << 3, // Platform Window: Disable platform decorations: title bar, borders, etc. (generally set all windows,
5869 // but if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsDecoration is set we only set this on popups/tooltips)
5870 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon =
5871 1 << 4, // Platform Window: Disable platform task bar icon (generally set on popups/tooltips, or all windows if
5872 // ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsNoTaskBarIcon is set)
5873 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1 << 5, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when created.
5874 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnClick = 1 << 6, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when clicked on.
5875 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs =
5876 1 << 7, // Platform Window: Make mouse pass through so we can drag this window while peaking behind it.
5877 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear = 1 << 8, // Platform Window: Renderer doesn't need to clear the framebuffer
5878 // ahead (because we will fill it entirely).
5879 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge =
5880 1 << 9, // Platform Window: Avoid merging this window into another host window. This can only be set via
5881 // ImGuiWindowClass viewport flags override (because we need to now ahead if we are going to create a
5882 // viewport in the first place!).
5883 ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost = 1 << 10, // Platform Window: Display on top (for tooltips only).
5884 ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows =
5885 1 << 11, // Viewport can host multiple imgui windows (secondary viewports are associated to a single window). //
5886 // FIXME: In practice there's still probably code making the assumption that this is always and only on
5887 // the MainViewport. Will fix once we add support for "no main viewport".
5888
5889 // Output status flags (from Platform)
5890 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsMinimized =
5891 1 << 12, // Platform Window: Window is minimized, can skip render. When minimized we tend to avoid using the
5892 // viewport pos/size for clipping window or testing if they are contained in the viewport.
5893 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsFocused =
5894 1 << 13, // Platform Window: Window is focused (last call to Platform_GetWindowFocus() returned true)
5895};
5896
5897// - Currently represents the Platform Window created by the application which is hosting our Dear ImGui windows.
5898// - With multi-viewport enabled, we extend this concept to have multiple active viewports.
5899// - In the future we will extend this concept further to also represent Platform Monitor and support a "no main
5900// platform window" operation mode.
5901// - About Main Area vs Work Area:
5902// - Main Area = entire viewport.
5903// - Work Area = entire viewport minus sections used by main menu bars (for platform windows), or by task bar (for
5904// platform monitor).
5905// - Windows are generally trying to stay within the Work Area of their host viewport.
5906struct ImGuiViewport
5907{
5908 ImGuiID ID; // Unique identifier for the viewport
5909 ImGuiViewportFlags Flags; // See ImGuiViewportFlags_
5910 ImVec2 Pos; // Main Area: Position of the viewport (Dear ImGui coordinates are the same as OS desktop/native
5911 // coordinates)
5912 ImVec2 Size; // Main Area: Size of the viewport.
5913 ImVec2 WorkPos; // Work Area: Position of the viewport minus task bars, menus bars, status bars (>= Pos)
5914 ImVec2 WorkSize; // Work Area: Size of the viewport minus task bars, menu bars, status bars (<= Size)
5915 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI = No extra scale.
5916 ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // (Advanced) 0: no parent. Instruct the platform backend to setup a parent/child
5917 // relationship between platform windows.
5918 ImDrawData *DrawData; // The ImDrawData corresponding to this viewport. Valid after Render() and until the next call
5919 // to NewFrame().
5920
5921 // Platform/Backend Dependent Data
5922 // Our design separate the Renderer and Platform backends to facilitate combining default backends with each others.
5923 // When our create your own backend for a custom engine, it is possible that both Renderer and Platform will be
5924 // handled by the same system and you may not need to use all the UserData/Handle fields. The library never uses
5925 // those fields, they are merely storage to facilitate backend implementation.
5926 void *RendererUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the renderer (e.g. swap chain, framebuffers
5927 // etc.). generally set by your Renderer_CreateWindow function.
5928 void *PlatformUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the OS / platform (e.g. windowing info, render
5929 // context). generally set by your Platform_CreateWindow function.
5930 void *PlatformHandle; // void* to hold higher-level, platform window handle (e.g. HWND for Win32 backend, Uint32
5931 // WindowID for SDL, GLFWWindow* for GLFW), for FindViewportByPlatformHandle().
5932 void *PlatformHandleRaw; // void* to hold lower-level, platform-native window handle (always HWND on Win32 platform,
5933 // unused for other platforms).
5934 bool PlatformWindowCreated; // Platform window has been created (Platform_CreateWindow() has been called). This is
5935 // false during the first frame where a viewport is being created.
5936 bool PlatformRequestMove; // Platform window requested move (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager,
5937 // authoritative position will be OS window position)
5938 bool PlatformRequestResize; // Platform window requested resize (e.g. window was resized by the OS / host window
5939 // manager, authoritative size will be OS window size)
5940 bool PlatformRequestClose; // Platform window requested closure (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window
5941 // manager, e.g. pressing ALT-F4)
5942
5943 ImGuiViewport()
5944 {
5945 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
5946 }
5947 ~ImGuiViewport()
5948 {
5949 IM_ASSERT(PlatformUserData == NULL && RendererUserData == NULL);
5950 }
5951
5952 // Helpers
5953 ImVec2 GetCenter() const
5954 {
5955 return ImVec2(Pos.x + Size.x * 0.5f, Pos.y + Size.y * 0.5f);
5956 }
5957 ImVec2 GetWorkCenter() const
5958 {
5959 return ImVec2(WorkPos.x + WorkSize.x * 0.5f, WorkPos.y + WorkSize.y * 0.5f);
5960 }
5961};
5962
5963//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5964// [SECTION] ImGuiPlatformIO + other Platform Dependent Interfaces (ImGuiPlatformMonitor, ImGuiPlatformImeData)
5965//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5966
5967// [BETA] (Optional) Multi-Viewport Support!
5968// If you are new to Dear ImGui and trying to integrate it into your engine, you can probably ignore this for now.
5969//
5970// This feature allows you to seamlessly drag Dear ImGui windows outside of your application viewport.
5971// This is achieved by creating new Platform/OS windows on the fly, and rendering into them.
5972// Dear ImGui manages the viewport structures, and the backend create and maintain one Platform/OS window for each of
5973// those viewports.
5974//
5975// See Recap: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Multi-Viewports
5976// See Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary for details about some of the terminology.
5977//
5978// About the coordinates system:
5979// - When multi-viewports are enabled, all Dear ImGui coordinates become absolute coordinates (same as OS coordinates!)
5980// - So e.g. ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(0,0)) will position a window relative to your primary monitor!
5981// - If you want to position windows relative to your main application viewport, use ImGui::GetMainViewport()->Pos as a
5982// base position.
5983//
5984// Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a default backend from the examples/ folder:
5985// - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
5986// - Backend: The backend initialization will setup all necessary ImGuiPlatformIO's functions and update monitors
5987// info every frame.
5988// - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after
5989// EndFrame() or Render().
5990// - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls.
5991//
5992// Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a custom backend:
5993// - Important: THIS IS NOT EASY TO DO and comes with many subtleties not described here!
5994// It's also an experimental feature, so some of the requirements may evolve.
5995// Consider using default backends if you can. Either way, carefully follow and refer to examples/
5996// backends for details.
5997// - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
5998// - Backend: Hook ImGuiPlatformIO's Platform_* and Renderer_* callbacks (see below).
5999// Set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports' and 'io.BackendFlags |=
6000// ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports'. Update ImGuiPlatformIO's Monitors list every frame. Update
6001// MousePos every frame, in absolute coordinates.
6002// - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after
6003// EndFrame() or Render().
6004// You may skip calling RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() if its API is not convenient for your needs. Read
6005// comments below.
6006// - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls.
6007//
6008// About ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault():
6009// - This function is a mostly a _helper_ for the common-most cases, and to facilitate using default backends.
6010// - You can check its simple source code to understand what it does.
6011// It basically iterates secondary viewports and call 4 functions that are setup in ImGuiPlatformIO, if available:
6012// Platform_RenderWindow(), Renderer_RenderWindow(), Platform_SwapBuffers(), Renderer_SwapBuffers()
6013// Those functions pointers exists only for the benefit of RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
6014// - If you have very specific rendering needs (e.g. flipping multiple swap-chain simultaneously, unusual sync/threading
6015// issues, etc.),
6016// you may be tempted to ignore RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() and write customized code to perform your renderingg.
6017// You may decide to setup the platform_io's *RenderWindow and *SwapBuffers pointers and call your functions through
6018// those pointers, or you may decide to never setup those pointers and call your code directly. They are a
6019// convenience, not an obligatory interface.
6020//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6021
6022// Access via ImGui::GetPlatformIO()
6023struct ImGuiPlatformIO
6024{
6025 IMGUI_API ImGuiPlatformIO();
6026
6027 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6028 // Input - Interface with OS and Platform backend (most common stuff)
6029 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6030
6031 // Optional: Access OS clipboard
6032 // (default to use native Win32 clipboard on Windows, otherwise uses a private clipboard. Override to access OS
6033 // clipboard on other architectures)
6034 const char *(*Platform_GetClipboardTextFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx);
6035 void (*Platform_SetClipboardTextFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, const char *text);
6036 void *Platform_ClipboardUserData;
6037
6038 // Optional: Open link/folder/file in OS Shell
6039 // (default to use ShellExecuteW() on Windows, system() on Linux/Mac)
6040 bool (*Platform_OpenInShellFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, const char *path);
6041 void *Platform_OpenInShellUserData;
6042
6043 // Optional: Notify OS Input Method Editor of the screen position of your cursor for text input position (e.g. when
6044 // using Japanese/Chinese IME on Windows) (default to use native imm32 api on Windows)
6045 void (*Platform_SetImeDataFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiViewport *viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData *data);
6046 void *Platform_ImeUserData;
6047 // void (*SetPlatformImeDataFn)(ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData* data); // [Renamed to
6048 // platform_io.PlatformSetImeDataFn in 1.91.1]
6049
6050 // Optional: Platform locale
6051 // [Experimental] Configure decimal point e.g. '.' or ',' useful for some languages (e.g. German), generally pulled
6052 // from *localeconv()->decimal_point
6053 ImWchar Platform_LocaleDecimalPoint; // '.'
6054
6055 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6056 // Input - Interface with Renderer Backend
6057 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6058
6059 // Written by some backends during ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderDrawData() call to point backend_specific
6060 // ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderState* structure.
6061 void *Renderer_RenderState;
6062
6063 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6064 // Input - Interface with Platform & Renderer backends for Multi-Viewport support
6065 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6066
6067 // For reference, the second column shows which function are generally calling the Platform Functions:
6068 // N = ImGui::NewFrame() ~ beginning of the dear imgui frame: read info from platform/OS
6069 // windows (latest size/position) F = ImGui::Begin(), ImGui::EndFrame() ~ during the dear imgui frame U =
6070 // ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows() ~ after the dear imgui frame: create and update all platform/OS
6071 // windows R = ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() ~ render D = ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindows() ~
6072 // shutdown
6073 // The general idea is that NewFrame() we will read the current Platform/OS state, and UpdatePlatformWindows() will
6074 // write to it.
6075
6076 // The handlers are designed so we can mix and match two imgui_impl_xxxx files, one Platform backend and one
6077 // Renderer backend. Custom engine backends will often provide both Platform and Renderer interfaces together and so
6078 // may not need to use all functions. Platform functions are typically called _before_ their Renderer counterpart,
6079 // apart from Destroy which are called the other way.
6080
6081 // Platform Backend functions (e.g. Win32, GLFW, SDL) ------------------- Called by -----
6082 void (*Platform_CreateWindow)(
6083 ImGuiViewport *vp); // . . U . . // Create a new platform window for the given viewport
6084 void (*Platform_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . U . D //
6085 void (*Platform_ShowWindow)(
6086 ImGuiViewport *vp); // . . U . . // Newly created windows are initially hidden so SetWindowPos/Size/Title can
6087 // be called on them before showing the window
6088 void (*Platform_SetWindowPos)(
6089 ImGuiViewport *vp,
6090 ImVec2 pos); // . . U . . // Set platform window position (given the upper-left corner of client area)
6091 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . . . . //
6092 void (*Platform_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport *vp,
6093 ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Set platform window client area size (ignoring OS
6094 // decorations such as OS title bar etc.)
6095 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window client area size
6096 void (*Platform_SetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . . . . // Move window to front and set input focus
6097 bool (*Platform_GetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // . . U . . //
6098 bool (*Platform_GetWindowMinimized)(
6099 ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window minimized state. When minimized, we generally won't
6100 // attempt to get/set size and contents will be culled more easily
6101 void (*Platform_SetWindowTitle)(ImGuiViewport *vp,
6102 const char *str); // . . U . . // Set platform window title (given an UTF-8 string)
6103 void (*Platform_SetWindowAlpha)(
6104 ImGuiViewport *vp,
6105 float alpha); // . . U . . // (Optional) Setup global transparency (not per-pixel transparency)
6106 void (*Platform_UpdateWindow)(
6107 ImGuiViewport *vp); // . . U . . // (Optional) Called by UpdatePlatformWindows(). Optional hook to allow the
6108 // platform backend from doing general book-keeping every frame.
6109 void (*Platform_RenderWindow)(
6110 ImGuiViewport *vp, void *render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Main rendering (platform side! This is often
6111 // unused, or just setting a "current" context for OpenGL bindings).
6112 // 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
6113 void (*Platform_SwapBuffers)(
6114 ImGuiViewport *vp,
6115 void *render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers (platform side! This is often unused!).
6116 // 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
6117 float (*Platform_GetWindowDpiScale)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling:
6118 // Return DPI scale for this viewport. 1.0f = 96 DPI.
6119 void (*Platform_OnChangedViewport)(
6120 ImGuiViewport
6121 *vp); // . F . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Called during Begin() every time the
6122 // viewport we are outputting into changes, so backend has a chance to swap fonts to adjust style.
6123 ImVec4 (*Platform_GetWindowWorkAreaInsets)(
6124 ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . . . . // (Optional) [BETA] Get initial work area inset for the viewport (won't be
6125 // covered by main menu bar, dockspace over viewport etc.). Default to (0,0),(0,0).
6126 // 'safeAreaInsets' in iOS land, 'DisplayCutout' in Android land.
6127 int (*Platform_CreateVkSurface)(ImGuiViewport *vp, ImU64 vk_inst, const void *vk_allocators,
6128 ImU64 *out_vk_surface); // (Optional) For a Vulkan Renderer to call into Platform
6129 // code (since the surface creation needs to tie them both).
6130
6131 // Renderer Backend functions (e.g. DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan) ------------ Called by -----
6132 void (*Renderer_CreateWindow)(
6133 ImGuiViewport *vp); // . . U . . // Create swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_CreateWindow)
6134 void (*Renderer_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport *vp); // N . U . D // Destroy swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called
6135 // before Platform_DestroyWindow)
6136 void (*Renderer_SetWindowSize)(
6137 ImGuiViewport *vp,
6138 ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Resize swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_SetWindowSize)
6139 void (*Renderer_RenderWindow)(
6140 ImGuiViewport *vp,
6141 void *render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Clear framebuffer, setup render target, then render the
6142 // viewport->DrawData. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
6143 void (*Renderer_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport *vp,
6144 void *render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers. 'render_arg'
6145 // is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
6146
6147 // (Optional) Monitor list
6148 // - Updated by: app/backend. Update every frame to dynamically support changing monitor or DPI configuration.
6149 // - Used by: dear imgui to query DPI info, clamp popups/tooltips within same monitor and not have them straddle
6150 // monitors.
6151 ImVector<ImGuiPlatformMonitor> Monitors;
6152
6153 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6154 // Output - List of viewports to render into platform windows
6155 //------------------------------------------------------------------
6156
6157 // Viewports list (the list is updated by calling ImGui::EndFrame or ImGui::Render)
6158 // (in the future we will attempt to organize this feature to remove the need for a "main viewport")
6159 ImVector<ImGuiViewport *> Viewports; // Main viewports, followed by all secondary viewports.
6160};
6161
6162// (Optional) This is required when enabling multi-viewport. Represent the bounds of each connected monitor/display and
6163// their DPI. We use this information for multiple DPI support + clamping the position of popups and tooltips so they
6164// don't straddle multiple monitors.
6165struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor
6166{
6167 ImVec2 MainPos,
6168 MainSize; // Coordinates of the area displayed on this monitor (Min = upper left, Max = bottom right)
6169 ImVec2 WorkPos,
6170 WorkSize; // Coordinates without task bars / side bars / menu bars. Used to avoid positioning popups/tooltips
6171 // inside this region. If you don't have this info, please copy the value for MainPos/MainSize.
6172 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI
6173 void *PlatformHandle; // Backend dependant data (e.g. HMONITOR, GLFWmonitor*, SDL Display Index, NSScreen*)
6174 ImGuiPlatformMonitor()
6175 {
6176 MainPos = MainSize = WorkPos = WorkSize = ImVec2(0, 0);
6177 DpiScale = 1.0f;
6178 PlatformHandle = NULL;
6179 }
6180};
6181
6182// (Optional) Support for IME (Input Method Editor) via the platform_io.Platform_SetImeDataFn() function.
6183struct ImGuiPlatformImeData
6184{
6185 bool WantVisible; // A widget wants the IME to be visible
6186 ImVec2 InputPos; // Position of the input cursor
6187 float InputLineHeight; // Line height
6188
6189 ImGuiPlatformImeData()
6190 {
6191 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
6192 }
6193};
6194
6195//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6196// [SECTION] Obsolete functions and types
6197// (Will be removed! Read 'API BREAKING CHANGES' section in imgui.cpp for details)
6198// Please keep your copy of dear imgui up to date! Occasionally set '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS' in
6199// imconfig.h to stay ahead.
6200//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6201
6202#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
6203namespace ImGui
6204{

6207 const ImVec4 &tint_col,
6208 const ImVec4 &border_col); // <-- border_col was removed in favor of ImGuiCol_ImageBorder.
6209// OBSOLETED in 1.91.0 (from July 2024)
6210static inline void PushButtonRepeat(bool repeat)
6211{
6212 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, repeat);
6213}
6214static inline void PopButtonRepeat()
6215{
6216 PopItemFlag();
6217}
6218static inline void PushTabStop(bool tab_stop)
6219{
6220 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, !tab_stop);
6221}
6222static inline void PopTabStop()
6223{
6224 PopItemFlag();
6225}
6226IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetContentRegionMax(); // Content boundaries max (e.g. window boundaries including scrolling, or
6227 // current column boundaries). You should never need this. Always use
6228 // GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail()!
6229IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowContentRegionMin(); // Content boundaries min for the window (roughly (0,0)-Scroll), in
6230 // window-local coordinates. You should never need this. Always use
6231 // GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail()!
6232IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowContentRegionMax(); // Content boundaries max for the window (roughly (0,0)+Size-Scroll), in
6233 // window-local coordinates. You should never need this. Always use
6234 // GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail()!
6235// OBSOLETED in 1.90.0 (from September 2023)
6236static inline bool BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = 0)
6237{
6238 return BeginChild(id, size, ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle, window_flags);
6239}
6240static inline void EndChildFrame()
6241{
6242 EndChild();
6243}

6247// ImVec2& size_arg, bool borders, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags) { return BeginChild(id, size_arg, borders ?
6248// ImGuiChildFlags_Borders : ImGuiChildFlags_None, window_flags); } // Unnecessary as true ==
6249// ImGuiChildFlags_Borders
6250static inline void ShowStackToolWindow(bool *p_open = NULL)
6251{
6252 ShowIDStackToolWindow(p_open);
6253}

6256 int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items = -1);

6258 bool (*old_callback)(void *user_data, int idx, const char **out_text), void *user_data,
6259 int items_count, int height_in_items = -1);
6260// OBSOLETED in 1.89.7 (from June 2023)

6264{

6266}

6270}

6307// Renamed in 1.77, renamed back in 1.79. Sorry!
6308//-- OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from June 2020): Old drag/sliders functions that took a 'float power > 1.0f' argument instead of

6325// OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from June 2020) static inline bool DragFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_speed, float
6326// v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power = 1.0f) { return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4,
6327// v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); } // OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from June 2020) static inline bool SliderFloat(const

6330// June 2020) static inline bool SliderFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_min, float v_max, const char*
6331// format, float power = 1.0f) { return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, &v_min, &v_max,
6332// format, power); } // OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from June 2020) static inline bool SliderFloat3(const char* label,
6333// float v[3], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, float power = 1.0f) { return
6334// SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, &v_min, &v_max, format, power); } // OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from
6335// June 2020) static inline bool SliderFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_min, float v_max, const char*
6336// format, float power = 1.0f) { return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, &v_min, &v_max,
6337// format, power); } // OBSOLETED in 1.78 (from June 2020)
6338//-- OBSOLETED in 1.77 and before
6339// static inline bool BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id, ImGuiMouseButton mb, bool over_items) { return
6340// BeginPopupContextWindow(str_id, mb | (over_items ? 0 : ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems)); } // OBSOLETED in 1.77
6341// (from June 2020) static inline void TreeAdvanceToLabelPos() { SetCursorPosX(GetCursorPosX() +
6342// GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()); } // OBSOLETED in 1.72 (from July 2019) static inline void SetNextTreeNodeOpen(bool
6343// open, ImGuiCond cond = 0) { SetNextItemOpen(open, cond); } // OBSOLETED in 1.71 (from June
6344// 2019) static inline float GetContentRegionAvailWidth() { return GetContentRegionAvail().x; } // OBSOLETED
6345// in 1.70 (from May 2019) static inline ImDrawList* GetOverlayDrawList() { return GetForegroundDrawList(); }
6346// // OBSOLETED in 1.69 (from Mar 2019) static inline void SetScrollHere(float ratio = 0.5f) {
6347// SetScrollHereY(ratio); } // OBSOLETED in 1.66 (from Nov 2018) static inline
6348// bool IsItemDeactivatedAfterChange() { return IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(); } //
6349// OBSOLETED in 1.63 (from Aug 2018)
6350//-- OBSOLETED in 1.60 and before
6351// static inline bool IsAnyWindowFocused() { return IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow); } //
6352// OBSOLETED in 1.60 (from Apr 2018) static inline bool IsAnyWindowHovered() { return
6353// IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow); } // OBSOLETED in 1.60 (between Dec 2017 and Apr 2018)
6354// static inline void ShowTestWindow() { return ShowDemoWindow(); } // OBSOLETED in 1.53 (between
6355// Oct 2017 and Dec 2017) static inline bool IsRootWindowFocused() { return
6356// IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow); } // OBSOLETED in 1.53 (between Oct 2017 and Dec 2017)
6357// static inline bool IsRootWindowOrAnyChildFocused() { return
6358// IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootAndChildWindows); } // OBSOLETED in 1.53 (between Oct 2017 and Dec 2017)

6386//-- OBSOLETED in 1.82 (from Mars 2021): flags for AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), AddImageRounded(), PathRect()
6387// typedef ImDrawFlags ImDrawCornerFlags;
6388// enum ImDrawCornerFlags_
6389//{
6390// ImDrawCornerFlags_None = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone, // Was == 0 prior to 1.82, this is now ==
6391// ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone which is != 0 and not implicit ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft =
6392// ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft, // Was == 0x01 (1 << 0) prior to 1.82. Order matches
6393// ImDrawFlags_NoRoundCorner* flag (we exploit this internally). ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight =
6394// ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight, // Was == 0x02 (1 << 1) prior to 1.82. ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft =
6395// ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft, // Was == 0x04 (1 << 2) prior to 1.82. ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight =
6396// ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight, // Was == 0x08 (1 << 3) prior to 1.82. ImDrawCornerFlags_All =
6397// ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll, // Was == 0x0F prior to 1.82 ImDrawCornerFlags_Top =
6398// ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight, ImDrawCornerFlags_Bot = ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft |
6399// ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight, ImDrawCornerFlags_Left = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft,
6400// ImDrawCornerFlags_Right = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight,
6401//};
6402
6403// RENAMED and MERGED both ImGuiKey_ModXXX and ImGuiModFlags_XXX into ImGuiMod_XXX (from September 2022)
6404// RENAMED ImGuiKeyModFlags -> ImGuiModFlags in 1.88 (from April 2022). Exceptionally commented out ahead of
6405// obscolescence schedule to reduce confusion and because they were not meant to be used in the first place.
6406// typedef ImGuiKeyChord ImGuiModFlags; // == int. We generally use ImGuiKeyChord to mean "a ImGuiKey or-ed with
6407// any number of ImGuiMod_XXX value", so you may store mods in there. enum ImGuiModFlags_ { ImGuiModFlags_None = 0,
6408// ImGuiModFlags_Ctrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiModFlags_Shift = ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiModFlags_Alt = ImGuiMod_Alt,
6409// ImGuiModFlags_Super = ImGuiMod_Super }; typedef ImGuiKeyChord ImGuiKeyModFlags; // == int enum ImGuiKeyModFlags_ {
6410// ImGuiKeyModFlags_None = 0, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift = ImGuiMod_Shift,
6411// ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt = ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super = ImGuiMod_Super };
6412
6413#define IM_OFFSETOF(_TYPE, _MEMBER) offsetof(_TYPE, _MEMBER) // OBSOLETED IN 1.90 (now using C++11 standard version)
6414
6415#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
